Title: Enter in cell editor dismisses the wizard (1GBBRYH)
Description: Reporting this problem for Sheila Sholars at the SVL:; ; 	In the SQL Wizard; you can select a row in a table then select a cell in that row to edit it.  After editing;; 	the user should be able to press the Enter key to close the cell editor.  However; what happens is that; 	the Finish pushbutton gets the Enter key event and performs the Finish action (i.e. the wizard closes).; 	If I disable the Finish pushbutton; the cell editor gets the Enter event and all works fine; but we want;  	the Finish pushbutton enabled.; ; 	This problem is not unique to cell editors.  You can easily recreate this problem in any wizard by; 	selecting a row in a table (or a node in a tree) which listens to key events.  Pressing Enter in this case;  	while the Finish pushbutton is enabled also passes the Enter key event to the Finish pushbutton.  ; 	Even if this turns out to be a bug elsewhere; Im open to suggestions for workarounds while its being fixed.; ; ; NOTES:; ; 	RG (4/5/01 1:46:52 PM); 	Most of the time you actually want the enter key to work like this.; 	Suppose you are typing in a text field (ex. project name); you want to; 	be able to press enter and have the wizard finish right away.; ; 	RG (5/3/01 10:59:41 AM); 	If you are in a situation where you want your control to get the enter ; 	key rather than the OK button you should be able to temporarily disable the shells; 	handling of the enter key. But currently it appears this is not possible; 	given the SWT api on org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Decorations.setDefaultButton(Button); ; 	RG (5/4/01 5:08:41 PM); 	The solution is to add a traverse listener to the cell editors control and set doit to ; 	false for enter and esc thus letting the cell editor deal with these.; 	I have it working in the text cell editor. There apprears to currently be an SWT bug in CCombo; 	which is preventing me from getting it working for the combo cell editor.; 	1GD7J2T: SWT:WINNT - Not getting key events from CCombo

Title: SH: Building takes to many steps (1GBACBR)
Description: Since the global incr. build button in the toolbar is not working; 	as desired; the self-hosters always have to go back to the; 	project theyre working (i.e. select it) on and then use click on; 	the Build action in the context menu.; ; 	Depending on how long we have to wait for the finally build; 	story; we should have a shortcut.; ; 	Often I would simply like to compile the file I just changed; 	(using auto-build could do the job but since it first does ; 	a full build where the build order might not be correct I; 	cant fully trust this feature).; ; ; NOTES:; EG (3/28/01 6:15:20 PM); 	The build actions exposed to the user should be revisited; 	once the new build story is in place.; 	What we frequently do is to incrementally build; 	a single project.; ; EG (5/4/01 10:53:10 AM); 	There are different cases:; 	*	Building with auto build on is OK.; 	*	Building the workbench with auto build off has improved. There is now an action and a short cut ctrl-b.; 	*	Building a project incrementally is only possible from the pop-up menu. We are; 		frequently doing this and there should be a short cut . The Packages View and; 		the navigator have to agree on the short-cut; e.g. ctrl-shift-b; 	the navigator should agree on the short cut.

Title: Wizards: message looks like description (1GBM6UL)
Description: MA (4/3/01 6:04:40 PM); 	The error and warning messages of the wizards have now been placed on the top of the page; 	- The location is very unusual: It is placed over the description; 	- (Warning) messages do not have an icon. When displayed; there is no difference between the descriptio; 	   and the message; which is quite confusing ; NOTES:; ; MA (10.04.01 17:58:56); 	To reproduce:; 		1. Create a Java project; 		2. open the New class wizard; 		3. enter 1 as a class name -> error message is nicley visible; 		4. enter a$ as a class name -> warning message (set using setMessage)is at the exact same place as the wizard description; 			(set by setDescription); ; EG (4/18/2001 5:06:48 PM); 	agreed; wizards should support to show a warning message with a warning icon.; ; RG (5/4/01 5:18:30 PM); 	The current design is based on suggestions from usabilty in Toronto.; 	Although the location is unusual; it has the advantage of having more space than showing; 	messages and errors in the button bar.; 	I think the important issue in this pr is that messages hide descriptions and that the two appear the same.

Title: [Dialogs] SelectionDialog interface inconsistent (1GBWTFX)
Description: The SelectionDialog interface is inconsistent. The public API is array based but the protected API is List based. This is really; 	hard to program.; ; ; NOTES:; 	RG (4/9/01 11:41:38 AM); 	The fields result and initialSelections should be of type object[] ; 	(along with the return type of their accessors); 	This will be a breaking api change but the class was only made public in build 042.; ; EG (4/10/01 3:04:31 PM); 	it was public before (around 33). We are now duplicating the Workbench version of the SelectionDialog and; 	this should not be required.; ; RG (4/16/01 5:39:10 PM); 	Awaiting approval to release API change; ; jeem (5/4/01 6:37:03 PM); 	There is a minor inconsistency in the API in one method: protected void setResult(List newResult).; It really should have been protected void setResult(Object[] newResult). SelectionDialog is allowed ; to have arbitrary subclasses which may call this method; a change of method signature would be a; breaking change for these clients. Since this inconsistency is an annoyance rather than a hinderance;; making this change would likely do more harm than good.; ; RG (5/7/01 9:16:10 AM); 	The other inconsistent method is ; 		protected List getInitialSelections()getInitialSelections() ; 	It returns a list even though the API to set the initial selections takes an array; 		public void setInitialSelections(Object[] selectedElements); 	Although selection dialog will have subclasses that will be affected it only became officially public ;     in build 042 (it had the @private tag previously) so the number of people using it may be limited;    	at this point.

Title: Beefy DCR Common Superclass for ContentOutline and PropertySheet (1GBRNRX)
Description: PRODUCT VERSION:; ; Heres your beef; Kevin.  Sorry; George made me go out to lunch.; ; Eclipse 033; ; I am writing a View identical to the PropertySheet[View] and ContentOutline[View].; Both of these are PageBookViews; and much of the code is similar.; ; The part about asking the activated part for its Page Adapter could be pushed into the superclass.; Subclasses (or some configuration API) would have to specify which Adapter (a.k.a. IPage); the PageBookView is displaying.; ; TRH (4/9/2001 1:08:54 PM); 	PageBookView does not handle getDefaultPage returning null.  Is it possible to add this?  See PageBookView.setFocus();; 	it seems to be coded to check for null page.; ; TRH (4/9/2001 1:04:47 PM); 	Additional Comments:  I recently wrote a PageBookView subclass and a dafault Page subclass to go with it.; 	Page implements getControl() to return null.  Why?  This should be left abstract; forcing me to implement; 	this method.  I didnt think I needed to implement it because createControl(Composite) returns the Control.; 	Why do both getControl() and createControl(Composite) both have the same return value?  It is confusing; 	because the implementor of createControl thinks that the caller might use the returned Control; and therefore; 	he does not have to implement Page.setFocus() or Page.getControl().  Actually; very rarely is createControls; 	return value used.  I think it should be void in as many places as possible where getControl() is defined; to; 	avoid the confusion I and other might have.  Thanks.

Title: Fast view + search  (1GDJ0HW)
Description: jkca (5/10/2001 3:01:11 PM); 	jre-sdk 104a; ; If you Fast View the search window and then perform a search;; the view appears and then disappears quickly.  I would expect; the fast view to appear and remain until I tell it to hide.; ; p.s. really like the fast views!

Title: DCR: EditionSelectionDialog should support folders too (1GBYOPC)
Description: From JA (26.3.2001):; 	I would like to be able to use this for comparing/replacing folders as well as files.; 	I dont know how easy this would be to do; but can it be made to handle IStructureComparator[] as well as ITypedInput?; 	In your original email about this; I recall you were planning to do this.; ; NOTES:

Title: Project references Property Page doesnt show up in packages view (1GBYXIX)
Description: EG (4/10/01 3:11:15 PM); 	The Project References Property page should also be available on an IJavaProject.; 	The problem is that IJavaProject has an IResource but isnt one.; 	One solution is to make the ReferencePropertyPage class API and we will contribute; 	it for IJavaProject.; ; 	Another solution is to add support to the plugin.xml markup for specifying that ; 	getAdapter(IResource) should be called for an object first before going through; 	the contribution mechanism.; ; NOTES:; EG (4/18/01 5:26:05 PM); 	The solution implemented in the debugger is register the propery page; 	against both the IProject and IJavaProject:; <extension point = com.ibm.eclipse.ui.propertyPages>; 	<page; 		id = com.ibm.dt.internal.ui.LauncherPropertyPage; 		class=com.ibm.dt.internal.ui.LauncherPropertyPage; 		objectClass=com.ibm.eclipse.core.resources.IProject; 		name= %LauncherPropertyPage.name>; 	</page>; 	<page; 		id = com.ibm.dt.internal.ui.LauncherPropertyPage; 		class =com.ibm.dt.internal.ui.LauncherPropertyPage; 		objectClass=com.ibm.jdt.core.IJavaProject; 		name= %LauncherPropertyPage.name>; 	</page>; </extension>; ; 	This would be a layer breaker for the workbench and this solution; 	isnt applicable in this case. ; 	What we could do in the Java tooling is to register the ProjectReferencePage.; 	However; this would require that we refer to the internal ProjectReferencePage.; 	   	<page name=Project References;   	   id=com.ibm.eclipse.ui.propertypages.project.reference;            objectClass=com.ibm.eclipse.core.resources.IProject;            class=com.ibm.eclipse.internal.ui.dialogs.ProjectReferencePage>;    	</page>; ; 	To make this clean would require to make the ProjectReferencePage accessible; 	as API. Since we will not call any method on the ProjectReferencePage the API; 	is basically the class name.; ; EG (4/18/01 7:40:17 PM); 	Tried the above but it didnt work since the ProjectReferencePage does a ; 	hard cast on IProject without checking for the IResource adapter.; 	See the code below.; ; 	private void initialize() {; 		>>>>project= (IProject) getElement();; 		noDefaultAndApplyButton();; 		StringBuffer buf= new StringBuffer();; 		buf.append(Projects may refer to other projects in the workspace.\n);; 		buf.append(Use this page to specify what other projects are referenced\n);; 		buf.append(by project );; 		buf.append(project.getName());; 		buf.append(.);; 		setDescription(buf.toString());; ; TC (5/1/01 4:48:32 PM) - this has been changed to the following ; project = (IProject) getElement().getAdapter(IResource.class);; ; but we still need to determine what the final answer should be as this is an internal class

Title: [Contributions] Switching views updates images for all menus (1GC3CQH)
Description: - Load version 0.044 [ne] 01 of ImageDescriptor and URLImageDescriptor; which add trace statements.; - Repeatedly switch between two views (e.g. task list and properties).; - You see two print statements on the console each time:; createImage: URLImageDescriptor(eclipse:/plugin/com.ibm.jdt.ui/icons/full/ctool16/java_pers.gif); createImage: URLImageDescriptor(eclipse:/plugin/com.ibm.jdt.ui/icons/full/ctool16/java_pers.gif); ; This is the image for the Java perspectives.; WorkbenchWindow.updateActionBars() does and updateAll() on the menu manager;; which forces all menu items; even those not currently visible; to be updated;; which causes SwitchToPerspMenu to fill the menu; which loads the images each time (it doesnt cache).; ; Recommend:; 	1. WorkbenchWindow.updateActionBars() should do an update(false); not an updateAll(false).; 		- Is there any downside to this? The menus should update themselves when shown.; 	2. SwitchToPerspMenu should cache its images (tricky given API on contribution items; see ActionContributionitem).; ; NOTES:; ; NE (04/12/01 6:39:18 PM); 	Released change 1 above as WorkbenchWindow 0.044 [ne] 01.; ; NE (5/2/01 10:24:51 PM); 	Had to back out of this change because accelerators were not getting hooked properly with lazily created menus.

Title: PreferenceOpen workbench in: New window does not work for Java Debug persp. (1GC1HXH)
Description: Open Preferences page and set:; 		Open Workbench in new window.; 	Run a java program.; 	The Java debug perspective will open in the same window.; ; NOTES:; 	EJP (4/11/01 6:30:17 PM); 		Not sure if it is UI or JUI bug.; ; ; KH (8/2/2001 2:19:42 PM); 	Need to revist this to make sure that there is exactly one way to do this AND it; 	honors the user preference

Title: [UI] Popup Menu Extension produces duplicate results in static menu (1GC2RTS)
Description: Create a view with a static context menu.  ; Register it.; Add a popup menu action extension.; Run.; Open the popup: you see 1 action instance.; Open the popup: you see 2 action instances.; ; NOTES:; ; PopupMenuExtender needs to handle static case.  It should remove the contributions for; one show in the next show by using the SubMenuManager.

Title: Smoke 106: toolbar flickers when pressing arrow down in search result view (1GC2U6R)
Description: - do smoke test until search; 	- do the text search and press the arrow down button to reveal the first rest.; ; 	==> the workbenchs tool bar flickers.; ; NOTES:; DM (4/12/01 6:19:49 PM); 	The same applies to all views with toolbar buttons that interact; 	with another view. I have already reported that PR:; 		1GBZ9F5: ITPUI:WINNT - Toolbar buttons should not set focus to viewer; ; 	Related: 1GBPPFE: ITPJUI:WIN2000 - Toolbar flickers when double clicking on method in hierarchy view; ; EG (4/21/2001 5:51:05 PM); 	moving to ITPUI

Title: rebuild all just saves all editor without a warning (1GC2UI7)
Description: AK (4/12/01 5:56:34 PM); 	1. modify a java file; dont save; 	2. workbench/rebuild all; 	3. the file is saved without any interaction with the user. ; ; NOTES:; EG (4/21/2001 5:45:46 PM); 	this is a good default behaviour. I always want to build my latest code.; 	Workbench could provide a preference for this; but this is not critical.; 	Moving to ITPUI; ; CM (10/3/01 11:24:13 PM); 	See also: 1GDVNT4: ITPDUI:WIN2000 - Rebuild All does not prompt for saving

Title: Actions should have accelerator as separate property (1GCDU59)
Description: The accelerator and text of an action cannot be set independently.; ; This is problematic for global actions in the Eclipse UI; since handlers can change the text; but the workbench; should define the accelerator.  Currently handlers must re-specify the accelerator in the text.; There is also no way of getting the textual representation of the accelerator; only the SWT keycode.; ; The accelerator should be a separately settable property; with conveniences for converting from; the textual representation to the SWT keycode; and vice-versa.; ; Customers original request:; RH:; I am updating the Undo Actions label; for example; undo delete.; If I do this; it resets the accelerator.  How do I avoid resetting the acclerator?; And; In the case of Undo; when our action is actually wrapped by the real UndoAction;; is our accelerator being used; or just that of the Global UndoAction?; ; NE:; Action.setText() is used to set the accelerator as well.  Since global; action handlers simply propagate their setText() to the real action; the; accelerator (and mnemonic) are passed on (or lost if not specified by the handler).; By default; undo and redo use &Undo@Ctrl+Z and &Redo@Ctrl+Y for their text.; ; You should include both the mnemonic and the accelerator in the text; as; follows:; ; undoAction.setText(&Undo Delete@Ctrl+Z);; redoAction.setText(&Redo Delete@Ctrl+Y);; ; You might also want to set the tool tip text.; ; RH:; Why is the accelerator not a separate proprety from the label?; Anyway; we are trying to parse the old labels accelerator and restore it.; ; If I call getText; will I get the @Ctrl+Z portion; or just Undo?; ; NE:; Unfortunately; the accelerator portion is stripped when it is set; so getText() would return &Undo; not &Undo@Ctrl+Z.; There is no way of getting the accelerator for a global action.; ; Note that there is a getAccelerator() method on Action; but this returns the SWT key code; and there is no API to convert this to the textual representation.; However; getting the accelerator on your handler will not return the accelerator of the actual global action.; ; I have filed two PRs for these issues: ; 1GCDU59: JFUIF:ALL - Actions should have accelerator as separate property; 1GCDW98: ITPUI:ALL - Need way of getting accelerators for global actions; ; For now; I recommend just hard-coding @Ctrl-Z and @Ctrl-Y for your undo and redo handlers.; ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (4/18/01 10:25:33 AM); 	Should add setAccelerator(int) to IAction and Action.; 	Should change setText() to not change accelerator if not specified.; 	Should add static methods on Action:; 		int acceleratorTextToKey(String acceleratorText); 		String acceleratorKeyToText(int); ; NE (4/18/01 12:35:47 PM); 	RH proposes:; ; Action.setText(String) and Action.getText() are not symmetrical.; @ it being converted to a TAB; and & is getting lost.; ; We are implementing UndoAction.getTooltipText() to return getText(); but; then the; Tooltip has the accelerator on it.  This doesnt make any sense to me.; ; I would prefer that  text be an entirely separate property from; accelerator; (and possibly mnemonic).  getText() might return just the Text; no; accelerator.; ; It is probably too late to make this type of change; but this could be; simulated; by changing the semantics of setText().  setText() could parse the; accelerator; if present; but leave it alone if not present.; ; So; the accelerator would not be changed when calling:;      CASE 1: setText(Undo delete); ; To really set the accelerator to null; I would call:;      CASE 2: setText(Undo delete@); ; One could argue that the mnemonic should always be set with the text; so I; think having to call:;      CASE 3: setText(&Undo delete); is perfectly acceptable.; ; To be considered separately; getText() could return just the text; without; the accelerator at the end.; ActionContributionItem would have to be changed accordingly when it updates; a MenuItem.; ; NE (4/18/01 1:13:02 PM); 	Made suggested workarounds.  See: ; 		1GCE23H: JFUIF:ALL - Accelerator should not be reset if not specified in text; 		1GCE25G: JFUIF:ALL - Action.getText() should return what was set in setText(); ; NE (5/2/01 10:32:52 PM); 	Should make accelerator separate property.; 	Should have way of converting to/from printable representation.; 	However; too late to make these API changes.; 	Workaround is to have all global action handlers specify accelerator text.; 	Moved to inactive.

Title: Need way of getting accelerators for global actions (1GCDW98)
Description: Since clients can change the text of certain global actions (i.e. undo and redo); this also overwrites; the accelerator.  There is no way of getting the accelerator for a given global action; so users; must currently hard-code this knowledge.; ; See also 1GCDU59: JFUIF:ALL - Actions should have accelerator as separate property; ; NOTES:; ; KH (4/24/2001 1:49:34 PM); 	priority?; ; NE (4/24/01 1:55:07 PM); 	DCR.

Title: [Workbench] Architectural issue - using RunnableContext in forked mode (1GCEE6Y)
Description: EG (4/18/2001 5:35:51 PM); 	An IRunnableContext supports to run a runnable forked:; 		public void run(boolean fork; boolean cancelable; IRunnableWithProgress runnable) throws InvocationTargetException; InterruptedException {; 	When run in forked mode the runnable is executed in a separate ModalContext thread and the UI is blocked from input.; 	When forked is false then the operation is run in the UI thread. This means the UI isnt responsive while the runnable is; 	executing. ; ; 	Since the JFace restructuring most of the code was run with fork=false and this resulted in PRs since the UI wasnt repainting. ; 	This got addressed by turning the fork to true. However; this is no longer trivial since the code now has to; 	be aware that it isnt running in the UI thread. Notice; that in the old JFace there were some smarts in dialogs that; 	took some of this burden from the user. ; ; 	We have attempted to switch to fork=true in the Java UI. Posting dialogs from another thread is still doable with; 	a code pattern like this:; ; 	private int openDialog(final Dialog dialog) {; 		final int[] result= { Dialog.CANCEL };; 		getViewer().getControl().getDisplay().syncExec(new Runnable() {; 			public void run() {; 				result[0]= dialog.open();; 			}; 		});; 		return result[0];; 	}		 ;  ; 	However; where we hit the wall was when a long running operation tries to modify a Document.; 	JFace text is consistent with JFace and assumes it is accessed in the UI thread only.; ; 	Issues:; 	- 	there should be a huge WARNING in IRunnableContext about the consequences of ; 		using forked=true; 	- 	there needs to be recommendations for how ISVs handle forked=true; e.g. how to; 		post dialogs.; 	- 	the Document modification problem could be addressed by making the Document; 		aware that it can be accessed from a non-UI thread. However; this would be ; 		inconsistent with the rest of JFace.; 	-	without a better story for forked=true clients will fall back to forked=false which; 		results in non-responsive UI behaviour.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: error in Preferences dialog not displayed after hitting Tab (1GCGEY2)
Description: If an error is displayed in the Preferences dialog; then you hit Tab to change the ; focus to a button; the error is no longer displayed; even though the problem is ; still there.; ; *Window->Preferences; *Select Java->Runtimes->JDK1.2; *Click Browse; *Select some random invalid (i.e. does not contain a JDK) directory; *Hit OK.; *Notice the error in the banner area of the Preferences dialog; *Hit Tab (once or twice) until the Defaults button has focus ; *The error in the banner area of the dialog is not longer displayed; ; NOTES:; 	RG (5/11/01 4:38:40 PM) ; 	This is because ; 	org.eclipse.jface.preference.StringFieldEditor.getTextControl(Composite); 	sets a focus lost listener on its conctrol and calls clearError message when; 	the text contol loses focus.; 	Interestingly it does not validate until focus is lost so one gets no error; 	message even if there is one. Just after validate displays a message;; 	the message is cleared.

There are many settings I can make; font size; color; etc.; 	I only want to repaint open editors once when I change a couple of settings. Since there is no way I can batch those changes; Id have to repaint my editor; 	each time I get a property change.; ; RG (4/24/01 5:38:20 PM); 	For now you either listen for property changes or implement your own mechism in performOK(); 	Moved to inactive

Title: [Tasks] Task view filtering and extensibility proposal (1GCHVPB)
Description: There have been several requests for the task view to provide a better UI for ; filtering tasks; and to make it extensible.; ; Look and feel issues:; 	- use filter selection dialog instead of multiple toolbar buttons; 	- provide single toolbar button and popup menu item (Filter...) to ; open filter selection dialog; 	- indicate whether filters are active in title ; Extensibility issues:; 	- allow filtering based on marker type (e.g. All errors; or WSA errors); 	- allow filtering based on plugin (?); 	- allow different marker types to be shown (types other than PROBLEM ; and TASK and their subtypes) (?); 	- allow different attributes (columns) to be shown (?); ; Related look and feel issues:; 	- allow columns to be selectively shown or hidden; ; Executive summary:; =================; ; Will add a filter dialog; to replace buttons in toolbars.; Will add a single toolbar button and menu item to open filter dialog.; Filter dialog will have the following layout.  The buttons in the top half are ; all toggles.; ; 	[X] Show Tasks   [ ] Show Completed Tasks (disabled if Show Tasks is ; unchecked); 	[X] Show Errors; 	[X] Show Warnings; 	[X] Show Infos; 	[ ] Other (enables section below; and disables buttons above); 	------------; 	Show entries of type: [combo box for marker type]  (e.g. All Types; ; Problem; Task; and registered subtypes); 	Where description contains: [text box]; 	[ ] Where severity is: [combo box for severity] (disabled if checkbox ; at left is unchecked; or if non-Problem type selected); 	[ ] Where priority is: [combo box for priority] (disabled if checkbox ; at left is unchecked; or if non-Task type selected); 	[ ] Where completion status is: [combo box for completion status] ; (disabled if checkbox at left is unchecked; or if non-Task type selected); ; Prerequisites:; 	- Core must provide human-readable names for marker types.; ; Will not support:; 	- filtering based on plugin; 	- different marker types to be shown in task view; 	- different attributes (columns) to be shown ; ; To be determined:; 	- allow columns to be selectively shown or hidden; ; ; More background:; ===============; ; It is straightforward to use a filter selection dialog instead of the multiple ; toolbar buttons.; The interesting issue is how to make it extensible.; A limited way would be for the dialog to allow you to choose which marker type ; to show.; However; this doesnt provide enough granularity.  ; Currently the task view shows only PROBLEM and TASK marker types; and their ; subtypes.; Problems are divided into errors; warnings; and infos based on the value of ; their SEVERITY attribute.; So we want to filter based on different attribute settings; in addition to the ; marker type.; ; ; However; with minor improvements to what we have now; we could have a dialog ; which lets the user; - choose marker type criteria; 	- marker type chosen from all registered types; 	- conditions: equals; not equal to; is a (i.e. is subtype of); is not a; - choose 0 or more attribute criteria; 	- attribute chosen from available ones supported by selected type (+ ; inherited ones if applicable); 	- conditions: equals; not equal to; exists; does not exist; contains ; text; doesnt contain; is at most; is at least; is more than; is less than; is ; between; 	- conditions apply to all supported value types (String; Integer; or ; Boolean); 		- if we declared type of attribute in XML as either String; ; Integer; or Boolean; we could be more selective on which conditions are shown; - would still need human-readable descriptions for marker types and attributes; ; One problem with this is that; since we dont support enumeration types; ; frequently used attributes like SEVERITY and PRIORITY are integers;; and the parameter to match would have to be specified as an integer; which has ; no meaning to the user.; E.g. the user should not have to know that Error severity is equal to 2.; We could also describe the allowed values for an enumeration attribute in XML; ; but this is starting to add more semantics to the XML than we would like.; ; A more closed form solution would be:; - choose marker type criteria as above; - choose 0 or more attribute criteria; 	- attribute chosen from hardwired set (currently supported ones); 	- since theyre hardwired; we can have combo boxes for enum attributes ; (SEVERITY; PRIORITY; DONE); - the UI could be tailored to the fixed set of attributes; rather than generic; - see executive summary above for proposed layout; ; Other task view extensibility issues (not directly related to filtering):; - do we want to allow different kinds of markers to be shown; other than ; PROBLEMs and TASKs?; 	- could provide an extension point for which types are shown; 	- only registered types and their subtypes would be shown; - do we want to allow different attributes to be shown?; 	- defined by registered types and/or subtypes; ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/2/01 10:43:28 PM); 	Variation on executive summary implemented in 047.; 	Could still do more.; 	; KH (8/13/2001 1:59:42 PM); 	Pls elaborate on could still do more

Title: [UI] scrolling in editor messed up when layout of Workbench views changes (1GCI0O5)
Description: Install PDE; Run Workbench; Change perspective to Plugin Development; File-> New -> Other-> Plugin Development-> Plugin Project; Enter any name; XYZ for example; Finish; You should have a manifest editor open on plugin.xml; if not double-click ; on plugin.xml in the navigator to open it.; You will be on the Overview page; Make sure you have the Outline view; Properties view and Tasks view open as well.; The workbench is oriented as follows:; Nav		Editor			Outline; 			Properties	Tasks; ; On the Overview page; scroll over to the left and down to the bottom as far as it will go.; Close the Outline view; NOTICE: I cannot scroll to over to the left anymore; but all of contents of the page (horizontally) ; is not visible.; ; If you close all the other views (Properties; Tasks; Error Log) so that the Editor now takes ; up all that area; all of the page is not visible but I now cannot scroll up to the top of the page ; either.  ; ; ; NOTES:; 	EJP (9/21/2001 2:05:59 PM); 		Could not reproduce it.

It is currently a flat list of tasks and problems.; ; I have logged a feature request for this.; ; NE (4/26/01 10:31:13 AM) RH adds:; Java Tooling should use this for Compile Errors!; Compile errors could be grouped by Compilation Unit.; Severity of the Unit would be a simple Min( children ).; ; NE (4/26/01 10:31:27 AM) response:; I have added your comments to the feature request.; You can currently sort by resource by clicking on the Resource column ; heading.; ; NE (5/2/01 10:54:28 PM); 	Deferred.; ; KH (8/13/2001 2:07:01 PM); 	Use as input for TaskList rework.

Title: Problem when overriding Dialog.createDialogArea (1GCQBAP)
Description: If Dialog.createDialogArea(Composite parent) is overridden and a FComposite is returned nothing; 	will be visible unless the correct layout data has been set on the Composite.; ; 	This is problematic since it couples a clients implementation of createDialogArea to an implementation detail ; 	of the base class (and it shows thatControl.setLayoutData is not a good idea in the first place).; ; 	If this  behavior cannot be fixed it should be documented in the methods JavaDoc!; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] SelectionService is faulty (1GCQW3Z)
Description: I do not have a real test case for this.  I can only make one up.; ; The delete action always targets the active part.  If you activate the navigator and; then click on a file; the delete action will be enabled.  If you click onto another part; without a selection provider the delete action is disabled.  It is targetted to the; new part.; ; Now create a global action in an action set.  It should be enabled for type IFile; and; label it delete too.  If you activate the navigator and; then click on a file; the delete action will be enabled.  If you click onto another part; without a selection provider the delete action is NOT disabled; because the plugin action; does not receive notification of the new selection.  It is still targetted to the selection; in the old part.; ; NOTES:; ; DS (4/25/01 11:36:18 AM); ; The current behavior of ISelectionService as implemented in the workbench is faulty. ; ; 	- If getSelection is called when the active part does not have a selection provider getSelection ; 	returns null. ; 	- If the user activates a part with a selection provider a selectionChanged event will ; 	be fired containing the part selection.  ; 	- If the user activates a part without a selection provider a selectionChanged; 	event will not be not fired. ; ; This leads to an inconsistenty.  The return value for getSelection has changed; but no event was fired.; ; To resolve this I would like to fire a selectionChanged event whenever the active part ; changes.  If the active part is a selection provider we will pass the part selection.  If not ; we will pass null in selectionChanged.  This indicates that the selection is undefined ( the ; part may have a selection but is just not publishing it ).  In either case selection listeners are ; notified when a change of selection occurs; and listeners always know the latest value of ; getSelection.; ; jeem (5/4/01 6:22:38 PM) - API-wise;; ISelectionListener.selectionChanged(IWorkbenchPart; ISelection) already specifies that; selection may be null. I recommend adding an explanation to ISelectionService re: when; listeners will be notified.

Other apps can do it.

Title: (Examples) Users of InputDialog should check if the operation was canceled. (1GCSM38)
Description: The user of InputDialog should check ; 		if(dialog.getReturnValue() == dialog.CANCEL); 	and cancel the action.; ; 	Here is a list of senders in the UI examples that are not doing it.; 		createNewFile() :: StructuralChangeExample; 		editPerson(Person) :: RenamePersonAction; 		editPerson(Person) :: RenamePersonAction; 		renameFile() :: StructuralChangeExample; 		renameFirstName() :: ChangeEventExample; ; NOTES:; ; 	RG (4/12/01 5:38:18 PM); 		Open returns the return value so you can do; 		if (dialog.open() == dialog.CANCEL) ; ; 	EJP (4/26/01 9:48:51 AM); 		Creating a copy of this PR.; 		Moving one to Active TextEditors and other to Active examples.

Title: Workbench Title is Not Meaningful (1GCSQB5)
Description: The title of the workbench has the format Perspective - Eclipse Workbench.  ; The ; perspective name defines how Im looking at information; but not what.  In ; my ; mind what is just as or more important than how (justification below).  ; Hence; I think; the window title should be ProductName - Input : Perspective; or something ; similar.  ; ; Justification:; ; 1. Start the workbench with the default perspective. Youre looking at the ; workspace; ; 	or everything with the Resource Perspective.  The title ; says Resource - Eclipse Workbench.  ; 2. Create two projects in the navigator.  ; 3. Select one and invoke Open in New Window | Resource.  A new window will ; open; 	on the selected project.  This is an important feature; because it ; allows scoping and ; 	increases the scalability of the project.  The title of the new window ; is Resource - ; 	Eclipse Workbench.  ; 4. Go back to the first window.; 5. Select the second project.  Invoke  Open in New Window | Resource.  A new ; window; 	will open.  ; ; Now you have 3 windows which all have the same caption; but clearly they ; present different ; information.  The titles are useless.  This problem also occurs when you create ; 3 pages; within a single window.; ; To resolve this I think the titles should be ..; ; Workspace ( or some other term; maybe All; or * ) : Resource Perspective; Project 1: Resource Perspective; Project 2: Resource Perspective; ; NOTES:; EG (5/1/2001 9:18:54 AM); 	I would also like to see the input element in the title.; 	When changing the title format keep in mind that the most ; distinguishing information; 	is in the front this allows you to distinguish the windows in the short ; cut bar.; 	Having all windows start with Product name would make them only ; distinguishable by; 	the icon. The last proposal makes more sense to me.
