Title: Need destinctive perspective icons (1GD00EQ)
Description: The icons for perspectives need to be distinctive so that they can be easily; distinguished on the perspective bar.; ; The icons for the defualt and java perspectives look too much alike and some; perspectives (debug for example) are not yet supplying their own icon which; makes hover help the only way to tell them apart.; ; Consider; 1) Making an icon required rather than optional in the extension point; 2) Since the api is frozen consider using a different icon from the ; one used for the Resource perspective for perspectives which; do not supply an icon.; ; NOTES:

Title: IDE Crashes if non existant files deleted. (1GD0KG9)
Description: 1. Create new file with long file name ..; 12345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890.txt; Result: Editor cannot find.; 2. Create another file with long file name.; Result: Editor cannot find.; 3. Now select both of the unfindable files.; 4. Invoke Delete from the popup menu.; Result: The VAJava IDE Disappears.; ; NOTES:; ; SA (5/7/2001 3:31:12 PM); 	This is related to the problem 1GD0JXR: ITPUI:WIN98 - Cannot open file with filename > about 220 chars; 	which Core is currently working on.

Title: Shortcut replace perspective does nothing? (1GD04BD)
Description: Pressing on the replace perspective shortcut button does nothing; 	when Resources perspective is active. Is that the correct behavior?; 	If so; shouldnt it be disabled?; ; 	If I switch to another perspective; and then hit this button; it; 	switches back to the Resources perspective.; ; 	I guess the tool tip is not very helpful. I do not understand what; 	this button is for. Is it to switch to the default perspective? Is so; 	it should say so (Replace current perspective (Help) with default one (Resources)); ; NOTES:

Title: Tool tip for some shortcut buttons too vague (1GD04L8)
Description: The three shortcut buttons Open In Same Window;  Open In New Window;; 	and Replace Perspective are too vague in what they do. For Replace; 	Perspective see PR 1GD04BD.; ; 	Maybe something like Open current perspective (Resource) in a new page; 	and Open current perspective (Resource) in new window?; ; NOTES:

Title: Replace With button is confusing (1GD05PC)
Description: If you press the Open New Window; Open in Current Window; or Replace; With buttons in the shortcut bar a new perspective is created with the default; perspective.  However; there is no indication of default perspective in the RMB menu; or that the default perspective will be used if the action is selected.  This; makes it unclear as to what will happen if the buttons are pressed.  ; ; Suggestion: Show the default perspective at the top of the menu and display it; in bold.; ; NOTES:; ; KH (8/13/2001 3:37:24 PM); 	Usability suggestion

Title: Current perspective is not clearly defined in menus (1GD05X3)
Description: 1. Open a new page with the resource perspective.; 2. Delete every view but the navigator.; 3. Invoke Save Perspective As and save the current layout as Nav Only.; 4. Now open the Perspective | Replace With menu.  Notice that the current; perspective is not visible within the menu.; ; Suggestion: Add the current perspective to the bottom of the menu if it; is not normally there.  ; ; NOTES:

Title: Icon for .doc file does not correspond to Windows choice (1GD067J)
Description: - create a .doc file; - in the Navigator; it shows the regular .txt file icon; ; 	- although it has a gray background; not transparent; 	- in the editor bar; when inactive; it differs slightly from the inactive icon for .txt files; ; - if I create a .doc file from Windows Explorer; it uses the icon for WordPad (I dont have Office installed);; which is quite different (it has the red A in the bottom right corner).; ; NOTES:; ; NE (04/30/01 11:51:12 AM); 	Creating .bmp file gave it the right icon.; ; TC (5/1/01 4:25:12 PM) - SWT issue - see; 	1GD2DEY: SWT:WIN2000 - Icon lookup fails for some windows icon paths

Title: [Import/Export] File type selection on importing is too poor. (1GD068I)
Description: 1) Create a project; 	2) Import from File System; 	3) Select Files of type; 	4) Click Edit; ; 	You will be able to specify what kind on file you want to import but; 	you cant do much more then that.; ; 	PS: When you start using a new IDE the fisrt; importing is the first thing; 	that is done. We should work more on that.; ; 	-> I would like to specify things like *.* except *.class; 	-> Or in the details Dialog be able to say Deselect all *.class.; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR: Allow reordering in fast view bar (1GD08EG)
Description: Clients may want to rearrange the order of their docked views in the fast view bar.; Drag and drop would be ideal here.; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR: Fast view should allow switching to regular view (1GD08HU)
Description: It should be possible to switch a docked view back to being a regular view; without having to move the mouse to the; fast views pushpin.; E.g.:; 	- double clicking fast view icon; and; 	- pop-up menu with Switch to Regular View; ; NOTES:

Title: Ending up with to many editors opened. (1GD08J2)
Description: We should have a option to have one editor opened and keep changing its; 	contents as the selection is changed in the navigator.; ; 	If the file is dirty we should give the user the option to save or not;; 	cancel and the option to open a new editor.; ; NOTES:

Title: Drill down viewer should support placing buttons in toolbar (1GD09DS)
Description: The drill down viewer; used in the Java package view and the ; debuggers variables view; should provide a way for clients to; have its buttons show up in the views toolbar rather than having; its own toolbar.; ; NOTES:

Title: Fast View action should have verb name (1GD0A5E)
Description: The Fast View action on views title bar pop-up menu should have a verb name;; e.g. Switch to Fast View or Dock.; ; See also 1GD08HU: ITPUI:WIN2000 - DCR: Fast view should allow switching to regular view; This should have a verb name too; e.g. Switch to Normal View or Undock.; ; I dont recommend Switch to Slow View <g>.; ; NOTES:

Title: Variable location of toolbar button (1GD0A6A)
Description: Open the java perspective; Open a .java file by doiulbe clicking it in the packages view; Note that the Show source of selected element only button is just ot the right of the run button.; Now select Java>open type; Pick a type and press ok; Note that the Show source of selected element only button is at the end of the toolbar; ; This is very confusing.; ; NOTES:

Title: Incorrect behavior with close all perspective & dirty editor (1GD0B8M)
Description: Open two perspectives. In one perspective open a file and modify it.; 	Switch to the other perspective. Select Perspective->Close All from; 	the menu. The current perspective is closed; then you get a dialog; 	box asking whether to save the modified file. If I press cancel;; 	the file is not save and the perspective remains open; yet the; 	other perspective is closed already.; ; 	We should check for open dirty editors before closing any; 	perspectives; so the user can hit cancel. Or remove the; 	cancel button.; ; NOTES:; ; DS (5/9/01 9:15:58 AM); 	In this scenario no loss of work occurs.  It is also consistent with our algorithm; 	for closing windows: a dialog appears for each in turn as they are closed.; ; DS (5/11/01 10:11:10 AM); 	In progress.  See:; 		SaveAllOperation 0.1005 [ds] 01; ; EJP (10/2/2001 2:22:26 PM); 	I have started fixing this but I ended up with the following problems:; 		i) There are few different scenarios:; 				Closing a page.; 				Closing a window or closing all pages in a window.; 				Closing the workbench.; 		ii) Editors may or may not make sure the content is in sync when editing the ; 		same input in different editors.; 	; 	a) When closing a single editor or a page; editors with the same input may be; 	opened in another page. Whether  it should be saved depends on isSaveOnCloseNeeded().; 	b) When closing a window; editors with the same input may be open in another page; 	in the same window (it would be closed as well) or is a different window.; 	c) When closing the workbench; editors with contents not in sync may be opened; 	and the user should be told and decide what to do.; 	; 	We could fix a) and b) but we need API in IEditorPart to implement c).

Title: SelectPerspective dialog should support double click (1GD0BT5)
Description: Choose Perspective->Replace With; ; 	The dialog with the list of perspectives should have a perspective selected ; 			; 		AND; ; 	Double clicking an item in the list should dismiss the dialog. ; ; NOTES:

Title: [GlobalActions] DCR - Undo should specify what it will be doing (1GD0C4M)
Description: When selecting the Edit->Undo menu; there is no visual; 	cue as what will be undone. In MS Word; you get things; 	like Undo Typing or Unto AutoCorrect etc.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Perspectives] Closing help view should go back to previous perspective (1GD0CUY)
Description: - activate Navigator view; - hit F1; - choose one of the items; - the Help view opens in the Help perspective; - close the Help view; - youre left with a blank perspective; ; This is very confusing.  In order to get back to the regular perspective; you have to; choose Perspective / Close.; ; Closing the Help view should put you back where you were when you hit F1.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (04/30/01 2:15:07 PM); 	It may make sense to generalize this: if last view closed; close perspective.

Title: [GlobalActions] Diff not obvious between Search & Find/Replace (1GD0DBP)
Description: From looking at the Edit menu; it is not obvious; 	why there is a Find/Replace and a Search item.; 	Search seems to apply to all resources; not just; 	the editor with focus. Maybe this item would be; 	better in the File menu?; ; NOTES:

Title: Some windows dont fit screen (1GD0EPV)
Description: jkca (4/30/2001 1:53:06 PM); 	jre-motif-sdk 101; ; The New Class Wizard does not size correctly under linux; neither; does the preferences page.  Both are too big.

Title: Directory selection dialog does not show full path (1GD0F47)
Description: Open the directory selection dialog (for example; from the file Import; 	Wizard; click browse to specify a directory).; ; 	Notice as you select sub directories; only the last part of the directory; 	is shown instead of the full path (e.g. docs instead of d:\eclipse\docs); ; NOTES:

Title: Missing icons for Show View->Others dialog? (1GD0GBJ)
Description: Select Perspective->Show View->Others; ; 	You get a dialog with a tree view. There is no icon; 	next to the top level category names. Notice also; 	the spacing between the + and the label; ; 	Now expand the Basic category. Notice all the top; 	level labels have moved to the right...like making room; 	for an icon which they do not have.; ; 	If there is no icons for these top level labels; maybe; 	we should have two lists (like the main New Wizard; 	page - categories on left side; and wizards for selected; 	category on the right side)?; NOTES:

Title: Cant tell which detach wnd belong to which workbench wnd (1GD0HSK)
Description: Start the workbench and drag views into detach windows. Now open;; 	a new workbench window (Perspective->Open in New Window). Drag some; 	views into detach windows.; ; 	Now flip between the two workbench windows - you cant tell which; 	detach windows belong to which workbench window.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 4:24:34 PM); 	Minimizing one will minimize its associated detached views.

Title: Detach window usuability suggestions (1GD0HYI)
Description: Please see also PRs:; 		1GD0HSK: ITPUI:ALL - Cant tell which detach wnd belong to which workbench wnd; 		1GD0HC8: ITPUI:ALL - DCR - Allow minimize of detach window; ; 	To me; these detach window seem like palettes (if this was a graphics editor). A few; 	years ago; I remember using one such product on the Mac which implemented its palette; 	in a very helpful way - and it was done that the user did not even notice (the way a ui should; 	be...not interfere with what the user is doing); ; 	Right now; the detach window always float above the workbench window. This means; 	you are always shuffling windows around. Here is how this graphics package handled; 	this case. When you were working with the palette; it was above the editor. Once your; 	mouse left (or it may have required you click on the editor again); the palette would; 	move below the editor (in the Z-order that is). When the mouse entered the palette; 	and hovered for a specific amount of time at the same place; the palette came to the; 	top...without the user clicking on it.; ; 	Maybe we could do something along these lines for our detach windows?; ; NOTES:

Title: Property sheet updates even if in a fast view (1GD0IUX)
Description: Not sure how possible this is to implement; but it would be nice if the property sheet didnt update; when in a fast view.  It could instead update based on the selection when made visible.; The VCM property sheet requires server round trips; so it would nice to avoid them when not; needed.; ; NOTES:

Title: 5 line file takes 7 seconds to open (1GD0KY4)
Description: 1. Create a java project.; 2. Expand the project.; 3. Select .classpath.; 4. Invoke Open With Default Text Editor.; Result: It takes about 7 seconds for the editor to open.; 5. Close the editor.; 6. Repeat step 4.; Result: Another 7 seconds; and so on.; ; This is way; way too slow for good productivity.  ; ; NOTES:; ; SA (7/12/2001 2:11:57 PM); 	The first time I opened the default editor; it took several seconds. This is due; 	to class loading according to optimizeIt. However; if I close the editor and; 	open the file again; it opens very quickly. So I could not reproduce step 5 and 6; 	above on windows 98.

Title: [JFace] Preferences not saved immediately (1GD0LWZ)
Description: - start Eclipse; - choose Window / Preferences; - turn the Welcome Dialog setting off (Ill assume it was on before); - kill Eclipse process from shell; - start it again; - the Welcome Dialog still comes up; ; This probably applies to all dialog settings.; ; The settings should be saved immediately; since they count as user input; which would be lost in the event of a crash.; ; ; NOTES:; 	RG (5/1/01 3:52:04 PM); 	Im certain this functionality was added for the Tech Preview so somewhere along the line it has gotten lost.; 	It is not enough for the preferece dialog to save its store since each of the individual pages may have their; 	own store.; 	I believe the dialog used to get the strore from the pages and do a if (needsSaving) save call.; 	We can no longer do this because the dialog deals with IPreferencePages not PreferencePages.; 	The best solution would be to add a saveStore method to IPreferencePage.; 	In addition we need to add a save method to IPreferenceStore (it already has needsSaving).; 	Although these are breaking API changes I suspect no one will actually be affected since; 	we will implement the methods in PreferencePage and PreferenceStrore and I suspect; 	everyone is using these implementations.; ; 	Proposed fix (not released) in:; 	PreferenceStore :: org.eclipse.jface.preference 0.101 [rg] 01; 	PreferencePage :: org.eclipse.jface.preference 0.101 [rg] 01; 	PreferenceDialog :: org.eclipse.jface.preference 0.101 [rg] 01; 	IPreferenceStore :: org.eclipse.jface.preference 0.101 [rg] 01; 	IPreferencePage :: org.eclipse.jface.preference 0.101 [rg] 01; ; RG (5/4/2001 6:04:26 PM); 	Transferred these class versions to the new repository; ; jeem (5/4/01 7:53:35 PM); The minimal breaking API changes would be to; 	- clients who implement IPreferencePage directly; 	- clients who implement IPreferenceStore directly; This is possible; although it seems more likely that clients are subclassing; the standard implementation PreferencePage and PreferenceStore.; Since the problem is severe enough; the change should proceed and; document as a breaking API change.; ; A client that is currently reimplementing PreferenceDialog.handleSave(); to save the preferences (as recommended in old javadoc comment) would; not be calling the new method implementation. If all clients should only; extend but not reimplement this method; this would be an additional; breaking API change and should be documented as such. If; on the other hand; ; its fine for a client to reimplement; then this is not a breaking API change.; ; jeem (5/4/01 7:48:45 PM) - Specific comments on version 0.101 [rg] 01; - Comment for PreferencePage.saveStore() should be non-javadoc and; 	refer to IPreferencePage.; - Javadoc comment for PreferenceDialog.handleSave() should either; (a) allow subclasses to override as before; or (b) allow subclasses to; extend only.

Title: [Navigator] Cannot open file unless navigator is visible (1GD0MFF)
Description: If I close the navigator there is no way to open a file.  I would like a File Open action where; I can select a file using wildcards and open it.  The default editor is an acceptable editor; for this case; but a combo box could also be added so I can select the editor.; ; NOTES:

Title: Cannot drag editor area (1GD0MLZ)
Description: If the editor area is empty you cannot drag it.  This is unfortunate; because if I; want to move the editor area I need to move all of the views instead.  An O(1) operation; becomes an O(n) operation.; ; NOTES:; ; SA (5/17/2001 9:03:16 AM); 	Adding this feature is fairly easy (it seems). However; it does not address the; 	issue of dragging the editor area when one or more editors is opened. We need; 	to come up with a proper solution for both instead of just implementing half a; 	solution.

Title: shortcut key for zoom? (1GD0N0I)
Description: is there a shortcut key for zooming views?  It would be really nice (Ctrl-M in VA/Java).; There should also be actions somewhere (Window menu?); ; NOTES:

Title: Annoying auto-expand when editor is closed (1GD1Z1V)
Description: I find it annoying that when you close an editor; it automatically expands; the navigator to reveal and select the file for the next open editor.  Closing; one editor does not necessarily mean I want to immediately start working; in another one.  It interrupts workflow because the navigator suddenly jumps; to another spot and you lose the context you were working in.; ; This is particularly annoying when doing comparisons and catchup/releases;; which use editors.  Every time I finish releasing; the navigator jumps to some; random file that I happen to have an editor open for.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Side effects when hitting Tab key in new file/folder wizards (1GD1ZGM)
Description: Create a project if you do not already have one. Make sure; 	you do not have a project or folder selected.; 	Open the new file or folder wizard. Click in the container field and; 	type in a new project name. Now hit tab twice to place the focus; 	in the file/folder name field. Look at the container field name...; 	it was changed.; ; 	That is because hitting tab from the container field passes focus; 	to the container selection tree below it. When it gets focus; the first; 	item in the tree is selected; causing the container field name to ; 	change.; ; 	This is not the behavior I was expecting (not to mention I could not; 	find the file I created afterwards because it had gone in the wrong; 	project).; ; 	Maybe the container selection tree should not be there. It should; 	only be available when the user clicks a Browse button?; ; NOTES:; ; TC (5/2/01 10:39:24 AM) - this is due to the Tree firing a selection event on tab focus ; ; see 1GD3S6M: SWT:WINNT - Setting focus on a Tree via a tab fires a selection event; ; TC (5/10/01 8:58:25 AM) - deferred pending changes to SWT

Title: Cant see or switch to other open perspectives (1GD2ABN)
Description: The current Perspective menu options allow you to open new perspectives in the same window; and close them;; but there is no way of switching between them; or even seeing which ones are open.; ; Either we should just support one open perspective; with the old one persisting its state when closed;; or we should make the fact that there are multiple open ones more visible and easier to work with.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Viewers] StructuredViewer#setSelection(ISelection; boolean) (1GD2ACL)
Description: DS (5/1/01 2:14:44 PM); 	StructuredViewer#setSelection(ISelection; boolean) comment claims to not do call updateSelection(ISelection); 	if the selection is the same as the current selection.; 	Appears to not be true from reviewing the code and from the selection changed callbacks that are occurring.; 	Comment out of date or implementation oversight?; ; NE (5/2/01 11:14:35 PM); 	Some code is relying on this to update viewer selection and notify listeners when table selection is tweaked;; 	by doing v.setSelection(v.getSelection()).; 	Should find better way of doing this; and make this match the spec.; 	Is this causing problems elsewhere?; ; DS (5/3/2001 3:05:12 PM); 	We have overridden the method so that we are not doing spurious updating on selection; 	of the same selection.  A fix would just remove the need for our code.; ; NE (5/3/01 4:16:10 PM); 	Im curious as to the use case that was causing problems.  ; 	Who sends setSelection often enough with the same selection to make it worth filtering out duplicates?; ; NE (5/3/01 4:57:43 PM); 	DS replies:; Rapidly stepping in the same stack frame. ; The thread is started and stopped and we ensure that the top stack frame is selected and revealed.

Title: [Properties view] PropertySheet - Keyboard Navigation Problems (1GD2AG4)
Description: 1)	Keyboard navigation causes boolean values to change state (booleans dont have a real cell editor); 2) You cant navigate away from an active combo box; 3) You cant dismiss a cell editor with escape; ; NOTES:; 	RG (5/3/01 12:08:37 PM); 	1) This is a feature of CheckBoxCell editor. It should not be used in the; 	property sheet since one can use a combo instead. (It is needed in the tasklist); 	We removed the property descriptor for this editor to discourage its use.; ; 	2) We could use the up/down arrrows but I think we will lose the key press that allows you to leave.; 	Thus you would have to press twice to go to the next item.; ; 	3) This is being fixed; 	1G607PZ: ITPUI:ALL - Esc does not disable PropertySheet Text Cell Editor.; ; 	RG (5/7/01 3:19:20 PM); 	Idea 2) above is not valid since we need the up/down arrow keys to navigate the combo list.; ; 	RG (5/7/01 7:17:53 PM); 	Actually the fix for three will allow you to navigate away by pressing escape.; ; 	RG (5/31/01 6:08:30 PM); 	Now waiting on 1GEM261: SWT:ALL - CCombo still has focus when invisible

Title: [View Mgmt] views with undeclared category attribute are tossed (1GD41DV)
Description: Nothing happens if the category attribute mentions an undeclared category in; the <view> contributed to the org.eclipse.ui.views extension point.; ; Steps to reproduce:; ; 0. Create a plug-in that contributes a view to the  org.eclipse.ui.views extension point; and mentions the name of an undeclared category in the category attribute on the <view> element.; (See attached plugin.xml and .java source file.); ; 1. Start eclipse; 2. Perspective -> Show View -> Other; 3. Expand the all of the categories.; ; Observe: The new view does not show up any where.; ; Expectation: If the category is undeclared; I would expect (a) the view to show up ; in the place it would had I omitted the category attribute entirely; and perhaps (b); a helpful entry written to the platform log.; ; 4. Exit the workbench; ; Observe: No log entry.; Expectation: ; ; =contents of plugin.xml=========================; <plugin;   name=Hello World View;   id=com.example.jeem.hello;   version=1.0;   provider-name=Jeem>; ;   <requires>;     <import plugin=org.eclipse.ui/>;   </requires>; ;   <runtime>;     <library name=hello.zip/>;   </runtime>; ;   <extension; 	point=org.eclipse.ui.views>; 	<view;        		id=com.example.jeem.hwViewId; 		category=com.example.jeem.hwViewCat; 		name=Hello World View	; 		class=com.example.jeem.HelloWorld>; 	</view>;   </extension>; ; </plugin>; ; =contents of /com/example/jeem/HelloWorld.java=========================; package com.example.jeem;; ; import org.eclipse.ui.part.ViewPart;; import org.eclipse.swt.SWT;; import org.eclipse.swt.widgets.*;; ; public class HelloWorld extends ViewPart{; 	; 	Label fLabel;; 	; 	public void createPartControl(Composite parent) {; 		fLabel = new Label(parent; SWT.NONE);; 		fLabel.setText(Hello world);; 	}; 	; 	public void setFocus() {; 		fLabel.setFocus();; 	}; }; ; =.log excerpt==========================================; ; Log: Wed May 02 13:53:44 EDT 2001; 2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 1 Problems encountered loading the plug-in registry.; 	1=============<children>=============; 	2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 1 No plugin found for: file:/D:/eclipse102-jdk/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.boot/plugin.xml; 	2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 1 No plugin found for: file:/D:/eclipse102-jdk/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jface.examples/plugin.xml; 	2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 1 No plugin found for: file:/D:/eclipse102-jdk/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.scripting.examples/plugin.xml; 	2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 1 No plugin found for: file:/D:/eclipse102-jdk/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.scripting.examples.adapter.development/plugin.xml; 	2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 1 No plugin found for: file:/D:/eclipse102-jdk/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.examples/plugin.xml; 	2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 1 No plugin found for: file:/D:/eclipse102-jdk/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.vcm.core.webdav/plugin.xml; 	2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 1 Unknown extension point org.eclipse.ui.editorsActions specified in plug-in org.eclipse.ui.examples.readmetool.; 	2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 1 Unknown extension point com.ibm.eclipse.core.help.contribution specified in plug-in org.eclipse.ui.examples.readmetool.; 	2 org.eclipse.core.runtime 1 Unknown extension point org.eclipse.ui.makerImageProvider specified in plug-in org.eclipse.debug.ui.; 	1=============</children>=============; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Workbench Layout Smoke Tests (1GD466Y)
Description: This is a test list for layout in the workbench.; ; Folder Creation ..; 	- DnD view over view; 	- DnD view over folder; 	- DnD view over view in floating window; 	- NEG TEST - DnD view over editor area. ; 	- DnD editor over editor; 	- DnD editor over editor folder; 	- NEG TEST - DnD editor over view area.  ; ; Folder Breakdown ..; 	- DnD view out of folder with 2; 	- DnD view out of folder with 3.  Folder should remain.; 	- DnD view out of folder in floating window; 	- DnD editor out of editor folder with 2; 	- DnD editor out of editor folder with 3.  Folder should remain; ; Relative Drag and Drop ..; 	- DnD view to top; right; bottom; left of another view; 	- DnD view to top; right; bottom; left of folder; 	- DnD view to top; right; bottom; left of editor area. ; 	- DnD editor within editor area; ; Detached Windows ..; 	- DnD view out of window; open detached window; 	- DnD view back into window; close detached window; 	- DnD second view over floating window ; 	- DnD second view out of floating window to create second detached window; 	- DnD second view out of floating window onto main.  ; ; Tab Items; 	- reorder items in view folder by dragging tabs; 	- reorder itmes in editor folder by dragging tabs; ; Fast Views; 	- DnD view over shortcut bar.  It should become fast view; 	- Open fast view.  Unpin.  It should return to last position in root layout.; ; Page Switch; 	- Verify layout persistance of main window when switching pages; 	- Verify layout persistance of detached windows when switching pages; ; Zoom; 	- zoom / unzoom view in root layout; 	- zoom / unzoom view in folder.  Verify folder not visible; 	- zoom / unzoom editor in single folder.  Verify no other editors visible; 	- zoom / unzoom editor in mult-folder editor area.  Verify no other editors visible; 	- NEG TEST - zoom / unzoom view in detached window.  Should have no effect; ; The following actions should maintain zoom; 	- Show View ( if it is zoomed View ); 	- Show View ( if view is visible in Detached Window ); 	- switch to another page and back; 	- click on any visible view or editor; 	- Show / hide fast view; ; The following actions should cause unzoom; 	- Open editor; 	- Close editor; 	- Close all editors; 	- Show / Hide editor area; 	- Show view / editor which is not visible; 	- Activate view / editor which is not visible; 	- Reset perspective; 	- Save perspective; 	- Change perspective; 	- DnD zoom view out of main window to detached window; 	- DnD view in detached window onto zoom view; ; The following actions cause unzoom now; but it would be convenient if they didnt in future; 	- Close detached view.; 	- All DnD; ; Persistance Between Sessions; 	- ensure layout is persisted between sessions; 	- fast views; 	- view layout; 	- detached windows; 	- open editors; ; Placeholders; 	- Drag view to new position; close; reopen.; 	- Drag view to folder; close; reopen.; 	- Drag view to detached; close; reopen.; 	- Close all views in folder; reopen one by one.; 	- Make view fast; restore.; 	- Make folder fast; restore views one by one.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Markers] Marker View should remember top item (1GD5MM6)
Description: When the task list is restored; it doesnt remember which items were visible.; It should remember the top item (which it can get from the Table widget);; and set it back after restoring the contents and selection.; ; NOTES:; 	EJP (5/7/01 3:23:32 PM); 		It is saving the position (selection) of the horizontal and vertical scrollbars.; 		The navigator is working but the tasklist does not.; 		Task list works on Linux.; ; 		- Moving to SWT.; ; 	McQ (09/05/2001 3:16:33 PM) -; 		We do not support positioning the table via programatically changing; 		the position of the scrollbar. The application code should be using; 		getTopIndex/setTopIndex.; ; 	EJP (5/10/01 10:29:02 AM); 		- There is nothing in the API specifying how it is supposed to work.; 		- It works for tree why shouldnt it work for table?; 		- There is no API to get the topindex on a tree.; 		** I am still using it for tree and I changed the code on table to use the top index.; 		- Either; we need the schroll bar working or a getTopIndex for the tree.

Title: Too hard to find Repository Viewer (1GD5XD0)
Description: (for usability discussion); ; In order to get the Repository Viewer; you have to; 	Perspective->Show View->Other;; 	in chooser pick Managing;; 	expand it to see Repositories.; ; I think people will have a hard time finding it.  Since we dont have a perspective we are second class.; ; As a result its also not clear to me how to get people started off in an easy way.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] ESC closes the Navigator. (1GD5XD8)
Description: Move the Navigator to a new detached window.; 	Select a file.; 	Press ESC.; ; 	The window closes but nothing should happen. ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/22/01 4:11:18 PM); 	On ESC; SWT gets an WM_KEYFIRST message; which gets processed by Display.translateTraversal;; 	which ends up calling traverseEscape() on the focus control (the navigators Tree in this case).; 	Its default behaviour is to close the controls shell; unless the shell has no parent.; ; 	Cant hook a traversal listener since we the focus control is arbitrary.; ; 	Could create it without a parent in DetachedWindows constructor; but then the detached window; 	would act as a separate window; not a child of the workbench window.; 	E.g. it would not minimize when the workbench window is minimized.; ; NE (5/24/01 2:24:56 PM); 	Filed 1GE8RXW: SWT:WIN98 - Need a way for child shells to disable ESC closing; 	This would be a good candidate for an SWT patch.

Title: [ActionSets] Should have for views as well (1GHW7P7)
Description: It would be good to allow a view; or contributors to it; to group actions into sets;; and allow the user to choose which sets are visible.; ; For example; the debuggers inspector view allows the various languages to contribute; buttons for filtering (e.g. Java contributes a hide/show final action).; If multiple languages do this; then this clutters the view toolbar; but the user typically; only works on a single language at a time.; See 1GGNR38: ITPDUI:ALL - Questions dealing with UI; ; Also; this might help control WSAs toolbar situation (currently 64 actions contributed to toolbar).; ; ; NOTES:

Title: [Tasks] Need task view filter on/off (1GDO676)
Description: I have the task filtering set up to show only certain types of ; 	tasks on the currently selected resource and its children. But; 	sometimes I would like to see all tasks in the workspace.; ; 	It would be convenient to have a button which turns filtering; 	on/off. This would save me from having to go into the filtering; 	and changing all the options every time I wanted to see all taks.; ; NOTES:

Title: Problems with new folder wizard (1GD7FNI)
Description: Select a project; Open the new folder wizard; ; 1) Note that above the container name it says Enter or select the folder.; I think this should be container not folder.; 2) The wizard should open with the focus in the folder name field; 3) Consider putting the folder name before container selection.; Entering the folder name is the main purpose of the wizard.; ; ; NOTES:; 	RG (5/4/01 11:20:42 AM); 	Similar problems in the file wizard

Title: Import: Select Type does not select anything  (1GGYV3Z)
Description: id  RATLC00009823     Priority: 2; Headline:  Import: Select Type does not select anything ;   ;  Description:  In the import wizard; the Select Type button does not select anything. ; ; STEPS TO REPLICATE: ; - select File->Import ; - select File System for import source and press Next ; - enter a directory with subfolders and files (eg. WINNT) ; - press Select Types ; - in the Select Types dialog; press Select All and press OK ; ; Result: ; - Nothing was selected in main wizard ; ; Expected result ; - All the files with the file extensions in Select Types should be selected. ; ;  NOTE: Select Types only filters the selected files if all the files were already selected.; ; NOTES:; ARCH (7/18/01 7:04:25 PM); 	Investigate for 1.0.; 	Fix only if trivial.; ; TC (7/23/01 3:43:06 PM) - this was a design decision for import. Select types is a filter on the ; existing selections and will not query files that are not selected for efficiency reasons.; ; TC (7/24/01 9:50:43 AM) - I think a rename of the button for the import dialog like Filter Types; would be less confusing; ; NE (08/09/01 12:02:28 PM); 	A better solution is to make Select Types actually select the chosen types.; 	Since this may lead to significant work by the UI; it should use a cancelable progress monitor; 	(also for Select All case; or even checking individual items).; 	Renaming the button for 1.0 is not very tasty; since the UI would likely change back for 2.0;; 	with progress monitoring and cancelation added.; 	Should just document the problem in README.

Title: Project -> Build and Project -> Build All are confusing (1GD7KU3)
Description: The menu entry Project and its options; combined with the pop-up menu on a project;; are confusing.; 	First; both have the options Build and Rebuild All.; 	I would guess that the menu entry Project afects all projects but it is not clear enough that this; is true.; ; 	Suggestion:; 		When you select a Project and right click on it; you get the options:; 			Build		( like it is now ); 			Rebuild 	( instead of Rebuild All); ; 		Rename the menu entry from Project to Projects and the options to:; 			Build All	( instead of Build ); 			Rebuild All	( as it is now ); ; NOTES:; ; KH (5/7/2001 9:02:50 PM); ; 	Pls talk to me before you make changes. ; ; SA (5/18/2001 3:53:44 PM); 	After talking with the Core team and Eclipse Java IDE team; here are some of the issues:; ; 	- Everyone is ok with the words Build and Rebuild All. So I see no need to rename these. Woo Hoo!!!; ; 	- What is leading to confusion is the menu name Project. Everyone seems to think it maps to the; 	current selected project in your navigator! So they assume Build and Rebuild All apply to the; 	selection. What we need is a new name for this menu so it is less confusing (Id be interested what; 	the usuability tests say). Workspace cannot be used unfortunately. Any suggestions? It could be; 	Projects (with an s at the end)?; ; 	- It seems most people turn off auto build... Ive not asked why yet...; ; 	- Everyone wants a shortcut to do a manual incremental build of the CU. Right now; hitting Ctrl+B; 	causes the incremental build to run on all projects. Therefore; you need to find the project; popup; 	its menu; and select Build - quite painful and causes you to scroll the navigator around a lot. The; 	package view adds Build Project and Rebuild Project to the file and folder popup menu... not so; 	sure I like that idea. What if we had a menu item in the File menu to do a Build with Ctrl+B as the; 	accelerator. It would be enabled when an editor is open. We could also change the Build toolbar; 	icon to also enable/disable on an editor being open? That way people get the shortcut to build the; 	project in which the current editor input belongs to.; ; 	- Some disagree with the Build menu item in the Project menu being removed when Auto build is; 	turned on. We should only disabled it instead. I defer to the usuability experts on this one...; ; 	Issue number 4 (shortcut to do project build) is what everyone seem to be complaining about.; 	Maybe if people used auto build more this would not be such a big deal.

Title: [Perspectives] Edit Perspectives - should be able to create new (1GDDUO7)
Description: (usability/consistency); ; Perspectives->Edit Perspectives provides a list dialog but you cant add new ones.; However you can create new ones by doing Save Perspective As....; ; This is inconsistent.  You would expect to be able to also do it from edit also (I certainly did; then noticed Save as after).; If there is concern that new would have to create an empty one and this for some reason is invalid;; you could support copy in the edit dialog.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Standard Components] Lost DND auto-scroll in navigator (1GD7N31)
Description: Regression: auto-scrolling during drag and drop operations in the navigator used to work; ; but doesnt in latest build.; ; NOTES:; ; KH (5/10/2001 10:19:17 AM); 	Autoscroll to be supplied by SWT team.

Title: [JFace] JFace dependent on Platform.getPlugin (1GD7WWW)
Description: JFace has a dependency on Platform.getPlugin which makes it hard just to play; with simple examples.; In org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.handleExceptionInEventLoop(Throwable); we call Platform.getPlugin(Platform.PI_RUNTIME) which in my case throws an; AssertionFailedException because my simple example has nothing to do with plugins.; ; Somehow our handling of exceptions in the event loop should detect the simple case; where there is no platform plugin and let the exception happen.; ; NOTES:

Title: Use of folder confusing (1GD9YEG)
Description: Recently there was a change in the UI to use the word folder to generically mean either project or folder.; While it is true that both folders and projects can contain other resources; it is not true that projects ; are folders. ; ; There are a few problems with this approach.  For example; when a user is asked to specify a folder ; they will not be sure if they can spec a project.  There may well be cases where the can and other ; cases where they cannot.  The terms; concepts and structures are NOT interchangable.; ; NOTES:; ; JM (05/05/2001 6:41:20 PM); 	See also; 		1GD9Y58: ITPUI:WIN2000 - Create folder dialog confusing; 	for another example of why this naming is bad.

Title: [PropertiesView] Tabbing doesnt stay in Property view (1GDD37J)
Description: ; Tabbing doesnt stay in PB (property browser/view); ; NOTES:; 	RG (5/7/01 5:49:46 PM); 	Tabbing in single viewer desktop parts in general appears to take you ; to another part until you encounter; 	a text widget which then traps you.; 	Is the expected behavior in the property sheet that you would tab ; through the properties?; 	Or perhaps move from a property name to its value?

Title: [Tasks] Unclear how to create child tasks (1GDD3AD)
Description: PRODUCT VERSION:; ; 043; ; DESCRIPTION:; Unclear how to create child tasks; NOTES:; ; ; NOTES:; GDA (5/7/01 11:16:00 AM); 	I believe there was also a post about this.; ; NE (5/8/01 9:21:31 PM); Does he mean hierarchical groupings of tasks?; ; NE (5/8/01 9:21:37 PM) GDA replies:; I believe yes. I am but the conveyor of information that DT obtained from JK. ; All I did was; create the prs<g> - no value add.; ; I believe I saw a newsgroup post by rational asking for child tasks and it may ; provide additional; info & I think kevinh may also have seen it.; ; If you need additional info we can go back to them and ask.; ; NE (5/22/01 3:33:38 PM); 	The task list does not support child tasks.; 	Moving to inactive.; ; KH (8/13/2001 4:29:33 PM); 	Input for tasklist improvements

Title: Java perspective menu layout question (1GDD4FS)
Description: I am not a big fan of the current layout of the menus in the Java perspective. Many menus with little entries...; ; - Java  ---> open type; - Project --> build/rebuild; - Window ---> preferences; ; The menu organization seemed better in VAJ. I like the Selected one; which I am missing now.; I feel that the perspective menu should rather be merged with the Window one; where perspectives could simply appear as; window layouts. At least the Window menu could have 3 different sub-items:; ; Window/Preferences; Window/Perspectives; Window/Show View/...; ; In the Java menu; why arent the various toolbar options available as well (search for example).; ; Also having a hook to the VCM (like the management query tool in VAJ) would be nice.; ; NOTES:; ; PM (5/7/2001 5:47:02 PM); 	I also dislike the fact I have to indirect through Others... in general in the menus; so as to get to non generic elements (which I will likely; 	never use when doing Java stuff). In the Java world; the defaults should be Java elements; the rest could be reachable through Others...; ; EG (5/8/2001 11:40:43 AM); 	In the Java perspective you dont have to go through Others. You currently have to go through others for the Open To actions;; 	but this will be fixed in the next workbench build input.; ; EG (5/8/2001 11:42:17 AM); 	moving to the feedback to ITPUI

Title: [JFace] DCR: task-oriented progress monitor needed (1GDDVJ6)
Description: UI implementations of IProgressMonitor typically show how many items have been; processed so far. This implementation is OK for cases where a build has to; compile N files. However; in cases where the operation is going through several; main tasks; each having its own subtasks; it is probably better to list all the ; main tasks in advance;; and then draw a checkmark in front of each task text as it has been completed.; Progress indicator can still be used to show progress within each of the main; tasks.; ; I didnt check IProgressMonitor in detail; but it should be flexible enough; to acommodate this implementation without changes.; ; Of course; for this kind of monitor to work; there should not be more than a few; main tasks. Otherwise; the indicator will be too tall.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Build menu labels are confusing (1GDF0JU)
Description: This is my understanding of the build menu entries in the workbench:; ; 	Context menu when clicking on a project:; 		Build -> perform incremental build on that project; 		Rebuild All -> force a build on that project; ; 	Project menu on Workbench menu bar; 		Rebuild All -> force a build on all projects in the workspace; ; ; 	The Rebuild All on the context menu for a project is confusing.; 	Something like Rebuild Project or Force Build or something indicating; 	that the action was just for that particular project and not all projects; 	in the workspace would be better.; ; NOTES:; EG (5/9/2001 11:05:37 AM); 	Rebuild Project would be better. Build action is owned by ITPUI we; 	are just reusingit.; 	Moving to ITPUI

Title: [Editor Mgmt] Creating new HTML file launches IE (1GDEXJO)
Description: - File -> New -> File; 	- foo.html; 	- opens up IE on the new empty file; ; 	I would expect an editor on the file or at least the default; 	text editor in the workbench.; ; NOTES:; ; DJH (5/8/01 11:09:06 AM); 	Same behaviour for .xml files.; ; KH (5/8/2001 11:18:54 AM); 	If an editor has not been associated with this file type we consult the platform. ; 	Pls double check that if you double click on .xml and .html files in the OSs ; 	file explorer ie5 is displayed. ; ; DJH (5/8/01 11:22:12 AM); 	Yes; IE is associated with html and xml files in the OS. ; 	Is there some way to query the OS to open the file in; 	edit mode since I do have editors associated with these; 	file types. It just seems weird to open up IE on an empty; 	file that I just created through the wizard.

Title: assertion failed on renaming a project in the navigator (1GDEXRC)
Description: AK (5/8/01 5:11:38 PM); 	i was renaming a project in the navigator; 	; Log: Tue May 08 17:10:37 CEST 2001; 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 Exception in org.eclipse.ui.views.navigator.ResourceNavigatorRenameAction.run: org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed; ; ; ; NOTES:; EG (5/9/01 5:36:57 PM); 	terse; but moving to ITPUI FYI; ; SA (5/18/2001 5:53:42 PM); 	Not enough information to determine the cause of this problem; given I cannot reproduce this.; ; AK (5/22/01 7:05:03 PM); 	cant reproduce either; 	but i have no idea why there was only one line in the log - not the whole stack trace

Title: Absolute vs relative paths (1GDEYE3)
Description: In the new file/folder wizard; the path displayed for the container resource; 	is relative. (e.g. aaa/bbb rather than /aaa/bbb); ; 	I find this confusing since:; 	- the selection in the list of possible container resources is the folder so I; 		wonder what the path is relative to. The workspace root? The selected; 		resource?; 	- when you click on the resource in the navigator the path is absolute (e.g.; 		/aaa and /aaa/bbb); ; 	I would recommend using the full path (which is always absolute) in the text; 	box.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 4:07:50 PM); 	We have been trying to use full; but relative paths wherever possible.; 	I find it feels more open in the UI.; 	The workspace may not be the users conceptual top of the world.

Title: [WB State] Show view dialog should remember its expanded state (1GDFE3Y)
Description: - choose Perspective / Show View / Other; - expand Basic; - choose Navigator; - hit OK; - choose Perspective / Show View / Other; - the Basic category is no longer expanded; ; Users will often want to open multiple views from the same category; and should not have to expand categories each time.; ; NOTES:

Title: PartSashContainer.dispose method is ambiguous (1GDF8IK)
Description: This is a note for future design improvements ..; ; See 1GDDH59: ITPUI:WIN2000 - EditorArea does not dispose CTabFolder; ; We should rename createPartControl and dispose in LayoutPart to ; activate and deactivate in reflection of their true meaning.  Then we could; add a dispose method reflecting the true behavioral intent.; ; NOTES:

Title: Duplicate perspectives... (1GDFA12)
Description: 1) Select a folder; Open a Java perspective on it.; 2) Select the same folder again; Open Java perspective; ; The second time; I would expect it to just switch to the already open perspective; instead it opens; a duplicate.  Compare with VA/J when you double click on a package.  It either switches to an existing; package browser; or opens a new one if not available.; ; NOTES:

Title: [EditorMgmt] Need to sort out handling of out-of-synch resources (1GDFD96)
Description: We need to sort out the proper handling of out-of-synch resources.; Currently behaviour is:; 	- if you try to open one in an editor; you get an error dialog and have to manually refresh local; 	- on startup; if it tries to open an editor on an out-of-synch file; you get a cryptic error dialog; ; Its debatable whether the user really cares if its out of synch.  Theres only ever one copy of the contents anyway.; One option would be to refresh automatically on open.; Should discuss with Core team.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/29/01 11:56:04 AM); Message to JM:; We still have problems handling out-of-synch resources.; ; For issues related to opening editors; see 1GDFD96: ITPUI:WIN2000 - Need to sort out handling of out-of-synch resources; There are other issues with copy/move; etc.; ; Many moons ago; when I was still on the Core team; you told me the way you thought this should work; but Ive unfortunately forgotten the details.; For opening editors; Im inclined to just do a refresh local; without prompting the user.  Theres only one copy of the content anyway.; My only hesitation is that this is a workspace modification; and will trigger a build when opening an editor on an out-of-synch file.; ; For saves; it should prompt whether to overwrite; or to refresh.  It would be nice to be able to compare changes too.; Neither overwriting or refreshing is too tasty though; since changes are lost either way.  ; Is there any way we can leverage the local history or the recycle bin to avoid permanently losing changes?; ; If youre too busy; just let me know and Ill go ahead with my proposal above.  It may be suboptimal; but it will be better than what we have currently.

Title: Adding a new task auto-names it (1GDFDI6)
Description: - open a text file; 	- rightclick in the file and choose Add -> Task; ; 	Note that the new task appears and its name is the name; 	of where the cursor was last. I would expect it to say ; 	Enter task description just like it would when you ; 	add a task to the workspace.; ; NOTES:

Title: Need easy way to switch between editors (1GDIFZA)
Description: When I have multiple editors open; due to space constraints the tabs do not ; 	show me the full name of the file that I am editing.; ; 	I would like to have an Editors menu or Switch To or something which; 	lists all the files I have open and allows me to bring that editor to the front.; ; 	Currently the only ways to open the editor that you want are:; 		- Guess. Many class names begin with the same chars so when I; 			see Marke... it could be Marker.java; MarkerReader.java; etc etc.; 			This forces me to randomly click on these classes until I pick; 			the right one.; 		- Navigate to the correct resource in the navigator (or packages view); 			and re-open the editor. This is painful if you have the tree expanded.; 		- Java -> Open Type. This can be slow and I already have the editor; 			open and just want to switch to it.; ; 	A menu like this would also save me from having to use those small; 	arrows to look at all my editor titles when I have too many open.; ; NOTES:

Description: - self hosting workspace; 	- select org.eclipse.jdt.ui in packages view; 	- press Go into in the package views toolbar; 	==> observe: the source folder Eclipse Java UI gets revealed. Why ?; ; ; NOTES:; EG (5/9/2001 11:20:19 AM); 	This is the drill down control behaviour.; 	KH pls advise what is that status with the Drill Down Control; will; 	it be revived in the Navigator. If will not be used in the Navigator; 	then we will also remove it from the packages view.

Title: New project wizard browse dialog initial path wrong (1GDH34S)
Description: Open the New Project wizard.; 	Unselect Use Default Location; 	Click on Browse button; 	The dialog does not open at the correct path as; 	was specified in the location field.; ; 	This has to do with using forward slash (/) instead; 	of backward slash (\) on windows. A PR was reported; 	to SWT about this (for DirectoryDialog). If SWT; 	is not willing to support this; then we will need; 	to fix it in the wizard.; ; 	We should also be using IPath::toOSString to get; 	the correct slash for the platform.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 11:55:26 AM); 	Should just fix our stuff; and not wait for SWT.; ; KH (9/10/2001 4:47:36 PM); 	IPath is supplied by Core

Title: New project location behavior strange (1GDH3GQ)
Description: The New Project wizard has changed for the better when; 	specifying the location. However; there is one strange; 	behavior.; ; 	Open the new project wizard; 	Unselect use default location; 	Type a new directory in the location field (or use browse button); 	Type in project name (p1 for example); 	Hit finish; 	==> It creates a project with the contents from the dir you specified; ; 	Now; open the new project wizard again; 	Unselect use default location; 	Leave the location field alone (it should contain the default eclipse dir); 	Type in project name (p2 for example); 	Hit finish; 	==> It creates a project with the contents from the dir\p2 directory.; ; 	We should probably not allow the user to specify the eclipse directory; 	when Use Default Location is unchecked.; ; NOTES:

Title: Delete project should prompt to delete content on disk (1GDH3ZN)
Description: Create a new project and set its location to some directory on your; 	hard disk (make sure it some temp dir you do not mind losing); 	Select the project in the navigator and delete it.; 	It deletes the project and also all location directory on the; 	hard disk.; ; 	We should prompt to make sure the user wants the actual directory; 	on the hard disk deleted.; ; NOTES:

If I add a plugin with action set; 		visible=true and run it using an existing workspace; the action do not show by default. I need; 		to go and explicitly enable the actions.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Tasks] Drillinto project does not filter tasks (1GDIHYV)
Description: Connect to desktop repository on cvslnx; add 2 or 3 of  the org.eclipse.ui.* projects; Select a project; oprn in same window; Java; The task view shows errors for all the proejcts; where I would have expected it to reflect; my selection in this perspective; ; NOTES:

Title: Building auto-saves editor changes (1GDIJI1)
Description: - turn off autobuild; 	- edit some java files; dont save; 	- hit Ctrl-B; ; 	Note that the workspace is built and your changes in your; 	editors are saved without prompt.; ; 	I would expect a Save changes before building? dialog.; ; NOTES:; ; SA (5/10/2001 3:12:40 PM); 	Thats the expected behavior. The workbench preference; 		Save all modified resources automatically prior to manual build; 	is on by default. So the file was saved when you pressed ctrl+b; ; 	Question: Should this be on or off by default?; ; 	However; if the preference is off; then no save happens. You are not; 	event prompted.; ; 	Question: Should the user be prompted if they want to save first (yes;; 	no; cancel)? That would be my preference.; ; DJH (5/10/01 4:31:11 PM); 	As a user I would expect it to be off by default; hence my surprise that; 	my files were saved.; ; 	And I would also expect a prompt if it was off and I had open files.; ; SA (5/14/2001 11:22:34 AM); 	The preference setting is now off by default; ; 	Prompting for open editors is not done yet. Need to decide; 	how to best handle dirty editors in different pages/workbench; 	windows.

Title: Task List: Filtering for project (1GDK9JJ)

Title: editor zoom not working as expected (1GDKL8O)
Description: AK (5/11/01 6:26:47 PM); 1. open 2 files in editor; 2. double click on the title bar; 3. i expected the whole editor windo to zoom; instead; only one editor zooms; ; NOTES:; EG (5/17/01 10:50:21 AM); 	the current behaviour is what Id expect. I want to give the; 	full space to the editor Im zooming.; 	Moving to ITPUI ; ; KR (5/22/01 3:28:08 PM); 	I agree with AK. I have a bunch of editors open and expected to still be able to switch ; 	between them after maximizing. Even if this is working as designed theres odd ; 	behavior when minimizing. The minimize double click not only minimizes the editor ; 	but also switches editors.; 	It seems that the double click is sent to the perspective when it has already been ; 	minimized.; ; 	To reproduce:; 	-open a bunch of editors (>= 5) with the editor view arranged on the right side of the perspective; 	-maximize the first one; 	-double click in the right third of the title bar to minimize; 	-the editor is minimized and switches to the file that is under the cursor in the minimized state

Title: No banner graphics in Save As dialog (1GDKM9Y)
Description: Open an editor on a file; 	Select File->Save As... menu item; 	Notice the dialog has a white banner at the top with; 	nothing in it. It that the expected look?; ; NOTES:; 	RG (5/11/01 2:46:25 PM); 	See 1GD0BXF: ITPUI:ALL - File save as dialog banner area empty; ; NE (05/28/01 11:14:07 AM); 	Need to be consistent.

Title: [Viewers] Debug view flicker when doing an inspect (1GEBP07)
Description: EG (5/25/2001 9:43:52 PM); 	When inspecting an expression the debug view flickers and redraws quickly.; ; NOTES:; EG (5/25/2001 9:44:24 PM); 	not critical for next build but should be fixed for shipping; ; JGS (5/29/01 6:12:47 PM); 	Problem is due to a thread suspend trying to switch to the debug perspective. ; ; JGS (5/30/01 10:10:40 AM); 	Unsetting switch to debug perspective preference does not eliminate flicker.; ; JGS (5/30/01 12:20:02 PM); 	Check for DebugEvents in DebugView.  Maybe an extra one; or maybe a stray change event.; ; JGS (5/31/01 10:59:22 AM); 	Looks like an AbstractTreeViewer problem.; ; JGS (5/31/01 11:37:02 AM); 	Steps to reproduce:; 	-	Launch some simple program in debug mode with a breakpoint set; 	-	When breakpoint is hit; swipe some variable and right-click Inspect; 	-	Carefully watch DebugView; and notice flicker; 	; 	In AbstractTreeViewer.updatePlus(); set a breakpoint on the 3rd line -- boolean removeAll = false;; 	First time breakpoint is hit is for JDIThread and DebugView is OK.  Second time is for JDIStackFrame; and; 	DebugView is now entirely blank.  This seems to be source of flicker.  The entire tree should not be getting ; 	removed; only the subtree rooted at the JDIThread should be getting refreshed.; 	; JGS (5/31/01 12:08:33 PM); 	Sent email to NE for advice.; ; NE (06/01/01 12:23:25 PM); 	Also flickers if you choose Display instead of Inspect (note that Display also appends to the same line; see 1GENIVH).; 	Seems to be the way the debugger is using the viewer.; 	I set breakpoints in AbstractTreeViewer.internalRefresh(Object) and TreeViewer.setSelection(List).; 	Heres an outline of what its doing:; ; DebugContentProvider.doHandleDebugEvent(DebugEvent);   kind=DebugEvent.SUSPEND;     DebugContentProvider(BasicContentProvider).refresh(Object);       - refreshes thread; 	- stack frame changed not equal; so preservingSelection() loses it; and selection is cleared;     DebugContentProvider.selectAndReveal(Object);       - setS selection to THREAD; DebugContentProvider.doHandleDebugEvent(DebugEvent);   kind=DebugEvent.SUSPEND;     DebugContentProvider(BasicContentProvider).refresh(Object);       - refreshes thread org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIThread@23d9; 	- same thread; so selection is not lost; DebugContentProvider.doHandleDebugEvent(DebugEvent);   kind=DebugEvent.SUSPEND;     DebugContentProvider(BasicContentProvider).refresh(Object);       - refreshes thread org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIThread@23d9; 	- same thread; so selection is not lost; Runnable>.run() in findDebugPresentation(Object; String; String; boolean);   DebugView.autoExpand(Object);     - refreshes thread org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIThread@23d9; 	- same thread; so selection is not lost;     - sets selection to FRAME org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIStackFrame@7ee6; Runnable>.run() in findDebugPresentation(Object; String; String; boolean);   DebugView.autoExpand(Object);     - refreshes thread org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIThread@23d9; 	- same frame; so selection is not lost; DebugContentProvider.doHandleDebugEvent(DebugEvent);   kind=DebugEvent.SUSPEND;     DebugContentProvider(BasicContentProvider).refresh(Object);       - refreshes thread org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIThread@23d9; 	- same frame; so selection is not lost; Runnable>.run() in findDebugPresentation(Object; String; String; boolean);   DebugView.autoExpand(Object);     - refreshes thread org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIThread@23d9; 	- same frame; so selection is not lost; ; Strange that its getting multiple SUSPENDs; and refreshing each time.; I noticed that DebugContentProvider.doHandleDebugEvent() has code in the case for RESUME to return; if it thinks the thread is suspended.; ; In the sequence above; on the first refresh; the selection is lost because the selected stack frame; has been replaced by a different JDIFrame instance (for main); which does not compare equal ; (even though they both represent the same frame); so the viewer cannot preserve it across the refresh.; But DebugContentProvider and DebugView.autoExpand cause several refreshes; and cause the selection; to be changed to the thread; then back to the (new) frame.; The flicker is caused by the combination of the first refresh losing the selection; and the DebugContentProvider; changing the selection to the thread; then back to the frame.; The viewer cant do anything about the first case; since it has no way of knowing that the frames are the same;; since they are not equal.; The flicker may not be noticeable if DebugContentProvider could be changed to simply refresh (ideally just once); ; then select the new frame; without  selecting the thread in between.; ; Note that the multiple refreshes; although inefficient; are not themselves the cause of the flicker; (aside from the first one losing the selection); since the TreeViewer is smart about reusing items; and not changing labels unless necessary.; ; Although not indicated above; it was also refreshing the variables and inspect viewers multiple times.; ; PR moved back to DUI.; ; DW (6/1/01 12:32:09 PM); 	I think the multiple suspends are due to the fact that we do not process the resume if ; 	the thread is already suspended.; ; EG (6/7/2001 10:19:21 PM); 	>the selection is lost because the selected stack frame; 	>has been replaced by a different JDIFrame instance (for main); which does not compare equal ; 	>(even though they both represent the same frame); 	in the LeapFrog debugger frames would compare equal in this case. ; 	Anyway it is too late for such changes.; 	; DW (6/8/01 8:07:06 AM); 	This explains the stack frame flicker - but the threads & debug target (i.e. all parents);; 	are still equal; so they should not flash.

This makes it hard to read; especially when there; 	is a space in the view name.; ; 	For instance; mine currently reads:; ; 	Resource History Tasks Search Results | Console |; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR: Need ignore for comparison editor (1GDO835)
Description: In the compare editor; it would be useful to have an ignore; 	button/filter like VAJ had. So when you are going over multiple; 	changes you can remove ones which youve already viewed.; ; NOTES:; ; JohnA (5/13/2001 12:27:33 PM); 	This would be a nice generic feature to have both in compare editors; 	and in the EditionSelectionDialog.  Moving to Andre for consideration.

Title: Unhelpful error message when deleting project (1GDQ11R)
Description: - tried deleting a project containing JUnit and some other test files I created; - restarted workbench; - deleted project; - it deleted Junit; did an auto-build; then complained that there were problems deleting resources; - the error dialog has some nested errors; with the message problems deleting resources; ; I suspect the problem was just having files out-of-synch.  The error messages should be more helpful.; Or; preferably; dont give me errors at all and just force deletion.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Wizards] unable to create project references to non-existent projects (1GDQ1I5)
Description: I am unable to create project references to non-existent projects. This constrains ; the order in which a user create their projects.; ; 0. Start in an empty workspace.; 1. Create a project P0 with a project reference to a project P1; ; Observe: the UI for setting the Project References property is empty (because; it only shows existing projects) and there is no way to create a project reference from; P0 to P1.; ; Expectation: it should be possible to add and remove project references to both existing and; non-existing projects. When showing project references; the UI should include a visual indication; when the project referred to does not exist.; ; See also: 1GDQ0YJ: ITPUI:ALL - invisible project references not shown; ; NOTES:; jeem (5/14/01 11:16:25 AM) - This needs to be coordinated with the JDT UI; whose; build classpath entries are analogous and should be presented to the user with similar controls.; ; JW (5/14/01 11:42:42 AM) This problem is not as important as 1GDQ0YJ.  I would consider this a P3.

Title: DCR: Please add a preference for single-click opens editor (1GDQA1J)
Description: Build 0.105.; ; In VAJ and VAME; selecting a compilation unit opens an editor.; For the user; this is just one click; or they can use arrow keys.; ; Currently in Eclipse the user has to double-click to open an editor.; I would really like a preference to enable the following behavior:; 	- single-click (or selection) opens a temporary editor; 		(which can be pinned afterwards if desired); 	- double-click opens an already-pinned editor; ; I think this behavior should occur when a compilation unit or any part of it; is selected (i.e. class in hierarchy; method; package & var decls; etc).; The behavior would ideally be consistent across all views; i.e. including; search; debugger; etc. as well as all java views; including compare.; So for example if the user expanded a tree in the packages view to see; a list of methods and then selected a method; the CU editor would open;; or if the user clicks once on a method in search; an editor opens; etc.; ; I understand that there will be times when an editor can take a while to open.; I am willing to put up with this because most of the time I will be opening; java files; and they come up fairly quickly.

Title: drill into should remember tree expansion - repository view (1GDQLBF)
Description: In the repository view the ; 	*	expand the head stream; 	* 	select the project versions and drill-into into it; 	*	hit back button; 	*	observe that the head stream is collapsed again forcing you to reopen it; ; It should remember  your tree expansion; ; NOTES:; ; JohnA (5/14/2001 6:21:25 PM); 	Drill down adapter is a UI piece.

Title: Tooltip for Perspective Shortcut does not show complete path (1GE8NXC)
Description: 1. Start with a project; folder; and file.; 2. Open the folder in a new perspective.; 3. Move mouse over resulting perspective button in left tool bar.; ; Notice; tooltip is input name rather than full path.  So if I open project/folder then; the tooltip says folder : perspective.  It would be more useful if it said; project/folder : perspective.; ; NOTES:

Title: Resource name in window title (1GDSLM4)
Description: JGS (5/15/01 7:15:36 PM); 	When opening a perspective in a new window on a project or package;; 	it would be nice to see the name of the resource in the windows title bar.; 	Otherwise; you can have multiple windows in the Windows task bar; 	all with exactly the same title.

Title: [Cell Editors] Usability: text cell editors should not move left when icons are present (1GDSNEU)
Description: Here is the scenario:; ; 1) Take any table or table-tree editor that support cell editing; 2) Set the column so that items in cells accept text cell editor but also have icons; 3) Click on the cell to move it into edit mode; ; Observe what happens: text field is positioned so that it starts with the column ; x coordinate. However; it ignores the fact that image is already there; and that the visual effect is that the text jumps to the left for the width of ; the icon. When editing is done; text jumps right again so that the icon; can be seen.; ; Ideally; the text editor should be positioned so that it does not cover the icon.; This way; there would be no shift left/shift right effect.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: [Wizards] Previous location of project content area not remembered (1GDQUX8)
Description: When I create a new project and set the content area to something other than the ; default; it would be good if the last choice was remembered so that when I go to create; the next project; if I choose not to use the default area; that value is used as the initail; setting for the file prompter.  Users who want to create several projects in the same ; non-default area will benefit greatly from this.; ; NOTES:

Title: Mechanism for reducing some clicks (1GDQWKH)
Description: In an effort to reduce some clicking; it may make sense to allow the dragging of files onto; the editor area.  Since one never really knows whether they have opened the file before and ; if they havent; what editor is going to open; it would be handy to simply drag the file and drop ; it on the editor area.  The minimal implication of this is open an internal editor on this file.; I do not claim to have an answer for figuring out what editor to open...; ; NOTES:

Title: [Navigator] Add Bookmark context menu item in Navigator (1GDRF81)
Description: NOTES:; ; in 105; Add Bookmark is an option from the Navigator pane context menu; but it doesnt do anything.; ; KH (5/15/2001 11:05:25 AM); same in 106. access the context/right-click menu from any file (e.g.; *.txt).; ; KH (5/15/2001 11:28:31 AM); ok; it DOES add a bookmark; in the resource as a whole; but theres no INDICATOR that it does anything. THATS the problem.

Title: [JFace] Multi-select problem in Release/Catchup (1GDRWRY)
Description: Catching up with some folder that has more than one file changed on the server.; 	Click on the first file.; 	Hold shift and click on the last one.; ; 	The selection changes to the last one instead of multi-selecting those files.; ; 	Hold shift and click on the first one.; 	Multi-selection works.; ; NOTES:; ; JohnA (5/15/2001 1:14:26 PM); 	This seems to occasionally happen in all trees; including the navigator (workspace view).; 	Moving to ITPUI for investigation.; ; KH (9/13/2001 2:10:16 PM); 	Also investigate why the multi select drawing looks so cheezy.

Title: [Contributions] DCR - ObjectContributor has incomplete implementation of verifyNameMatch (1GDS25O)
Description: Method verifyNameMatch in ObjectContributor looks like this:; ; /**;  * Verifies that the given name matches the given;  * wildcard filter. Returns true if it does.;  */; public static boolean verifyNameMatch(String name; String filter) {; 	UIHackFinder.fixUI();; 	//We should be using real wild care checker; not this one - that is lacking; 	if (filter.startsWith(*)) {; 		return name.toLowerCase().endsWith(filter.substring(1));; 	} else; 		if (filter.endsWith(*)) {; 			return name.toLowerCase().endsWith(filter.toLowerCase().substring(0; filter.length() - 1));; 		}; 	return false;; }; ; This implementation is incomplete for the following reasons:; ; 1) It does not take into account more complex wild card patterns (including those containing ?). It can only; match cases like *<name> and <partial_name>* (and the fact that I wrote it does not help :-)).; ; 2) It does not support exact match (if I want to register a contribution against plugin.xml only). I would; need to set my name filter to be *plugin.xml or plugin.xml* to fool it.; ; This code affects several extension points including pop-up actions and property pages (those; that are contributed against an object onto which name the filter is applied). It should be fixed; because it is a non-breaking change and no API is involved.; ; ; NOTES:; ; DS (5/16/01 2:52:09 PM); 	I have fixed problem 2.  ; 	Problem 1 is actually a feature request and can be deferred to future releases.

Title: [Workbench] Shared arrow icons (1GDS81C)
Description: There are several different arrow icons (up; down; left; right) in the workbench.  Maybe the; platform should provide these as shared images; to give a more consistent L&F.  ; Some of the places that use them:; ; - navigator (forward; back; up in toolbar); - search results (next; previous match); - compar editors (next; previous difference); - drill down adapters (packages view; repositories view; inspector); ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 11:57:24 AM); 	They are shared between navigator; packages view; and drill down adapters.; 	Should check others.

Title: POST-RELEASE: PAF: Workbench crash (1GDSB6Z)
Description: I commonly die a horrible death because of the following SWT error. (no more handles); 	This causes other programs (like Notes) to look weird when trying to draw icons; etc.; 	In a common day I have to reboot my machine 3 or 4 times to reclaim all lost resources.; ; org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles; 	at java.lang.Error.<init>(Error.java:52); 	at org.eclipse.swt.SWTError.<init>(SWTError.java:45); 	at org.eclipse.swt.SWTError.<init>(SWTError.java:34); 	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1798); 	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1707); 	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.init(Image.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.<init>(Image.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor.createImage(ImageDescriptor.java:106); 	at org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor.createImage(ImageDescriptor.java:77); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$ImageCache.getImage(ActionContributionItem.java:90); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.updateImages(ActionContributionItem.java:586); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.update(ActionContributionItem.java:493); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.fill(ActionContributionItem.java:249); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager.update(MenuManager.java:434); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager.update(MenuManager.java:364); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ShortcutMenu.updateMenu(ShortcutMenu.java:119); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ShortcutMenu.pageActivated(ShortcutMenu.java:67); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PageListenerList$1.run(PageListenerList.java:38); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:606); 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:388); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PageListenerList.firePageActivated(PageListenerList.java:36); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.firePageActivated(WorkbenchWindow.java:428); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.access$10(WorkbenchWindow.java:427); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow$5.run(WorkbenchWindow.java:840); 	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:81); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.setActivePage(WorkbenchWindow.java:827); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.SetPageAction.run(SetPageAction.java:41); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetSelection(ActionContributionItem.java:406); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:360); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.access$0(ActionContributionItem.java:351); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$ActionListener.handleEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:45); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.notifyListeners(Widget.java:643); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:610); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:850); 	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:280); 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:67); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:299); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.UIMain.main(UIMain.java:43); ; NOTES:; ; NE (06/11/01 10:01:27 AM); 	See 1GE8K2O: ITPUI:WIN98 - GDI usage stats for opening perspectives; ; ARCH (7/11/01 11:11:01 AM); 	Fix in 1.0; ; NE (07/19/01 2:31:16 PM); 	ImageDescriptor.createImage() is speced to always return a new image; ; 	so it cant return null; and cant return a shared image (i.e. the missing image).; 	And it cant be changed to catch the out-of-handles SWTError and create a new missing image; ; 	since its out of handles.; ; 	Only alternative is to change all cases to use ImageDescriptor.createImage(boolean); ; 	and handle the null case and SWTError.; 	; 	SWTError states: SWTErrors should not occur in typical programs; although high reliability applications ; 	should still catch them.; 	Could change ImageDescriptor.createImage(boolean) to catch the SWTError for the out-of-handles condition; 	(SWTError has a code); and have it return null.  So this would avoid the need for all users to catch it.; ; 	Of course; it would be better not to run out of handles in the first place; but we cant control this in general.; 	We can only minimize the number of images we create.; ; ; KH (8/1/2001 8:37:17 AM); 	Your proposal makes sense. Hold off making these changes until the SWT team fixes their part of this ; 	problem. They are going to be releasing changes that significantly reduce the number of images that need; 	to be created. ; ; NE (8/8/2001 3:19:49 PM); 	Try changing ActionContributionItem to not create extra images on Win98: disabled and hot image.; 	Use the hot image as the regular one.

Title: SEVERE: Perspective lost (1GDSH6F)
Description: - in the Window preferences set your perspectives to open in new page; 	- switch to Java perspective; 	- close old perspective (so Java one is the only one you have open); 	- close Tasks and Outline views; 	- move the Navigator to be next to the Packages view; 	- add the Repositories view; 	- setup is complete....; 	- File -> New -> Project (basic project; not a Java project); 	- enter a project name and hit enter.; ; 	Suddenly the Resource perspective is opened with your new ; 	project and the modified Java perspective that you had set up; 	is gone!; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 4:01:07 PM); 	Severe because it causes users work to be lost.

The task line changes; 	(importing file: ....) a lot indicating that it is still doing work but the; 	progress meter indicates that it is done.; ; NOTES:
