Title: [Dialogs] Error dialog does not wrap text (1GDU4J7)
Description: If no infosets are installed; the dialog Help Error appear; with long text descriptiong that is not wrapped.  Part of text is visible only.; ; NOTES:; ; DB (5/22/2001 11:35:27 AM); Moving to ITPUI:; It appears that on Windows the text set on MessageDialog wraps if too long. ; On Linux; the message is simply truncated.; ; JEL (29/05/2001 10:18:08 AM); To recreate this problem:; 1) boot into Linux; 2) before running eclipse; find the //eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.help.examples.ex1/; 	directory and delete it (thus forcing no help sets to be available); 3) run eclipse; 4) goto menu: Help->Help Contents; You should see the error dialog with only one line of text; ; KH (5/30/2001 4:31:11 PM); 	Widget does not support wrap style bit?; ; KK (2001-05-31 10:08:31); 	Help uses; 	static org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.MessageDialog.openError(parent; title; msg);; 	to display the error; and does not directlty access the widget .; ; KH (9/13/2001 2:28:14 PM); 	Investigate to ensure we are using the widget properly.

Title: Compare is too slow (1GDU6CJ)
Description: - click on a project in the navigator -> Catchup; 	- the project is a java project and contains changes in only one package; 	- all the changes are conflicts so Id like to go through them one by one; 	- the project tree starts all collapsed so I have to expand folder by folder until; 		I get to the desired level; 	- click on the first class and analise conflicts; 	- right click -> Catchup; 	- the project gets collapsed again so I have to expand again to the desired folder; ; 	Suggestion:; 	- the Catchup/Release tree could show up expanded to the first folder (inclusive) that; 		contains changes; 	- the selection should appear in the folder and not in the first file (because the; 		compare is too slow); ; NOTES:; ; RTP (5/16/01 4:48:05 PM); 	Note that this behaviour is achieved if the conflicing class is changed manually (editing; it in the left text area or using the copy changes options) and them clicking on the select; next change arrow in the structure compare.; ; KM (5/17/01 10:36:20 AM); 	Suggestion #1 is duplicate PR.; 	Suggestion #2 is a PR against Compare since it should not be as slow as it is.  Moving to UI.; ; AW (28.05.01 10:07:34); 	The time to compare to resources is dominated by the time to fetch the resource from the repository.; 	Seems to be a VCM issue.

Title: Shouldnt have to double-click to see problem tools (1GDUAJ4)

These actions are editor contributions and they; 	only show up when the editor is active. ; 	Moving to ITUPI for consideration

Title: View tab position settings not updated immediately (1GDUE0I)
Description: Modifying the preferences for the position of View tabs from top to bottom or vice versa does not take effect until the views onscreen have been closed / reopened.; ; To reproduce:; Start Eclipse.; Create a view folder with a number of tabs.; Window -> Preferences.; Toggle Workbence / Views / Tab Positions / Views from top to bottom or bottom to top.; Click Ok.; ; Note that the views with tabs onscreen still have them in the previous position.; Creating a new view folder with a number of tabs.; These new tabs will be in the right position.; ; NOTES:; JB (16/05/2001 7:31:20 PM)

Eclipse disappeared without showing an error dialog/warning.; 	I only noticed it because I had a pause in my batch file.; ; 	(Did not check the log - guess it may be in there but this is not enough); ; ; NOTES:

Title: Build Error info not accessible (1GDUXNJ)
Description: When you get a build error (e.g.; after saving a file with autobuild on); the UI puts up a ; dialog which says; 	Errors during build; The actual exception which is thrown back has much more information in it.  Recent changes; mean that the build will not fail completely when the first builder fails.  We will continue to; try and run all of the builders.  As a result; the general form of the exception status is ; 	multistatus (Errors during build); 		istatus (builder 1 error); 		istatus (builder 2 error); 		...; This seems like a prime candidate for the Details button.; ; NOTES:

Title: Contributing views should not startup the plugin (1GDVL49)
Description: New support for contributing views should not automatically startup the contributors plugin; if view is stacked. ; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR: Fast views should be faster on close... (1GFMKLY)
Description: Fast views would be much nicer to use if they hide as fast as they are shown.; 	The slow fading away is cute at the beginning but quickly becomes a nuissance; 	when you use fast views to do real work.; ; NOTES:

Title: [View Mgmt] Active view highlight does not go behind toolbar buttons (1GDVNIY)
Description: The highlighting in the titlebar of the active view is compressed when there are toolbar buttons; ; rather than continuing and drawing behind the toolbar buttons (and close box).; The more toolbar buttons there are; the shorter the highlighting is.; ; This looks funny; giving the titlebar an unpleasant; bruise-like mix of blue and grey;; and is inconsistent with the highlighting in the window titlebar (on Windows).; ; It can also lead to visual inconsistency within the workbench itself.; If I have two views; one above the other; or stacked together; where one has more toolbar buttons than the other;; then the highlighting has a different width between the two views.  This is noticeable when switching between them.; E.g. try switching between the Properties and Outline views.; ; NOTES:; JEL (17/05/2001 5:36:09 PM); 	I agree; this was actually the first thing I noticed when I started using Eclipse.  It just doesnt look as nice; 	as it could because of the colours fading to grey.; ; 	The reason the colours dont continue to fade behind the toolbar buttons is that the buttons take up the whole; 	width of the titlebar.

Title: Rebuild All does not prompt for saving (1GDVNT4)
Description: When trying to Rebuild All on project with file that has not been saved; Workbench does not prompt user to save.; ; 1. Open Workbench; 2. Create new Java project P ; 3. Right click on project and select New->Class to make class P (in default package) with public static void main; 4. Do some editing; e.g. add import java.io.*; and System.out.println(...);; 5. Do Rebuild all; but there is no prompt to save; ; NOTES:; ; SA (5/31/2001 10:01:23 AM); 	See also:; 		1GEACBG: ITPUI:ALL - SEVERE: Performing resource operations with dirty editor open on it; 		1GC2UI7: ITPJUI:WINNT - rebuild all just saves all editor without a warning; ; KH (5/31/2001 11:45:41 AM); 	Workbench preference for saving before build. But would be nice if we noticed before hand.

Title: DCR: Compare: cant do find in the text merge viewer (1GDVY02)
Description: EG (5/17/01 9:35:49 PM); 	There should be Find/Change support; ; NOTES:; ; AW (31.05.01 19:46:36); 	Since I cant reuse the existing code postponed until after June.

Title: Minor problem Selecting Types with no extension (1GEYQ44)
Description: In the import wizard; when you invoke Select Types you can use *. to filter files without; an extension.  This does not work in the export wizard.; ; Additionally; if you invoke Select Types a second time you will notice the dialog automatically; formats the extensions (i.e. *.java is reformatted to java).  So *. is reformatted to a null string; so if you click ok without making any changes it will not retain those files without extensions.; ; Steps to reproduce:; 1) create a file in your OS without an extension test; 2) in Eclipse do an import on file system; 3) in the directory field; find the parent directory of test; 4) click Select All; 5) click Select Types and type *. in the Other Extensions text field; click OK; ; notice test is selected; ; 6) click Select Types; ; you will see the *. is now <null>;; ; 7) dont make any changes and click OK again; ; you will lose selection on test; ; NOTES:; JEL (07/06/2001 2:25:09 PM) This PR can likely be given a low priority; I dont think many users; will be using files with no extension; even then the import wizard is still usable.

Title: [Workbench] CVS password saving between session (1GDX7JK)
Description: It does not feel right that we do not re-ask the password for an existing CVS ; connection in between session. In case I gave my workspace to someone else;; he would become granted with all access rights suddenly; just because I left ; some connections open.; ; This should maybe be configurable at least; so I can flush the information.; ; NOTES:; ; KM (5/18/01 12:12:39 PM); 	This supported is provided by the password keyring mechanism in Core.; ; 	It was decided that as a lowbar the UI would not support clearing it (you go and delete it).; 	Clearing on startup would need to be provided by Core.; 	This is either a Core or UI PR; depending on which solution one believes is right.; ; JM (5/20/2001 11:25:17 PM); 	The core support is explicitly support for authentication information across sessions.; 	Clearing on startup basically defeats the purpose of the mechanism.; 	This information is; by default; kept with the workspace.  For whatever reason it was; 	decided that we would not expose a notion of login or user etc so the previously entered; 	passwords are automatically available.  The only options to address this real issue are:; 		1) make users real; 		2) dont use the provided mechanism.; 	#1 is unlikely to happen.  #2 while potentially feasible; is likely low on the priority list.; ; 	Dont know where to go from here.; ; KM (21/05/01 6:33:32 PM); 	This feels like a future PR for UI to support Clear password cache menu operation.; 	This is keeping with what we agreed in planning.; 	We at least should ensure that people know where to find the keyring file to delete; 	(Core should provide info to DOC/Kerri for June release).; 	; JM (6/2/2001 1:11:54 AM); 	Moving to VCM.  There were questoins last week about the flush API so I assume that VCM; 	is adding some UI for clearing the password info.  The documentation on how to use that; 	should go with the rest of the VCM doc.; ; KM (6/2/01 4:19:19 PM); 	We are not adding at this time.; 	General password management should be supported by UI but decision was to hold off for June.; 	Moving to UI for future.

Title: Perspective menu - why others menu entry ? (1GDXFFP)
Description: Why presenting an others in the open perspective submenu when the resource one is also in there ? It should simply list them all under open perspective.; This extra indirection is creating confusion.; ; NOTES:

Title: Usability:
Description: I was looking for the old Close all editors item we had long ago but couldnt ; find.; Picked (hesitantly) Perspectives->Close All.; ; OK; so it did what it says; it indeed closed ALL my perspectives; leaving me ; with nothing.; Not sure would anyone ever want to do this?; ; I cant do the common one; which is get rid of all the editors! ; ; NOTES:; JEL (24/05/2001 12:24:56 PM); 	There are two different Close All menu items.  There is the one ; referred to above; (Perspectives->Close All); and there is one that will close all the editors ; (File->Close All;; or ctrl+shift+F4).  Having two menu items with the same name can be confusing.  ; Perhaps; the later could change to File->Close All Editors as mentioned above.; ; NE (05/28/01 12:09:33 PM); 	Should rename the perspectives one to Close All Perspectives and have ; it prompt.; 	Or perhaps just get rid of it.; 	Likewise; Close should be renamed to Close Perspective.; ; KLM (9/24/2001 6:12:51 PM); 	Perhaps:	Change File-> Close All to Close All Editors; 	It should be clear what you are doing when you choose Close or Close ; All from the ; 	Perspectives menu.  Also; it seems clear what you are doing when you ; hover over a ; 	perspective in the shortcut bar and bring up the popup menu that says ; Close; Close All.; ; KLM (9/26/2001 1:22:14 PM); 	Based on the menu that each Close All appears under; it should be ; obvious what this operation ; 	applies to (Perspective>Close All closes all perspectives; File>Close ; All closes all editors).; 	Closing this PR.; ; KLM (9/26/2001 3:48:35 PM); 	Re-opening.  Spoke with contact - he was looking to close all the ; editors; only in the; 	current perspective.  Not sure if providing a Close All Editors in the ; Perspective menu ; 	(to close all editors only in that perspective) is such a good idea; ; since it will likely create ; 	more confusion.  But will address the issue again anyway.

Title: SubProgressMonitor::done should not clear the subtask (1GDXMOZ)
Description: AK (5/18/01 7:27:02 PM); 	SubProgressMonitor::done clears out the subtask text which results in flashes.; 	it should either restore it to the previous text or leave the clearing out to the caller.; ; 	plus; theres no hook to override that would eliminate this unwanted and surprising behavior.; ; NOTES:

Title: Replace with... needs a confirmation dialog (1GDXO12)
Description: In the navigator (and elsewhere where files can be versioned); 	Manage -> Replace with... -> Team Stream Resource; 	takes action immediately after being selected.  There should be; 	a simple dialog here to confirm that the user really wants his/her local; 	copy obliterated.; ; 	All it takes is one errant click...; ; NOTES:; JB (18/05/2001 1:58:13 PM); ; NE (05/28/01 3:27:09 PM); 	This is important.  We had this behaviour in LeapFrog; and many people; 	lost changes due to it.; 	Ideally it would put any unversioned changes in the recycle bin; or the local history as well.

Title: Do we really need menu in Properties view? (1GDXZML)
Description: In the properties view; the menu has the exact same actions as; 	what the toolbar provides (hide/show categories; filter properies;; 	and restore default values).; ; NOTES:; KLM (9/24/2001 6:10:58 PM); 	Do we do this for accessibility?  Is it possible to access the toolbar items via the keyboard?; ; KLM (9/26/2001 5:12:23 PM); 	Cannot access local toolbar items via the keyboard.  Will have to redundantly add them to ; 	a popup menu for that view.; ; KLM (9/26/2001 5:40:45 PM); 	Will not remove the drop down menu until we get a story for menu registration for this view.; 	See 1GKOF28: ITPUI:ALL - need to register a menu in Properties view

Title: Should Go to resource... take filters into account? (1GDZCSS)
Description: I have the filters set up so it doesnt show .class files.; 	I am using the Go to resource... menu option and class; 	files are listed as potential resources to goto.; ; 	Shouldnt they be ignored and not a part of the list? Because; 	if you actually select a class file; it expands the Navigator; 	to the right spot; but doesnt select the file for you since; 	you have it filtered out.	; ; NOTES:

Title: [Tasks] TaskView should become visible after a build when hidden (1GDZWNW)
Description: EG (5/19/2001 12:58:03 PM); 	Consider the following scenario:; 	Im working in the Java Perspective.; 	My configuration of the Java Perspective has a stack of views at the; 	bottom:; 		Console (visible at the top); 		Search Result; 		Task List; ; 	When I do a build and have new errors. I dont see the result of ; 	the build operation and this can be confusing. I have to manually ; 	bring the Tasks view to the front.; 	The build operation should bring the task view to the front automatically.; ; 	Notice; that the console view and the search result view already support; 	this auto raise option; but not in a consistent way. The console view does it conditional based on; 	a user preference; the search result view does it unconditionally.; ; NOTES:

Title: Question: should editors have hardcoded white bg (1GE1ELT)
Description: I tested PDE on Linux and noticed that the background of all the editors and views is gray ; (the same as the dialogs). Our artwork look less then optimal this way (including things; like syntax coloring in Java editor). ; ; Should we somehow control this color in preferences and pick white as a default?; The reason I am asking is in order to coordinate PDE editors to do the same.; ; NOTES:

Title: Right-double-clicking in editor title bar zooms (1GE6Q6N)
Description: Double-clicking the right (menu) mouse button in the editor title bar causes it to zoom.; This is unexpected.  I was trying to see if there was a pop-up menu there for close all; and hit it twice ; (just to make sure there was no pop-up <g>).; ; It would be better if there was a pop-up menu; with options for zoom (or restore when zoomed); save all; and close all.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Editor Mgmt] Need show in navigator from an editor (1GE22Z1)
Description: Users often end up with many editors open.  Many users polled always disable the ; link editor to navigator option as it results in an unusable navigator.  Unfortunately; ; with this option disabled; there is no easy way to get from a given file in an editor ; to the file in the navigator to; say; release it.  At best the outliner; in the case of Java; files; offers Show in package view.  From there you can show in navigator.  At worst; the user has to manually hunt for the file in navigator.; ; Suggest adding a context menu to the editor tab.  This would have show in navigator; and may offer Java tooling the abilty to include show in package view.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Perspectives] Would like to tear off a perspective (1GE29PH)
Description: For whatever reason; I always seem to end up with perspectives open in the same ; window (yes I have tried all the different preference settings).  This is bothersome since ; I cant see the information I want at the same time and contexts get lost and forgotten.  ; There is no way to tear off a perspective into its own window.  ; ; A menu entry or the ability to drag the perspective onto the desktop much like you can do ; with views; would really help in this situation.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: [View Mgmt] unnecessary activation when deactivating editor (1GE4Z3E)
Description: *	open a msword doc in place; *	open a bmp file in place; ; *	ensure the bmp editor is active; ; *	click on the navigator; ; *	click on the tab for the .doc editor; ; Observe a bunch of flashing occurs and you can even see it repaint the bmp; editor; draw its toolbars etc; then remove them; ; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Preferences Smoke Tests (1GIIP94)
Description: This is a test list for the preferences dialog.; ; Presentation; 	Verify that the listbox on the left shows appropriate scrollbars when its contents extends beyond its client area.; 	Verify that the window grows to fit the content page of the selected item.; 	Verify that you can traverse all widget groups by pressing TAB.; ; Actions; 	Clicking on a item in the tree shows the corresponding page on the right; including the page title.; 	Verify that Defaults sets all fields to the default values for the current content page ONLY.; 	Verify that OK stores all changes made to fields by doing the following:; 		- make some changes to checkboxes; option buttons; and textboxes.; 		- click OK.; 		- open the dialog again and ensure that all the changes were saved.; 	Verify that Cancel discards all changes made to fields by doing the following:; 		- make some changes to checkboxes; option buttons; and textboxes.; 		- click Cancel.; 		- open the dialog again and ensure that all the field values are the same as before the change.; 	Verify that ESC maps to Cancel.; 	Verify that Apply stores all changes made to values by doing the following:; 		- make some changes to checkboxes; option buttons; and textboxes.; 		- click Apply and then Cancel.; 		- open the dialog again and ensure that all the changes were saved.; 	Verify that Apply immediately updates the workbench settings by doing the following:; 		- open a text file with the default text editor.; 		- type something in the editor; 		- open the preferences dialog; and click on Workbench | Default Text Editor; 		- click Change... At the Font dialog; select a different font and a different font size. Click OK.; 		- at the preferences dialog; Click Apply; 		- without closing the preferences dialog; ensure that the settings for the text editor are updated.; ; Persistence; 	Verify that all field values are persistent all the time.

Title: [JFace Text] Text editor did not repaint properly on scroll due to paste (1GITB07)
Description: - opened org.eclipse.ui/doc/org_eclipse_ui_importWizards.html (or any other .html file under doc); - scrolled to end of file; - selected text between quotes for the ALT=Copyright... by clicking before the C; hitting Shift-End;; then Shift-Left Arrow until just before the right quote; - pasted the new text: Copyright IBM Corp. 2000; 2001. All Rights Reserved.; - it did not repaint properly -- the right side of the line was not fully repainted; - it appeared as:; BM Corp. 2000; 2001. All Rights Reserved. BORDER=0 height=12 wi; with spaces to the right of the wi; - with the scrollbars as they were; it should have shown:; BM Corp. 2000; 2001. All Rights Reserved. BORDER=0 height=12 width=195>; - moving the horizontal scroll bar back and forth fixed the problem; ; Screen shot is in q:\viper\team\nick\PRs\1GITB07.zip; ; This is probably sensitive to the screen size and layout:; - I was in the Java perspective (no changes to its layout); - screen res was 1152x864 (32 bits per pixel); - window was maximized; - used the Navigator view to open the file; ; NOTES:

Title: PropertySheet should expand categories by default (1GE36VQ)
Description: PRODUCT VERSION:; Eclipse 107; ; The property sheet should expand categories when displaying categories.  Currently; they are collapsed; and if I expand them;; expansion is just temporary should they dissappear and come back.  This makes using the category feature frustating; to the point where; the user will always turn off show categories.; ; The fix would be to expand categories by default.

Title: Ctrl-F4 should close view  (1GEARVC)
Description: Ctrl-F4 should close the active view.  It already works for editors.; There is no other way to close the view using keyboard only.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/25/01 3:52:37 PM) ; 	See also 1GEARZ6: ITPUI:WIN98 - Ctrl-Space should activate view titlebar context menu

Title: [UI] Text edit fields truncate long names (1GE5BVX)
Description: I have a CU LineBackgroundEvent.java. When I rename it or refactor->rename it; the name thats shown in the edit field is roundEvent.java. The rest becomes visible; when I click in the field and hit home.; ; NOTES:; ; KH (9/19/2001 11:51:36 AM); 	Pls check JFace/Workbench code before moving this to JDT. ; ; EJP (9/21/2001 2:20:29 PM); 	It is still a problem.; 	Steps:; 		* On the navigator view; 		* Select a .java file with a long name (WebBrowserMessages.java); 		* Resize of scroll the navigator in a way that you only see half of; 				the .java file name (WebBrowserM).; 		* Popup menu -> Rename.; 		* The Rename editor box will should be bigger. It will have the size of WebBrowserM; 		but will show the end of the file name.; ; EJP (9/21/2001 2:31:33 PM); 	Windows file explorer has exactly the same problem.; 	We are creating a swt.Text with the navigator as its parent so the text can not be bigger then the navigator.

Title: All projects should be selected when creating new project (1GE3VKS)
Description: - File / New / Project; - The wizard comes up with two panes: All Projects on the left; and empty on the right.; - You have to click on All Projects for the different project types to show up on the right.; ; It should do this for me; since its the only selection.; Better yet; dont have a list of one item if thats always the case.; ; NOTES:

Title: Still sucking resources (image handles) on Win98 (1GE40E9)
Description: Cant realistically selfhost on Win98.  With just two workbenches (one each for selfhosting); I am down to 15% resources after launching second Eclipse.  This is with Notes etc closed.; With VCM perspective opened and RPRS I am down to 2%.; ; Closing the VCM perspective you get back to 14%.; Opening the Java one you run out and die (both eclipses).; ; NOTES:; ; NE (6/8/01 5:19:06 PM); 	See 1GE8K2O: ITPUI:WIN98 - GDI usage stats for opening perspectives

Title: [Progress] Replace with TS resource: Label cut off  (1GE4UVV)
Description: I replaced org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java with the team stream resource.; The label that showed the progress wasnt high enough to shows the entire text.; The last line was cut in half verically which looks ugly.; It seemed that there was enough space between the bottom of the label and the cancel ; button for at least 1.5 more rows of text.; ; NOTES:

Description: NOTES:

Title: Undo after file save does not work; but menu-item still active (1GE4W22)
Description: To Reproduce:; 	1) Open a (Java) file in Eclipse.; 	2) Make a change.; 	3) Click save.; 	4) Notice that the Edit -> Undo menu-item is active; select it.; 	5) Notice that no change occurs.; 	6) Notice that Edit -> Undo remains active no matter how many times steps 4-5 are repeated.; ; Would be nice if undo was still supported after a save.; ; NOTES:; JB (22/05/2001 11:35:18 AM)

Title: Field name misleading in New Folder wizard (1GE4Z26)
Description: NOTES:; ; In the New Folder wizard; the topmost field should read Enter or select the container; not; Enter or select the folder. ; ; 1) The user will often be selecting an existing project; not an existing folder; as the container for ;      the folder being created; and ; 2) they might accidentally type the name of the folder theyre trying to create in the topmost field ;     (instead of in the bottom field; where it belongs).

Title: Tear off windows over the editor is confusing. (1GE6SUW)
Description: If you move a view on top of another one you add it in its TabFolder.; 		If you move it over an editor you tear it off.; ; 		We should either; allow the user to mix editors and views or do not; 		allow him to drop a view over an editor. ; ; NOTES:

Title: Workbench should be ready to NOT be called from eclipse.exe (1GE58U1)
Description: This is a warning from PDE team that PDE starts the platform by running UIMain class ; using the currently selected JVM. In other words; it is not running soon to be implemented; eclipse.exe. Consequences:; ; 1) When PDE users start Eclipse instance to test or debug the code they are developing; in design-time Eclipse instance; they will not get anything provided by eclipse.exe.; I dont know what it is (so far I know it might be the splash screen).; ; 2) If there is any secret handshake between eclipse.exe and the platform UI; the platform; should be ready to NOT receive when PDE launches UIMain directly. If it only ; boils down to the splashscreen; the platform should have an option to raise ; this splashscreen on its own.; ; I dont know about other possible consequences of PDEs running of UIMain instead; of eclipse.exe; so please fill in the blanks.; ; ; NOTES:; ; KH (5/22/2001 4:45:17 PM); 	; 	The UI is not going to be displaying the splash screen any more. Showing the splash ; 	screen is moving to eclipse.exe and product configuration level. Product.ini is also ; 	moving out of the ui plugin as well.; ; 	McQ (23/05/2001 8:46:51 AM) -; 		Basically; all that eclipse.exe does is run java with a particular set of arguments.; 		As long as PDE is prepared to provide those arguments; there should be no problem.; 		I suggest DG talk to JMcA about what those arguments should be.

Title: Find/replace should preset last find string (1GE57MY)
Description: If I open the find dialog without having any text selected it should preset; the find field with the last used string.; ; NOTES:

Title: Need too many errors; stopping feature (1GE5EBP)
Description: Propose we add a Too many errors; bailing out feature to the build process; and/or; perhaps a max cap on the number of tasks the Task View UI is allowed to contain.; ; Simple errors can easily cause the task list to become huge and unmanageable.; Ive seen task lists containing tens of thousands of entries because of simple mistakes.; The problem?; Well; what am I going to do with 100;000 entries anyway?; The list takes about 30seconds to load and if you have filters on; then; it takes about the same amount of time to update as you select different; files in the properties view.  Since this operation occurs automatically; for you; and cannot be aborted... its a bit of a pain -- and it could take you; 15 minutes just to fix a one-character mistake in a library path or something. =(; ; To reproduce:; 	1) Take a perfectly functional project.; 	2) Delete the library paths (kill .classpath); 	3) Build.; 	4) Wait.; 	5) Look at your task list...; 	6) Select some other file in the project.; 	7) Wait some more...; ; NOTES:; JB (22/05/2001 6:13:02 PM); ; EG (5/25/01 9:15:02 PM); 	moving to JCORE for comment; ; CM (5/28/2001 12:13:28 PM); 	This is actually quite important. We need this feature or something like it.; 	Our problem on the SWT team is that when we load the swt project from the repository;; 	it does not initially have a .classpath file. (because our .classpath is platform-specific;; 	so we create our .classpath file after loading). After a build; there are 20;000 errors or so.; 	On Windows; the only problem is that it takes forever to populate the Table widget.; 	On Linux; we crash. The Table widget cant handle the volume.; 	You can imagine that if autobuild is on and someone innocently loads the swt project; 	on Linux (this has happened more than once) they will crash.; ; 	Changing the platform of this PR from WIN2000 to ALL; and removing the DCR from the title.; ; PM (5/29/2001 3:05:49 PM); 	Why dont you simply hit the Cancel button ? I understand that an auto-cancel action would be nice; but this could be handled by the platform.; ; JB (30/05/2001 11:51:58 AM); 	Cancel is insufficient as you dont always get enough realtime feedback from the; 	compiler to know when to cancel.  Moreover; without an auto-cancel option or a; 	high-water limit on the number of permissible tasks in the Task view; loading; refreshing; 	and filtering the Task view can become a significant burden on the system in terms of CPU; 	time and memory resources.  Hence cancelling manually midway through a build could still; 	leave 10000 errors behind (it does not take long for them to accumulate) and may cause; 	deteriorated application (and in the extreme case; system-wide) performance.; ; 	Nonetheless; I believe the issue can wait until the next release as it does not; 	occur frequently in normal operation.  It may be a source of concern for those people; 	migrating existing code to our product as things can sometimes be quite broken in the; 	first stages of any migration until all the compiler options and build paths get; 	set right.; ; CM (6/4/2001 2:32:53 PM); 	FYI; I just timed a compile that had 30;434 problems.; 	This was extremely easy to do; because if I load all of SWT and its examples and internal examples; 	at one time with autobuild on; and then go away for a coffee; this is exactly what will happen.; 	(because SWT intentionally does not have a .classpath file).; ; 	It takes under 2 minutes to compile all of that stuff; but populating the Tasks views Table; 	(which is a native Table widget; therefore we cannot fix it) takes over 6 minutes.; ; PM (6/18/2001 5:24:24 PM); 	The feedback problem from the compiler is a JDTCORE bug; which we already have a PR for.; 	Now the 6 minutes update is a UI issue. Moving to UI land for archiving.; ; KH  (6/18/2001 12:02:02 PM); 	I want a faster table widget.

Title: [UI] Show view dialog scrolled when new view opened (1GEG2EA)
Description: - new Java perspective; - Perspective / Show View / Other / Basic / Bookmarks; - as it opens; the leftover image for the view dialog shifts over along with the underlying views and editor area; - it then disappears once the bookmarks view is open; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 12:24:29 PM); 	This is cheesy.  Related to other PR filed for redraw problems when using dialogs and wizards.

Title: [Workbench] DCR: Support for multiple workspaces from within Eclipse UI (1GE5ESW)
Description: At the moment it is possible to maintain multiple workspaces under; Eclipse by specifying -platform to the application.  However it is not; possible to switch between workspaces without shutting down Eclipse; or starting another application instance in parallel.; ; From the user standpoint; it would be nice if the following workspace-related; functionality were available from within the Eclipse UI (much like it is in VAME):; 	1) New Workspace; 	2) Open Workspace...; 	3) Save Workspace; 	4) Save Workspace As...; ; These operations would support:; 	- multiuser development on the same machine [esp. useful in eXtreme environments]; 	- quick backup snapshots; 	- archival snapshots; 	- rapid deployment snapshots (for setting up local build environments within a team of developers); 	- transferring development snapshots between workstations; 	- perhaps encapsulating user per-project preferences; 		[the different semantics of developing in Java; C++; HTML; JSP may impact the; 		manner in which a developer would structure their user interface; in terms of; 		which action sets are loaded; and which types projects will be displayed together]; ; NOTES:; JB (22/05/2001 6:25:11 PM)

Title: [Standard Components] Task list can leave lingering priority dropdown (1GE5PH5)
Description: After messing with the priority of a new task I have been left in the state where there are; 	no tasks listed yet I have a dropdown list with the items (High; Normal; Low) lingering.; ; ; NOTES:; 	KW (5/22/2001 10:20:39 PM); 			Trying to get a reproducible testcase.; ; 	KW (5/22/2001 10:29:25 PM); 		Cant seem to get a consistent case. It has happened multiple times; usually the side effect of; 		leaving the combo box there with high ready to be selected.  Change focus and do a search; 		or something; change the filter for the tast list and its left around.; ; 	SA (10/4/2001 12:08:28 PM); 		Im running with build 0.202 with the lastest Eclipse UI code. Title: [Tasks] New task may be filtered out (1GE5PP6)
Description: Set the task filter to be Where task priority is high only.; 	Create a new task.; 	New task is not visible. Should be; you havent assigned a priority to this new task yet.; ; NOTES:; 	EJP (7/30/01 10:15:28 AM); 		We could open a dialog telling the user that the task will be filtered and will not; 		be showed in the task list. The dialog could have a Do not show this message again check box.

Title: [Perspectives] How to export (Save) perspectives for new install? (1GE5SQO)
Description: Ive got to throw away (or delete my .metadata) my current workbench due to a reoccuring NullPointer exception; 		Unhandled exception caught in event loop.; 		Reason:; 			java.lang.NullPointerException; ; 	After youve put significant work into arranging your views I hate to see that go to waste.  Or rather; if Ive installed; 	at home and would like to propogate my views home is there a way?; ; ; NOTES:

Title: [Tasks] Tooltip on tasks should be placed in a better position. (1GE7843)
Description: In the resource perspective with the task list in the right bottom corner.; 	Create a new task with a long description (the compiler error are like that).; 	Stop the mouse over the task descriptor.; 	The tooltip will open showing the description because it does not fit in the table column; 	but the tooltip will be show the whole description because it does not fit in the screen.; ; 	It should either; 		use more then one line;; 		open more to the left so the description would not be cut by de screen size.; ; 	The same problem happens with the editor title if the file name is too big.; 		; 	; ; NOTES:

Title: Icon for new tasks suggests multiple (1GE6T4G)
Description: The icon for the new task action in the toolbar of the tasks view shows 3 plus signs.; This suggests that it will create multiple tasks.  ; A single plus or star would be better.; ; NOTES:

Title: View window menu should be smarter (1GE6JSW)
Description: RE: The view window menu (right click on the view icon in its upper left corner); For a fast view the menu should include Minimize since there is a tool bar action for this; ; Also since we build this menu every time we should populate it only with valid items ; rather than including disabled items. ; ; ; ; NOTES:;  	RG (5/23/2001 3:18:40 PM); 	Also the detached view menu should contain maximize now that the real OS window titlebar; 	is gone.

Title: Missing stack trace in log makes it impossible to debug (1GE6MZR)
Description: During an incremental build; I got a dialog that said null and nothing else.; ; 	When I went to the .log; I had the following:; Log: Wed May 23 16:07:09 CEST 2001; 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 Exception in ; org.eclipse.ui.internal.GlobalBuildAction.run: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError; ; 	How do we expect an ISV provider to debug his/her code with so litle ; information? If because of the OutOfMemoryError; 	we were not able to dump the stack trace; then we should not catch it ; (the VM knows how to show it). Otherwise;; 	we should first report the OutOfMemoryError in the dialog; then we ; should show the stack trace.; ; NOTES:

Title: Property sheet view: Restore Defaults should be Restore Default (1GE6O4L)
Description: The tooltip for the default button should be Restore default value since it applies to the selection; and the view only allows single selection.; ; The menu item should be Default; ; Also this button/menu item should be disabled if there is no selection.; ; NOTES:

Title: [PropertiesView] Property sheet view: Filter properties should be Show/Hide expert properties (1GE6OCE)
Description: The tool tip for the filter action should be; Show/Hide expert properties since this is the only filtering we currently support; ; The menu item should be Expert; ; Note that the logic of the button will need to be reversed; (Show expert when pressed); ; NOTES:

Title: [Tasks] Task List does not handle multiple selection of resources (1GE8F8I)
Description: If a filter is set on the task list to only show problems in the currently; 	selected item and multiple items are selected then only the tasks from ; 	the first item are shown; ; NOTES:

Title: [Markers] Need indication of sort order in marker views (1GE6P7W)
Description: Most apps these days show the sort order using an arrow in the column header.; The task list should do the same.  ; Its confusing not to have visual feedback of the sort order.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/23/01 11:00:50 AM); 	Unfortunately; SWT has no support for this.  Can it be added?; ; SN (5/23/01 12:36:04 PM); 	SWT is feature and API frozen.  We are currently busy self hosting.; 	Sorry but new features and/or API requests need to be approved by; 	TLs at this point.

Title: Too easy to tear off views (1GE6QVV)
Description: Its very easy to tear off a view unintentionally; e.g when mousing in the titlebar to see if theres a menu where the view icon is;; when going to press a toolbar button and missing.  This leaves the novice user in an unexpected state.; Its also sometimes hard to reattach a view if its only moved out a little bit.; ; The threshold should be increased.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Should have a preference option - Detached windows allways on top. (1GE6RCP)
Description: We should let the user choose if he wants the detached windows allways on top.; ; NOTES:

Title: Properties view should not duplicate toolbar actions in view menu (1GE6RDC)
Description: The properties view duplicates the actions on the toolbar in the views dropdown menu.; This is not necessary.  No other view does this.; In addition; the names are different; leading to confusion.; ; NOTES:; KLM (9/24/2001 6:10:51 PM); 	Dup of 1GDXZML: ITPUI:ALL - Do we really need menu in Properties view?

Title: Moving detached window is too confusing. (1GE6RGB)
Description: 1) Tear off a view.; 	2) Click in the title bar and move it around.; 	3) Tear off a second view on top of the first one.; 	4) Click in the title bar and move it around.; ; 	The tear off operation and move are mixed up.; 	In the step two you have the impression that you are moving the window but; 	you are actualy tearing it off.; 	When you try to move it in the step 4 you end up tearing it off. ; ; ; NOTES:

Title: [Import/Export] Imported files do not retain last modified timestamp (1GE6RYS)
Description: Platform: JDK 108 W2K; ; Import a directory of files into a project; then look at the files in the local file system; The timestamp for all the files will be the time they were imported (i.e. copied locally).; This is counterintuative for file copying; the files should have the same dates as the; originals.; ; DJH (5/24/01 2:35:04 PM); 	The File -> Import function calls IFile.create and IFolder.create when importing; 	resources in the workbench.; ; 	The preferred method is to copy the resources to the destination on the filesystem; 	and then do a IResource.refreshLocal.; ; 	Note that this is what the VCM does when loading projects from the repository.; ; 	Moved to ITPUI for comment.; ; TC (5/28/01 4:02:17 PM) - awaiting decision from KH level 2 regardless; ; TC (5/30/01 3:46:41 PM) - deferred

Title: Usability - detached window should not stick to front (1GE6SYU)
Description: Whenever I detach a window; it sticks to the front; over the workbench. Why then allowing to detach a window if it always get in the way ?; ; NOTES:

Description: - Window / Preferences; - Expand Java ; - Hit OK; - Window / Preferences; - the expanded state is lost; ; It should remember the expanded state.; ; NOTES:

Title: Workbench preferences: focus given to accelerator key text (1GHBOZ8)
Description: - Window / Preferences; - Make sure the Workbench page is selected; - Click on In the same window; - hit Tab; - focus goes to the (empty) text field for this options accelerator key; - hit Tab again; it goes to Shift; - hit Tab again; it goes to Ctrl; ; These should not take focus.  ; Tab should go to the first choice in the next tab group (New Project Options).; ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (07/23/01 11:25:49 AM); 	Not sure what kind of widget these use; but Labels do not take focus.

Description: The output directory is not remembered.; ; NOTES:

I know that its projects; 	that Im creating.; ; KH (5/28/2001 6:26:33 AM); 	No

Description: The title of the dialog to select which filters to apply to the; 	navigator view seems wrong. It says Selection Needed.; 	We should probably give it a better title like Filter Selection; ; NOTES:

Description: Open the Resource perspective; 	Show view Bookmark (this should stack it; 	in the Navigator folder). Now click and drag; 	the Navigator tab (so as not to cause the; 	nav view to come to the front) into a; 	detach window.; ; 	You do not get a detach window with the nav view; but; 	the nav view is also not in the workbench window anymore.; 	The bookmark tab is still there instead of the bookmark view; 	taking over all the tab folder space. Clicking on Perspective->Show; 	->Navigator does nothing.; ; NOTES:

Title: Move project dialog confusing
Description: Create a project; In navigator; hit move.; ; In the resulting dialog; it doesnt tell me what it wants me to do.  The dialog title just says; Project.; ; If I go to the location text box; and try to append something; an error message appears at the bottom;; which is cut off so I cant read it.  There should be at least hoverhelp for long messages.; ; I assume it says local mapping overlap: d:/eclipse/target/JohnTest and d:/eclipse/target/OtherPlace;; which is a bit confusing... I think a user would ask; whats a local mapping?; or; ; How come it says two different directories overlap?.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Double click on detached view titlebar does not maximize (1GE7181)
Description: Double click on a detached view title bar; it does not maximize.; ; NOTES:

Title: MRU File List is not persisted between sessions (1GE71Z0)
Description: 1. Start workbench.; 2. Open 2 or 3 files.; 3. Notice how files appear in File menu MRU list.; 4. Shutdown workbench.; 5. Restart.; 6. Notice how files do not appear in File menu MRU list.; ; These files should be persisted between sessions.; ; NOTES:; ; DS (5/23/01 3:36:30 PM); 	Note: We should be using the IPersistableElement.  Do not peek into the; 	implementation to get the underlying resource.  The IEditorInput may not be; 	a resource.

Title: Usability issue - editor actions removed on focus lost? (1GE8IYN)
Description: Its probably too late to do anything about this; but for the record...; ; 	Open a java editor on a .java file. Note that it adds a few icons to; 	the toolbar. If you click on a view; those icons disappear. It felt like; 	the wrong thing to do. To get access to them; I had to click on the; 	editor again.; ; 	It just seems weird that some toolbar icons (like save) are; 	always there and available even when a view is active. So; 	why cant the editors specific icons also be there?; ; 	(I guess the same would hold true for the menu bar items; 	an editor adds); ; NOTES:

Title: [Bookmarks] Feature request: bookmark indicator on file icons (1GE8IZQ)
Description: When you bookmark a point within a file; a blue indicator is shown to indicate; that you have bookmarked that line.; ; It would be nice if an indicator would be placed overtop the icon of a file you have; bookmarked also (similar to the X indicators for errors - is it possible to have multiple; indicators?).; ; 1) create a new project; 2) add a file to the project; 3) make sure you are in the Navigator View; 4) right click on the file and select Add Bookmark; ; From the users point of view; nothing seems to happen here; so adding the indicator; would give the user a sign that the file was bookmarked.; ; NOTES:

Title: Bug in selecting adject elements in Packages/Navigator (1GE734Y)
Description: Normally; the user can select a group of adjacent elements using the shift key and the mouse in the packages ; and navigator window. However;; ; 1. Choose an element using the KEYBOARD.; 2. CLICK another element while holding down shift.; 3. Notice that it doesnt highlight the group of elements; but just deselects the previous one and selects the new one.; ; Such characteristic forces the user to select the first element using the mouse only. Notice that Windows Explorer; works either way.; ; NOTES:; This might have to do with SWT....; ; ; KH (9/19/2001 2:50:39 PM); 	See also: ; 	; 		1GEAOJK: ITPUI:WIN98 - Shift-select doesnt always work in Navigator

Title: Perspective shortcut icon close switches perspective (1GE738E)
Description: Open three perspectives (in the same window). In the shortcut bar; click on the; 	1st perspective icon to activate that perspective. Now popup the right mouse menu; 	over the 3rd perspective and select Close. Notice once the close is performed; the; 	active perspective switched to be the second one.; ; 	Since the 1st perspective was active when the 3rd was closed; I see no reason; 	why it should activate the 2nd one.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Standard Components] Multi-select in navigator temporarily undoes selection (1GEG093)
Description: - shift-select in navigator; - while mouse is down; other selected items are deselected; - when let go; theyre reselected along with the new one; ; NOTES:

Title: Build order preference page list is empty (1GE75YF)
Description: Open the Build Order preference page. Notice the list is empty.; 	Uncheck the Use Default option and the list is populated with; 	all the available projects. Now check the Use Default option and; 	notice the list is still populated but disabled.; ; 	The list should either always be populated or not when; 	the Use Default is checked.; ; NOTES:

Title: Tasks Cell Editor does not close on deactivation (1GE7AN3)
Description: Im not sure if this is a bug.  It is very strange behavior; though.; ; 1. Add a task to the task list.; 2. Click on description to edit.; 3. While cell editor is active click on navigator.  Notice activation is now in navigator;; but cell editor in task list is still open.; 4. Click back on title for tasks.; 5. Move scroll bar up and down.  Notice how cell editor disappers momentarily while; scrolling.; 6. Now click on column headings to change order.  Notice how editor still remains.; ; The same problem occurs if the priority editor is active.; ; Expected behavior:  If I click off the task list the cell editor should be deactivated; as; the part itself is deactivated.  ; ; NOTES:

Title: [Import/Export] Import Wizard: Finish button is enabled with no selected files (1GE7BAF)
Description: The finish button is enabled when the user has not selected files yet.; ; 1. File->Import; 2. Choose a folder that doesnt have sub folders.; 3. The finish button is enabled although the user has not selected any file to be imported. ; ; NOTES:; ; TC (5/28/01 3:42:09 PM) - level 2 PR - does not inform user that nothing has been selected; ; TC (5/30/01 3:49:25 PM) - low priority

Title: [Standard Components] Task View - Cannot create new tasks when text filter on (1GE7C91)
Description: 1. Start workbench.; 2. Activate Tasks view.; 4. Change filter to contains X.; 5. Now try to add a task to the resource.  ; ; Problem: The cell editor for the new task never appears.  I believe this is because; the new task is filtered out before you get a chance to edit it.; ; NOTES:

Title: New wizard has no focus (1GE7CYG)
Description: The New wizard should open with the first list having focus.; That way you can use keyboard navigation to select elements/advance etc.; As it is; noone has focus and you _must_ use your mouse to get anywhere.; ; This is essential for usability (and for those of us who try to reduce their mousing).; ; This is true for both hitting the New icon and New->Project....; ; NOTES:

Title: UI issues Copy/Move resource dialogs (1GEARYX)
Description: From the Nav view popup menu; 	- Copy and Move menu items should have an ... since they; 	request more information.; ; 	Copy Project; 		- dialog title should be Copy Project; 	Move Project; 		- dialog title should be Move Project; ; 	Copy Folder; 		- dialog title should be Copy Folder; 		- rename Select the destination. to be Enter or select the destination folder:; 	Move Folder; 		- dialog title should be Move Folder; 		- rename Select the destination. to be Enter or select the destination folder:; ; 	Copy File; 		- dialog title should be Copy File; 		- rename Select the destination. to be Enter or select the destination folder:; 	Move File; 		- dialog title should be Move File; 		- rename Select the destination. to be Enter or select the destination folder:; ; 	- on multi selection which has both folder and files; the title should be; 	Copy Resource and Move Resource; NOTES:

Title: Ctrl-Space should activate view titlebar context menu (1GEARZ6)
Description: Ctrl-Space should activate the context menu in the views titlebar; (not the pulldown menu in the views title bar; or the views context menu).; ; There is no other way to activate this menu using keyboard only;; so Fast View; Maximize and Close arent available by keyboard.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/25/01 3:52:46 PM); 	See also 1GEARVC: ITPUI:WIN98 - Ctrl-F4 should close view ; 	and 1GEAS5Y: ITPUI:WIN98 - F11 should zoom

Title: Resource View not opened when a project is created (1GE8EI9)
Description: When you create a new Project if the resource navigator is not open then the project is created; with no visual cue to its existance.; ; STEPS; 1) Open the Resource Perspective; 2) Close the Resource Navigator; 3) Create a project -no visual cue that it exists; ; NOTES:

Title: Full path of currently edited file should appear in the status line (1GE8FME)
Description: When an editor is selected; the full path of the file ; being edited should appear in the status line.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Workbench] Status line should use a read only text widget not a label (1GE8FVD)
Description: The Status line should use a read only text widget so ; that its contents can be copied to the OS clipboard; ; This is a trivial change but a big useability win.; ; NOTES:

Title: Tasklist should have Copy to Clipboard on its popup menu (1GE8FYV)
Description: It would be nice to be able to copy the text of the selected task to the clipboard.; ; NOTES:

Title: Deletion has a poor message (1GE8G0V)
Description: When you delete several items you get a Deleting:. message. The name of the ; items being; deleted should be shown.; ; STEPS; 1) Select several resources; 2) Select delete; 3) The message will be Deleting:. for the duration of the operation.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Go to resource dialog is too small (1GE8H7O)
Description: The go to resource dialog on the navigator popup is too small when it opens.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Why Open Project & Close Project label? (1GE8HFS)
Description: On the popup menu of a Project; there is an Open Project and Close Project; 	menu labels. Why add the word Project to the label. Since there two menu items; 	only appear on the Project popup menu; there is no need for the extra word Project; 	in the label.; ; 	Also; why have both menu items (open & close) at the same time? Only one of the; 	two is ever enabled at a time (i.e there is no situation where both will be enabled at; 	the same time). We should remove one of these.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Bookmarks] Multiple equivalent bookmarks allowed (1GE8HPH)
Description: The workbench allows you to bookmark the same file multiple times.  There is no; reason or need for this.; ; 1) Open the resource perspective (Perspective->Open->0 Resource); 2) Create a new project; 3) Add a file to the project; 4) Right-click on the file and select Add Bookmark; 5) Right-click on the file and select Add Bookmark; 6) Show the bookmarks view (Perspective->Show View->Bookmarks; ; Notice multiple entries of the same bookmark; they all point to the same file so only; one bookmark is really needed.; ; NOTES:

Title: Go to resource dialog should open with A selected (1GE8I4H)
Description: In order to open quickly the go to resource dialog does not fill its list; This makes for a large; unusual delay when clicking on the list as its ; contents are really filled in.; The dialog should open with A preselected and fill the list only; with appropriate matches; ; This is how the java go to type works.; ; NOTES:

Title: Adding a bookmark should open the Bookmarks View (1GE8I5C)
Description: When you add a bookmark either to a file or a location within a file; it would make; sense to open the Bookmarks View if it is not already open (without giving it focus).; This would be especially useful when in the Java Perspective as the Bookmarks View is; not one of default views; but this also applies to bookmarking in any Perspective.; ; 1) create a new Java Project; 2) add a new class to the project; 3) open the class in the editor (double click); 4) right click in the margin of the editor and select Add Bookmark; 5) give the bookmark a name; ; Here you see the bar icon appear in the margin to indicate the bookmark.; To reference your bookmark however; you need to do the following:; ; menu: Perspective->Show View->Other...[Expand Basic->Bookmarks]; ; If the auto-open Bookmarks is implemented; it is important not to give it focus;; we dont want to interrupt the user when he adds a bookmark.  By opening the view; a new user will know how to reference her bookmarks.; ; NOTES:

Title: Preference option Open a projects default perspective??? (1GE8I5X)
Description: In the workbench preference page; what does the option; 	Open a projects default perspective do? I selected In a; 	new window. but could not find any menu item in the; 	projects popup menu that caused a new window to open.; ; 	What the heck does this do? How do I know what is the; 	default perspective for a project?; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Shift doesnt work when opening perspective from dialog (1GE8LLP)
Description: With default settings; Perspective / Open lets you hold shift down to open a new window when choosing from the menu.; This doesnt work when choosing from the Other... dialog.  Same is true for alt.; Either it should work the same for the Other... dialog.; ; Or; even better; make it more visible in the dialog with buttons for Open in Same Window; and Open in New Window.; It should choose which one is the default based on the preferences; so return has the default behaviour.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Fast views too slow when going away (1GE8IHM)
Description: Fast views open quickly but have a scroll effect on closing.; The effect is neat the first time you see it but quickly becomes a pain; especially if the fast view is expanded across the workbech (ex. tasklist > 1sec.); ; NOTES:; 	RG (5/24/2001 4:58:22 PM); 	The effect looks bad on Linux.; 	It leaves a series of edges which then disappear one at a time.

Title: The tab of editors is huge (1GE8JG0)
Description: Created a java project and added an external jar.; 	Opened the file .classpath (the emacs editor was opened); 	Closed it.; 	Opened with Default Text Editor; 	The icon in the tab is too big. The tab is about 2 cm high.; 		; ; NOTES:; ; KH (5/28/2001 12:08:56 PM); 	This does not look good.

Title: GDI usage stats for opening perspectives (1GE8K2O)
Description: Here are some GDI resource usage stats for opening perspectives.; ; Before starting: 77% free; Coming up with no perspectives open: 75% free; Open resource perspective: 63%; Open another resource perspective: 58%; Close one resource perspective: 64%; Close other resource perspective: 75%; Open java perspective: 56%; Open another java perspective: 43%; Close one java perspective: 56%; Close other java perspective: 75%; Open java perspective: 56%; Open another java perspective: 43%; Open a third java perspective: 30%; Open a fourth java perspective: 15%; Close all perspectives: 75%; Open resource perspective in other window: 62%; Open another resource perspective in other window: 48%; Open a third resource perspective in other window: 35%; Close window with no persective open using close box: 36%; Close window with resource perspective using task tray menu: 49%; Close window with resource perspective using task tray menu: 63%; Open resource perspective in other window: 51%; Open resource perspective in other window: 37%; Close window using close box: 51%  -- worked this time; Close window using close box: 63%; Close perspective in last main window: 75%; Open java perspective in other window: 52%; Open another java perspective in other window: 30%; Open a third java perspective in other window: 7%; Close java perspective in other window: 30%; Close java perspective in other window: 51%; Close java perspective in other window: 75%; ; Differences:; Opening resource perspective:;   Same window: 12; 15;   Different window: 13; 14; 15; 12; 14; Opening java perspective:;   Same window: 19; 13; 19; 13; 13; 15;   Different window: 23; 22; 23 ; ; Summary:; 	- images are loaded multiple times for multiple perspectives; 	- images for a perspective are freed properly when perspective is closed; 	- Java perspective has more overhead for first Java perspective open; 	- Java perspective has significantly more overhead when opening a new window.; 	  probably due to having more toolbar buttons and menu contributions than the resource perspective; 	- can only have max 5 resource perspectives open; 	- can only have max 4 Java perspectives open in same window; or 3 in different windows; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/24/01 11:17:00 AM); 	Just for fun: Notes takes 10% to come up with the mail window; plus ~2% for each open message (freed when message is closed).; ; NE (6/8/01 5:19:14 PM); 	Update for build 120.; 	Workspace contains single empty Java project.; 	No perspectives open: 80%; 	Opened Resource perspective in same window: 73%; 	Opened 2nd Resource perspective in same window: 67%; 	Close; Close; back to 80%; 	Opened Resource perspective in new window: 72%; 	Opened 2nd Resource perspective in new window: 62%; 	Close; Close; back to 80%; 	Opened Java perspective in same window: 69%; 	Opened 2nd Java perspective in same window: 59%; 	Close All; back to 80%; 	Opened Java perspective in new window: 69%; 	Opened 2nd Java perspective in new window: 59%; ; 	So basically 10% per perspective.; 	This is improved from 110; but still too much

Title: [Navigator] Usability: closed projects (1GE930I)
Description: There is no function assigned to double click for closed projects in the Navigator view. It would be nice if the user can; open closed projects by double clicking them.; ; NOTES:

Title: Creating and deleting tasks feels sluggish (1GE8LC2)
Description: In task list; hit create button 5 times.  It takes a couple of seconds to complete.; ; Select first task and hit delete button 5 times.  It takes even longer to complete.  ; It refreshes after each one; with a noticeable pause between each one.; ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/24/01 11:33:12 AM); 	Auto-build was off; so its not due to builder activity.; 	Was in Java perspective; with another Java perspective open in same window.; 	Close java perspectives; and tried in resource perspective.; 	It was faster; but still felt sluggish for deletes.; 	Suspect its due to delta processing in packages view; tasks view and navigator view;; 	with packages view taking the most time for showing problem ticks.

Title: Open File .. (1GE8LD7)
Description: The java plugin provides an Open Java .. action.  This is very useful if you need to; open a class which is not visible in the current navigator or packages view ( and this; is very common now that we have drill down ).  However; Open Java .. is only useful; if you are a java developer.  All other developers will find themselves fighting the; product to open files which are not visible.  We need an Open File .. action to resolve; this general need.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Dialogs] Is there a single resource selection dialog out there? (1GE8LPK)
Description: We have several places where we need a single Resource selection dialog.  ; We wanted to make sure we werent overlooking one before we do our own.; What we want would be very similar to the ContainerSelectionDialog; but include; files.  The ResourceSelectionDialog is overkill for single-select.

Title: Nice to have Save action in Perspective menu (1GE8VBZ)
Description: In the Perspective menu; we have a Save As.. menu item. It; 	would be nice to have also a Save menu item. That way I do; 	not get the extra dialog box and the state is saved to the current ; 	perspective I have open.; ; NOTES:

Title: Search dialog does not support all extensions (1GE8VNZ)
Description: Select Edit->Search menu item. You have to specify an extension. But there; 	does not seem to be any way to specify all extensions (*.*). I tried leaving the; 	field empty and also using *.* and *; ; 	Also; people are use to seeing *.jav; *.java; etc to indicate extensions; 	than jav; java; etc We should change the Search dialog to show extensions; 	with *. as the prefix.; ; NOTES:

Title: Drag and Drop files does not check read-only (1GE8MAV)
Description: If you drag and drop a read-only files; you are not prompted to confirm the move.; If you move the read-only file using the popup menu; you get an error; (see: 1GE8LT7: ITPUI:WIN - Internal Error: moving read-only files); ; 1) create a new project; 2) in the Navigator; add a file in the root directory; 3) create a new directory; 4) make the file read-only (right click on file; click properties; Info; click Read Only; click OK); 5) drag and drop the file to another directory; ; The file is moved without prompting the user.  The workbench should ALWAYS verify that the user; really wants to move the read-only file.; ; NOTES:; JEL (24/05/2001 12:16:06 PM); 	Related PRs:; 		1GE8MI1: ITPUI:ALL - What is read-only property for? Ignored  by editors?; 		1GE8LT7: ITPUI:WIN - Internal Error: moving read-only files; 		1GE8MTR: ITPJUI:WIN - Package view ignores read-only property

Title: [JFace] Project Reference preference page wraps info too soon (1GE8MLW)
Description: The label in the ProjectReferences page wraps too soon - it ends up on 3 lines and would be better; on fewer. This is because the widget does not fill horizontal.; ; ; NOTES:; 	EJP (07/12/01 04:04:43 PM); 		createControl() in PreferencePage sets the layout data after calling createDescriptionLabel; 			descriptionLabel= createDescriptionLabel(content);; 			if (descriptionLabel != null) {; 				descriptionLabel.setLayoutData(new GridData(GridData.FILL_HORIZONTAL));; 			}; 		createControl() in ProjectPreferencePage does not do it.

Title: goto file on package in search view does nothing (1GE8N3D)
Description: 1. Start with java project; package and class ( ie X.java ).; 2. Open X.java in editor.; 3. Open Outline view.; 4. Select package for X.java in Outline.; 5. Invoke Declarations in Workspace.; ; Result: Search view appears with one item; the package for X.java.; ; 6. Select the package in the search view.; 7. Invoke Go to File.; ; Result: Nothing happens.; ; Expected Result: This is a package / folder; so Open should cause a new page to ; be created rather than a file editor to be opened.; ; NOTES:

Title: Open Folder .. (1GE8NOK)
Description: This is similar to ; ; 	1GE8LD7: ITPJUI:WIN98 - Open File ..; ; When I self host I find that there are too many resources in the workspace to look at; in the navigator.  To avoid this I open up new perspectives on; specific folders.  My original perspective only exists for the creation of ; new perspectives.  I never do any real work in it.; ; We should add an open folder to the project menu.  If selected; it would allow; the user to choose an input + perspective type and open a new perspective.; This would facilitate better random navigation within the product.; ; NOTES:

Title: Cant get OLE editor after opening system editor (1GKL7YF)
Description: 1. drop a .ppt document into a project; 2. double click; you get the inplace OLE Powerpoint editor control (very cool!); 3. close editor; Open With System Editor; it opens Powerpoint fine; 4. close powerpoint because man I love that embedded editor jazz; 5. Now the default editor is a text editor.; ; In between steps 3 and 5 I had released my file to the repo; which opened compare.  Dunno if that mightve reverted; the default editor to being the text one.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: D&D and zoom view weird behavior (1GE8OFX)
Description: Drag the nav view into a detach window.; 	Zoom the properties view; 	Drag the nav view over the properties view.; ; 	Notice how the D&D cursor icon is to attach right all the time.; ; NOTES:

Title: Move detach window causes unzoom (1GE8OLT)
Description: D&D the navigator into a detach window; 	Zoom another view; 	Move the detach window a bit; ; 	Notice the zoomed view is unzoomed.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Standard Components] The prompt dialog box shows for deleting a task that doesnt exist. (1GE8R18)
Description: When there is no completed task in the Tasks window; Workbench still confirms that the user really wants to delete; it.; ; 1. Clear all tasks in the Tasks window; 2. Right click->Delete Completed Tasks; 3. The prompt dialog box asks you if you really want to delete them althought there are no tasks at all.; ; NOTES:

Title: Editor tab gradient needs fixing (1GE8PLL)
Description: The gradient on the editor tabs look really weird when the file name is; 	short. Thats because the X button overlaps with the blue gradient - the gray; 	portion of the gradient is not long enough to hold the X button.; ; 	Here is a proposed solution (which SWT will need to implement). When drawing; 	the gradient in CTabFolder; it should not include the area where the X button; 	is located. ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 1:02:17 PM); 	Note that this would be inconsistent with Windows titlebars; where the gradient; 	draws behind the close box.

Title: [JFace] InputDialog scrolls default text (1GE8Q0Q)
Description: If you create a JFace InputDialog with some default text; it appears with the; text half scrolled off the side of the screen.  This is due to an SWT bug with; selectAll(). (See 1G84AZB: ITPDUI:ALL - Rename truncates name).; ; Maybe if InputDialog did text.setSelection(defaultText.size(); 0) it would not ; scroll;; since this places the cursor at the beginning of the text box.; ; This is annoying us in VCM because now the catchup/release dialog that pops; up asking for release comments provides a default comment (the most recent one; entered); but it looks bad because the text is half-scrolled so it looks ; truncated.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Tasks] Userbility: Checking a task (1GE8RBD)
Description: In order to check a task in the Tasks window; the user must highlight the task first. ; This requires virtually double click. Moreover; the check mark appears quite slow; ( takes about 0.5 seconds ); so that the user may be confused if he has clicked it correct.; ; NOTES:; 	RG (5/24/2001 1:47:18 PM); 	I think the problem lies in the fact that we are using a cell editor to perform a trivial task; 	I we know that the user is clicking in the check column then we should just update the state; 	of the task and its icon directly without ever activating a cell editor.

Title: Folder selection dialog is too small (1GE8REP)
Description: Open the import wizard and select zip import; Press the lower browse button; The browse folder dialog is too small; ; NOTES:

Title: Smurf house icon looks out of place (1GE8RVF)
Description: The Smurf house home icon used in the tool bar of the drill; down tree viewer looks out of place compared to the cool; toolbar icons we use elsewhere.; ; -Select a file and choose move from its popup menu; -Select a folder and press the right arrow; -Now the icon is visible; ; ; NOTES:; ;  NE (05/28/01 11:28:08 AM) drill-down buttons are inconsistent with navigator and package viewer web-browser buttons

Title: Properties view layout not specified in Resource perspective (1GE8S26)
Description: It use to be the Properties view was located in the same tab folder as the Outline; 	view and was visible when the Resource perspective was opened. Now it; 	is no longer visible  when Resource perspective is open and when the Properties; 	view is shown via the menu; it opens at the bottom right.; ; NOTES:

Title: [OLE] Core dump when opening .html file in composer (1GEY95R)
Description: TM (6/7/2001 14:05:54); 	SDK 119; ; 	1) I opened the file <org.eclipse.jdt.launching/doc/org_eclipse_jdt_launching.html> via a double click in the packages view; 	2) Netscape 4.75 opens as an inplace editor; 	3) There is a link (to a non-existing file) in there. Hovering over this link;  I selected open link in composer; 	4) observe: an error dialog box pops up saying:; ; 		Title: cvs over ssh - one project locks the workbench: netscape.exe - Application Error; ; 		Msg: The instruction at ... referenced memory at .... The memory could not be read.; ; 		When I clicked ok; netscape was terminated and I ended up with a blank editor tab.; ; 	Follow up: I double clicked the html file again and got an error dialog box: an error occurred when; 					 opening this editor and the workbench died.; 					 The log showed:; ; Log: Thu Jun 07 14:09:53 GMT+02:00 2001; 2 org.eclipse.ui 2 Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: org.eclipse.ui.; java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException; 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager.update(MenuManager.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager.update(MenuManager.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager.updateAll(MenuManager.java:515); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager.update(MenuManager.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager.updateAll(MenuManager.java:515); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.updateActionBars(WorkbenchWindow.java:1025); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.updateActionBars(WorkbenchPage.java:1464); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.setActivePart(WorkbenchPage.java:1333); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.requestActivation(WorkbenchPage.java:1152); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartPane.requestActivation(PartPane.java:239); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartPane.handleEvent(PartPane.java:191); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.WM_SETFOCUS(Control.java:3205); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree.WM_SETFOCUS(Tree.java:1269); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.windowProc(Control.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.windowProc(Display.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.SetFocus(Native Method); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.forceFocus(Control.java:474); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Decorations.restoreFocus(Decorations.java:465); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Decorations.WM_ACTIVATE(Decorations.java:889); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.windowProc(Control.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.windowProc(Display.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.ole.win32.COM.VtblCall(Native Method); 	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.ole.win32.IOleObject.DoVerb(IOleObject.java:21); 	at org.eclipse.swt.ole.win32.OleClientSite.doVerb(OleClientSite.java:536); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.editorsupport.OleEditor.setFocus(OleEditor.java:433); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage$1.run(WorkbenchPage.java:112); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.activatePart(WorkbenchPage.java:107); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.setActivePart(WorkbenchPage.java:1327); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.activate(WorkbenchPage.java:95); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.openEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:1001); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.openEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:922); 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.EditorUtility.openInEditor(EditorUtility.java:120); 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.EditorUtility.openInEditor(EditorUtility.java:101); 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.EditorUtility.openInEditor(EditorUtility.java:91); 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.packageview.OpenResourceAction.run(OpenResourceAction.java:57); 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.packageview.PackageExplorerPart.handleDoubleClick(PackageExplorerPart.java:619); 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.packageview.PackageExplorerPart.access$1(PackageExplorerPart.java:608); 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.packageview.PackageExplorerPart$3.doubleClick(PackageExplorerPart.java:293); 	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.fireDoubleClick(StructuredViewer.java:281); 	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.handleDoubleSelect(StructuredViewer.java:431); 	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer$1.widgetDefaultSelected(AbstractTreeViewer.java:654); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.notifyListeners(Widget.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.notifyListeners(Widget.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:732); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:815); 	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:285); 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:69); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:311); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.UIMain.main(UIMain.java:43); ; TM (6/7/2001 14:17:49); 	While the crash might very well be a Netscape bug. We should handle the crashed editor better.; ; KM (6/7/01 12:40:24 PM); 	Moving to UI for consideration on exception in MenuManager.; ; DS (6/7/01 6:06:42 PM); 	From the stack trace it looks like we are trying to update a pulldown within; 	the window menu.; ; 	NegativeArraySizeException =  Thrown if an application tries to create ; 	an array with negative size.; ; 	I am confused.  Within MenuManager we dont allocate any arrays.  The only; 	allocation is a new ArrayList (see below).  If some inline optimization is performed ; 	the error may occur in the ArrayList constructor where a real array is allocated.  But that ; 	implies that items.length < 0.  According to the java spec length may be positive ; 	or zero.; ; 		protected void update(boolean force; boolean recursive) {; 			if (isDirty() || force) {; 				if (menu != null && !menu.isDisposed()) {; 					// clean contains all active items without double separators; 					IContributionItem[] items= getItems();; 					List clean= new ArrayList(items.length);; ; 	We also call menu.getItems further down in the method.  The getItems method will; 	query the system to determine the item count for the menu.  If an error occurs in; 	OS.GetMenuItemCount the result is -1.  Then menu.getItems tries to; 	allocate an array of size -1.  This probably causes the exception.; ; 	The netscape editor opens  in an OleEditor; so it will replace some pulldown menus; 	within the window menubar.   It is not clear how MenuManager.update will cooperate if; 	we do an update.  ; ; 	Hypothesis # 1: The menubar contains a combination of our own menus and those ; 	contributed by netscape.  MenuManager.update removes all which are unknown.  And ; 	our own pulldown menus which have a menu manager ( probably the case above ) may ; 	not be realized.  Either type of pulldown menu may return -1 if OS.GetMenuItemCount; 	is called.; ; 	Hypothesis # 2: Kevin says there is complete separation between the ole menu and; 	our own.  In my own testing I find that we can normally query the items in our menubar; 	even when another menu is active.  The error situation above may just be a; 	side effect of the netscape error.; ; 	Have asked Veronika to comment.; ; VI (6/8/2001 10:02:50 AM); 	OLE creates its own menubar which it super imposes on the applications menubar.; 	The ole menu bar is completely separate from the applications menubar.; 	The only entries in the ole menu bar that come  from the application are those provided; 	in OleFrame.setFileMenus; OleFrame.setWindowMenus and OleFrame.setContainerMenus.; ; 	Is some cleanup being done on the MenuItem objects passed in to these methods?; ; DS (6/8/01 11:37:01 AM); 	We may modify the contents of these menus while the ole editor is active.  For; 	instance; we may add items to File New or the Perspective menu.; ; DS (6/8/01 12:44:25 PM); 	I talked with VI about this.  It should be OK to modify the contents of our menus while; 	an OLE editor is active.  And in my own testing I am able to modify the actions which; 	appear in the menu ( via action sets ) with no problems.; ; 	Getting back to the original problem; ie the workbench died without putting up a dialog;; 	our menu bar is corrupted.  There is nothing we can do.  At least we log the; 	problem.  We can do a readme for this scenario.; ; NE (6/15/01 12:17:29 PM); 	Readme doc:; 99.1.1.1 If an OLE editor crashes; it can cause the Workbench to also crash; ; If an OLE editor crashes; this can cause the Workbench to either crash; or to have its menus become inconsistent.
