Description: 1. Open some hierarchy like org.eclipse.swt.Control in Type Hierarchy.; 2. Try to select Control.  ; ; Result: On my system it is impossible until I select a subtree below root.  ; Then I can select the Control.; ; Observation: Control has a dotted border around it.  Perhaps it has selection; but there is a focus problem.; ; NOTES:; MA (5/29/01 10:11:53 AM); 	Could JFace look at it?; 	The element has been selected by code (treeviewer.setSelection()) while the viewer was in background.; 	When brought to front the selection is not visible; but seems to be set anyway (and prevents from being selected again); ; MA (5/31/01 12:30:14 PM); 	It has to be something with refresh. When the hierarhcy gets a new input; the changing is not done by changing the input of the tree viewers; 	but by calling refresh on the viewer.; ; NE (05/31/01 10:33:52 AM); 	Seems to work OK the first time the hierarchy view is opened.; 	Try again; selecting different type in packages view (to hide hierarchy view) and choosing Show In Hierarchy.; 	Reproduce in JDK build on 98; and in VAJ on 2000; with hierarchy view in either ; 	top-down (type hierarchy) or bottom-up (supertype hierarchy) mode.; ; NE (05/31/01 12:47:47 PM); 	SWT bug; encountered due to AbstractTreeViewer reusing items in updateChildren().; 	See 1GELNIG: SWT:WIN2000 - Tree item selection not shown if same item previously cleared

Description: We should have the menu option Copy to clipboard all over.; 	We should give the user the option to copy the status bar message as well.; ; NOTES:

Title: Browse directories dialog is empty (1GEA8DN)
Description: Open the new project wizard; Select Project; Press the next button; Enter a project name; Uncheck use default directory; Press browse; There is a beep and the directory dialog is empty ; ; The dialog should show the directory that most closely maps to what you have entered.; ; NOTES:; RG (5/25/01 8:51:17 AM)	; 	On Windows we always seem to open on My Computer; ; SA (5/25/2001 10:01:43 AM); 	This has been reported before but as a reminder... the DirectoryDialog which; 	is being used to select a directory does not accept / as part of the initial; 	directory. It must be \ on Windows.; ; 	It would be nice if DirectoryDialog did this parsing for us. Also; we should; 	use toOSString() on IPath so that we get the correct separator for the platform.; ; EJP (6/25/01 1:59:55 PM); 	Re-tested it. In my machine it shows the dev eclipse working directory.; ; EJP (7/11/01 1:39:31 PM); 	The method WizardNewProjectCreationPage::handleLocationBrowseButtonPressed(); 	should be fixed to use IPath::toOSString().

Title: [Navigator] DCR - Need shortcut for Go Into in Navigator & Package View (1GE9VB8)
Description: I am using the Web style navigation  to reduce the information overload presented to me in the navigator and; 	the package view. Using the context menu everytime when going into the selected element makes ; 	it a pain.; ; NOTES:; MA (5/25/01 11:25:04 AM); 	A go into button on the toolbar would be nice to have; ; EG (5/29/01 7:06:02 PM); 	double clicking the label works for me; but this behaviour should be optional.; 	moving to ITPUI

Title: [UI] Loose the default button in new project wizard (1GEA8P2)
Description: Ensure that at least one project already exists; Open the new project wizard; Select Project; Press the next button; Enter a project name; Press next; Note that Finish is the default button; Check the box beside an existing project; Note that the finish button is no longer the default (no button is); ; NOTES:

Title: Deleting a project should ask if user wants to delete contents (1GEACLE)
Description: Right now; if a user want to delete a project but retain its contents; the; user has to close the project and then delete it.; 	Although the Core API specs that; it seems more a side effect or; hidden feature than a real feature.; 	The suggestion would be that; when deleting a project (open or not); the; UI could prompt the user about deleting the contents or not.; ; NOTES:

Title: Too many pages in new project wizard (1GEAE6L)
Description: This is a combined UI / JUI problem.; ; Creating a new project requires too many steps; mainly due to having so many pages in the wizard.; Page 1: Kind of project.; 	- Usually have to choose All Projects manually; but thats the only option.; Page 2: Project name; and optionally change location (Ive never done this).; Page 3: Java settings; for class path and output folder.; Page 4: Java VM.; ; There are acres of free space on each page; except for maybe page 3.; ; Pages 1 and 2 should be combined; and shouldnt require selecting All Projects.; The project path is rarely changed; so it could be on an Advanced... button if its space is needed.; ; Pages 3 and 4 should also be combined; or the choice of VM could be on an Advanced... button as well;; since the product comes with one; and novices wont be changing it.; They should also be combined in the project properties (same UI).; ; NOTES:

Title: Radio buttons should be vertically aligned (1GEADN8)
Description: The radio buttons on the Workbench>Views preference page are horizontally aligned.; In general I prefer vertical alignment and given that the labels are top and bottom ; then vertical alignment seems preferred.; ; NOTES:

Title: TreeViewer flashes item when expanding for first time (1GEADSF)
Description: In the navigator; with expand a folder containing some items.; Notice that the item flickers (not the whole viewer).; It doesnt do it on subsequent collapse/expands.; ; NOTES:

Title: OLE editor does not re-paint its toolbar until editor is activated. (1GEAE3P)
Description: 1) create a doc file.; 	2) create a bmp file.; 	if you switch bettween editors if works file; 	but if you go to the navigator and switch the ; 	selected file the content of the file is re-painted in the; 	editor but the toolbars; status bar;etc are not.; ; NOTES:; 	EJP (5/25/01 10:55:17 AM); 		I understand it is a bit related to our model; ie; when the editor; 		is not activated the action are not showed in the toolbar but; 		in this case it is a local tool bar and it does not have a nice; 		visual efect.

Title: [UI] Need mnemonics for new folder and file (1GEAEK8)
Description: There are no mnemonics for the Folder and File options in the File / New submenu; or in the Navigator (actions are shared).; ; Should use: &Folder (for consistency with Windows Explorer) ; and Fi&le.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/25/01 11:34:12 AM); 	Tried adding & to the appropriate places in the plugin.xml.; 	This works for the menus; but unfortunately it shows as &Folder and Fi&le in the Other... dialog.; 	Backed out of change.

Title: [UI] ContainerSelectionDialog does not run validator on initial selection (1GEGW3Q)
Description: If an initial selection is passed to ContainerSelectionDialog; it does not run the validator on it.; It should.; ; To reproduce:; - set a breakpoint in CopyResourceAction.isValid(Object); - select a folder in the navigator; - choose Move; ; It selects the parent of the folder as the destination.; This is not valid; although in 110 it accepts it; but isValid is not even called to check.; ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/28/01 11:08:15 PM); 	Trigger PR: 1GEGEAN: ITPUI:WIN2000 - SWTException: Navigator; 	Added workaround to CopyResourceAction to double-check after destination is chosen.

Title: Cannot add page to empty window (1GEAEM4)
Description: 1. Open Preferences.; 2. Change Open a New Perspective to in new window.  Press OK.; 3. Close existing page in current window.; 4. Invoke Perspective | Open | X.; ; Result: the page is opened in a new window.  If the current window is empty the; new perspective should appear in the current window.  Otherwise; there is on way ; for the novice user to repopulate the window with anything usable.  They are forced ; to close it.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Perspectives] Custom perspective has same icon as base (1GEAEQY)
Description: 1. Open a java perspective.; 2. Remove Package and Hierarchy Views.; 3. Save perspective as test.; ; Result: You have a new perspective which has no java specific views in it; but; the icon for the perspective is still the java perspective icon.  ; ; We should offer a way to customize this icon OR fall back to the default; perspective icon.  ; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] CreateFolderAction and CreateFileAction are no longer needed (1GEAEV0)
Description: The CreateFolderAction and CreateFileAction classes in org.eclipse.ui.actions are no longer used;; since were sharing the NewWizardMenu in the navigator and packages view.; They should be deleted if not needed by WSA.; ; NOTES:

Title: Is a wizard necessary for new folder/new file? (1GEAF35)
Description: Having to go through a wizard to create a new folder or a new empty file seems; like a lot of fluff.  It would seem a lot easier to simply create the new folder with; New Folder as its name and enable the rename function immediately.; ; The reason for a wizard is usually because there are other properties that the user; must enter; but this is not the case for a folder/empty file.  Create a folder in Windows; to see what I mean.  There may be some technical reason for the folder wizard that I; am not aware of.; ; NOTES:

Title: New project wizard: tab goes to Cancel before Next (1GEAGBQ)
Description: - File / New / Project; - Give focus to project types list; - Hit tab; - It goes to the Cancel button instead of the Next button.; - Hit tab again; - It goes to the Next button.; - Choose a project type and hit Next.; - Enter a project name.; - Hit tab twice.; - It goes to the Finish button.; - Hit tab again.; - It goes to the Back button.; - Hit tab again.; - It goes to the Finish button again.; - Theres no way of tabbing to the Next or Cancel button.; ; Tabbing should follow a top-down; left-to-right order; and should not skip any selectable widgets.; ; ; ; ; NOTES:

Title: [Import/Export] Import dialog should allow the user to select MY Computer. (1GEAGDF)
Description: In Unix all HD are mounted as a directory under /.; 	In Window you have c: ; d: etc which makes it impossible to ; 	import files from c: and d: at the same time.; ; 	When the user click Browse to select a directory it open a dialog ; 	with all roots c: d: etc. We shoud let the user select desktop for example; 	and show the roots in the import dialog.; ; 	; ; NOTES:

Title: Tab doesnt work in new project wizard (1GEAG7W)
Description: - new workbench; - Choose File / New / Project; - None of the widgets have focus in the wizard page.; - Hit tab.; - It has no effect.; ; The first input widget should have focus by default.; Tab should go to the next one.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Task list shows animation of columns resizing when opening (1GEAGT7)
Description: - start the workbench with a resource perspective open; - notice that when the task list opens; you see the columns scrolling out to their preferred size.; - close the task list; - reopen it; - see the same effect; ; It should just open with the columns at the right size.; The user should not see any resizing going on.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 11:35:04 AM); 	Looks horrid on Linux; and slow machines.

Title: Property page title drawn incorrectly? (1GEAH4C)
Description: - select a resource and choose Properties from pop-up menu; - notice that the page titles are drawn with a light blue IBM gradient; with a dark line near the bottom; ; followed by a light line again; ; Is this as it should be?; ; NOTES:

Title: Inconsistent margins in property pages (1GEAH7U)
Description: Create a Java project; and choose Properties.; Flip through the property pages.; Some have no margins; with their widgets starting in the top left corner of the page.; Others have a small margin.; E.g. Info has them; but Managing doesnt.; ; They generally look better with a margin; but either way we should be consistent.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Wizards] New folder dialog: text for parent folder (1GEAHDM)
Description: The text for the parent folder should be Enter or select the parent folder instead of Enter or select the folder; to distinguish it from the folder being created.; ; NOTES:

Title: Should have mnemonic for Open Perspective (1GEAHG0)
Description: In the navigator; the Open Perspective menu item has no mnemonic.; Should use: Open &Perspective.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] New Project dialog does not prime Browse buttons the first time (1GEAHGE)
Description: When you select Browse for the first time from a New Project dialog no directory is preselected.; It should select the default locations directory; ; NOTES:; ; SA (10/9/2001 3:12:18 PM); 	I disagree. When you hit the Browse button; the directory dialog should be primed with the; 	content of the Location field in the wizard page. It so happen the first time the Browse; 	button is pressed; the Location field is empty.; ; 	Beside; priming the dir dialog with the default location would be of no use to the user; 	as this directory will be rejected by core (custom location dir cannot overlap with the; 	default location).; ; 	Waiting for TC to confirm this PR can be closed.

Title: Opening PDF files. (1GEAHMI)
Description: If we open a pdf file in the IE it will open the acrobat embeded in the IE.; 	; 	If we open it in the Workbenck it open the acrobat as a separed application.; 	Shouldnt we open it embeded as well.; 	; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 3:06:08 PM); 	Acrobat Reader has special support being a plugin in IE or Netscape.; 	Its not free OLE behavior.

Title: Order of Pages in folder is not preserved (1GEAHVY)
Description: 1. Arrange the views in a perspective as follows ..; ; 	Left side .. Folder with Hierarchy; then Packages; 	Middle .. Editor Area; 	Right side .. Folder with Outline; then Tasks; ; 2. Bring Packages to top.; 3. Bring Tasks to top.; 4. Save As Test.; 5. Close perspective.; 6. Open Test in same window; ; Result: ; ; 	Left side .. Folder with Packages; then Hierarchy; 	Middle .. Editor Area; 	Right side .. Folder with Tasks; then Outline	; ; NOTES:

Title: New folder silently creates parent (1GEAI0A)
Description: - New project A; - in filesystem; delete A; - in Navigator; select A and create new folder B; - it works; and in the filesystem it has recreated A; under which is B; ; Is this as it should be?  I think this behaviour is actually preferable to giving an error dialog.; But maybe it should warn that the parent folder has been deleted; and offer to recreate it;; giving the user the chance to cancel it.; Otherwise; it feels like the environment has discovered that it was out of synch; but hasnt bothered; to tell the user.  If there were other resources in the parent; they would still be showing in the navigator;; but would not exist in the filesystem.  If it prompts; it could do a refresh local too if the user accepts recreating the parent.; ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/25/01 12:25:52 PM) See also 1GEAICC: ITPUI:WIN98 - New folder complains if folder already exists in file system

Title: [Dialogs] Goto resource dialog should handle up and down. (1GEAI35)
Description: The goto resource dialog shoud handle up and down arrows and change; 	the selected resource in the resource list pane.; ; NOTES:

Title: SEVERE: UI is difficult when trying to open an out-of-synch file (1GEAL61)
Description: - new file B.txt; - change B.txt in the filesystem; - open B.txt in Eclipse; - it gives an error dialog: Problems Opening Editor / File has changed since ; last synchronization.; ; A: This case will happen often; B: What is synchronization?  We dont use that term in the UI anymore.; C: It doesnt show how to rectify the situation.  How is a novice user supposed ; to know to do a refresh local?; D: Its not necessary.  Theres only one content which can be seen in the ; editor.  It could just do a refresh for you and open it.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/25/01 1:25:37 PM) ; 	Are there any disadvantages to just doing a refresh?  Need to check ; with a Core person.; ; DS (5/29/01 8:43:27 PM); 	I will write an operation to do a refresh ( with user confirmation ) if ; the resource has; 	changed.  This operation can be reused throughout desktop in open ; editor; copy; move;; 	delete; etc.; ; 	Out of sync states to deal with = modify; delete; ; DS (5/29/01 9:24:37 PM); 	According to Rodrigo there is no way to see if a file is out of sync.  ; Perhaps it would; 	involve doing everything a localRefresh does; but without doing the ; localRefresh.; ; KH (5/30/2001 2:50:50 PM); 	Local refresh will cause builders to run. We should NOT do this for ; free.

Title: SEVERE: UI is difficult when trying to save an out-of-synch file (1GEALEF)
Description: - new file B.txt; - modify it in the editor; but dont save; - change B.txt in the filesystem; - save B.txt in Eclipse; - it gives an error dialog: Save problems / Internal Error: Reason: File has ; changed since last synchronization.; ; A: This case will happen often; B: What is synchronization?  We dont use that term in the UI anymore.; C: It doesnt show how to rectify the situation.  How is a novice user supposed ; to know to do a refresh local?; D: Its not an internal error.  Eclipse didnt fail (it is; however; failing to ; meet the users expectations.); E: It throws away the changes made in Eclipse!  This is really bad; as it loses ; the users work.  ; ; It should notify that the file has changed since it was opened; and offer to:; 	1 - save anyway; overwriting other changes; 	2 - abandon changes made in editor; 	3 - compare differences and merge; ; For 1 and 2; it should not really lose the other contents; but put them in the ; recycle bin or local history; so they can be recovered later if the user makes the wrong choice here; or ; needs them later.; ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/25/01 1:35:04 PM)	; 	Similar behaviour if file has been deleted in filesystem.; 	The editor contents are lost.; 	In this case; it should just save the editor contents.

Title: Editors not visible if there is not space (1GEALIZ)
Description: If you try and open an editor in the resource perspective and there currently is no open space ; the editor will not be visible.; ; STEPS; 	1) Open the resources view; 	2) Expand the Resource Navigator until it fills the whole page	; 	3) Open an editor - it will not be visible; ; ; NOTES:; EG (5/25/01 9:47:52 PM); 	layout is controlled by ITPUI

Title: Inconsistent behavior when dragging view (1GEALKL)
Description: 1. Start in a resource perspective.; 2. Grab navigator title bar and begin drag.; 3. Drag cursor back over original spot; as if you changed your mind.; ; Result: Detach cursor appears.  It is impossible to cancel the drag or drop the view; where it originally was.  As soon as you release the cursor a detached window appears; and; you need to start another drag gesture to restore the view to its original place.; ; 4. Drag and drop navigator onto another view to create folder.; 5. Grab navigator title bar and begin drag.; 6. Drag cursor back over original spot; as if you changed your mind.; ; Result: This time the stack cursor appears.  The action is the same; but in this; scenario the user can drop the view back where it was.  ; ; I think users will be frustrated by the inconsistent treatment of these two; similar motions.  I also think that both features are good; and we should ; strive to enable both.  ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 2:26:32 PM) ; 	Esc cancels drag.

Title: [UI] Goto resource tries to show root folder (1GEAM6E)
Description: - new project A; - in navigator; choose Go To / Resource; - type A; ; It matches project A; but shows an empty string in the Folders box.; It should avoid showing root in the Folders box (but still enable the OK button).; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/25/01 1:48:56 PM); 	Need to be sure to handle case where A is both a project name and a folder or file name.; 	Currently it creates separate entries for these in Matching Resources since they have different types;; 	so projects will never show anything in the Folders box.; ; EJP (9/21/2001 3:29:06 PM); 	This was fixed by showing root as Workspace.; 	Should we remove it?

Title: Go to resource list flashes a lot (1GEAMGL)
Description: In the Go To / Resource dialog; it refreshes the list each time a key is pressed; even if the resulting list will be the same.; This causes it to flash noticeably each time.; The Go to Type dialog in the Java UI doesnt do this; and has a much better feel.; ; NOTES:

Title: OpenWith should be disable if the file is already opened. (1GEANSE)
Description: Open a plugin.xml file.; 	- It will open the Plugin Manifest Editor; 	Popup menu - Open With -> Default Text Editor.; ; 	Nothing will happen.; 	We could:; 		- disable the open with menu option; 		- open a second editor; 		- tell the user that there is already a editor opened in that file.	; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 2:27:35 PM); 	This should activate the editor if it was already open.

Title: [Navigator] Deleting resource in Navigator should select next item (1GEAOO3)
Description: - new project A; - new file B.txt under A; - new file C.txt under A; - delete B.txt; - the selection is cleared; and C.txt has focus; - delete C.txt; - the selection is cleared; and A has focus; ; When an element is deleted; the next sibling should be selected.; If there is no next sibling; the parent should be selected.; If there are multiple items selected; it should use the focus item to decide which item is selected next.; That is; the next sibling of the focus item (after deletion) or its parent if none.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/25/01 3:27:30 PM); 	Note that this simplifies keyboard operation too.; 	Its also consistent with Windows Explorer.

Title: Accelerator text for Perspective Next and Prev should be changed (1GEAR9L)

Title: Confusion using Other Extensions on import/export (1GEJZJE)
Description: This DCR has been reported before; but I could not find the PR to add notes to.; ; - when using the import/export wizards; click Select Types....; - in the Other Extensions field; you must enter extensions as jpg; htm etc...; - this was not obvious to me; the preset file types are all listed as *.class; *.java; - until I was told how it actually works; I thought this feature was broken; I think most users will assume the *. is required.; ; Future Design Change:; 	accept (htm); (.htm); (*.htm); or even (home.htm) input types.; ; Temperary possible usability improvements:; i. list all the preset files as (class); (jav); (java) etc... this doesnt look as good though; but at least it would imply how to enter Other Extensions.; -or-; ii. in the Other Extensions text field; have abc there by default indicating how; to enter additional types.; -or-; iii. if the user clicks OK and there is an invalid extension; pop-up a dialog; i.e. myFile.*.htm; myFile..htm are invalid files; this is how *.htm and .htm are; currently being interpreted as.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Copy/Move Folders/Files issues (1GEASN1)
Description: PR marked SEVERE due to internal error in scenario 3 below; ; Scenario 1:; ; - create new project A; - new folder B under A; - select B; - choose Copy; ; Dialog title should be Copy Folder.; Label text should be Select the destination for B.; ; - select B in dialog; - hit OK; - get error dialog: Copy Problems / Problems occurred copying the selected resources; - hit Details; - see Destination should not be under resources hierarchy.; Which destination? Which resources hieararchy?  What should I do about it?; ; Ideally it wouldnt let me pick the same folder or any of its descendants.; This is easy to do with the viewers.; ; ; Scenario 2:; ; - create project C; - in file system; create folder B under C; - select project B in navigator; - choose Copy; - select C; - hit OK; - get error dialog: Copy Problems / Problems occurred copying the selected resources; - hit Details; - see Resource already exists in local file system.; Which resource?  What should I do about it?; ; ; Scenario 3:; ; - refresh C so that C/B shows up; - select project B in navigator; - choose Copy; - select C; - hit OK; - get prompt: Resource Exists / F/C/B exists.  Do you wish to overwrite?; - hit No; - get error dialog: Copy Problems / Internal error: Invalid thread access (no stack dump in .log); - hit OK; - get error dialog: Copy Problems / Problems occurred copying the selected resources; - hit Details; - see Resource already exists in local file system.; Which resource?  What should I do about it?; ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/25/01 4:59:58 PM); 	Same problems for copying files.; 	Same problems for Move.; ; EJP (5/29/01 9:14:28 PM); 	A fix to the severe problem is in:; 		CopyResourceAction :: org.eclipse.ui.actions 0.114 [ejp: 1GEASN1] 04; 	Not going to move this PR to fixed since there are a lot of low priority fixes; 	to be done.

Title: Navigator: New does not give container when multi-selected (1GEAURV)
Description: - select two resources in the navigator; - pop-up the context menu; - New is available; - choose File; - the container is not filled in; ; There are several options:; 	1. Dont include New if multiple selection ; 		- This doesnt apply to File / New though.; 		- Should still be able to do New Project since it doesnt use selection.; 	2. Pick first element in selection to derive container.; 	3. Pick the common container of the elements.; 		- Works OK if files selected; but could be confusing if folders selected; 		- Doesnt work if projects selected.; ; Option 2 seems simplest.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/25/01 4:54:46 PM); 	Note that the plugin.xml specifies a selection type of IResource for New Folder and New File;; 	but they dont specify the cardinality of the selection.; 	Can wizards do this?  If so; the New menu needs to be smarter than the proposals above.

Title: [Navigator] [UI] Canceling rename due to conflict changes selection (1GEAVIG)
Description: - new basic project A; - new folder A/B; - new file A/C.txt; - rename B to C.txt; - No to overwrite prompt; - it changes the selection to C.txt; ; Also; the selection is grayed even though the Navigator is still active.; Looks like the tree didnt regain focus properly; perhaps due to cancelling editor.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/25/01 5:14:21 PM); 	Also note that when the overwrite prompt comes up; the navigator shows the old name for the resource being renamed.; 	That is; it shows B where the user just changed it to C.txt.; ; EJP (9/24/2001 11:26:38 AM); 	We do have the overwrite prompt now but we are still changing the selection; 	with No is pressed.; ; EJP (9/24/2001 11:40:46 AM); 	The problem is in ResourcenavigatorRenameAction>>#runWithNewPath.; 	It changes the selection indepedent of the result of the super.runWithNewPath.; ; EJP (9/24/2001 11:54:54 AM); 	Have to add API so ResourcenavigatorRenameAction knows if the operation; 	was completed

Title: Refresh from dialog progress starts at 50% (1GEAWB7)
Description: In a good-sized workspace (e.g. containing Eclipse UI); clear the selection in the Navigator; and choose Refresh Local.; The progress dialog seems to start at past halfway; and only goes up to 75% before completion (auto-build is off).; ; Refreshing only the Eclipse UI project starts the progress at 0; but it seems to only go up to 30% or so.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Navigator Go Into redundant? (1GECWXO)
Description: Isnt Go Into redundant with Go To->Forward?; ; - It appears the only difference is that one works on the selected object and the other remembers what the last Go Into was on.; - There is no icon for Go Into; just for Go Forward; - It seems a waste of a popup menu entry to have both Go Into and Go To.; For larger products the navigator menu could get long; and Go Into is an infrequent operation also supported by toolbar icons.; ; Q: Whats the difference between Back and Up?  The tooltips are unhelpful.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (05/28/01 2:43:39 PM); 	Go Into is not the same as Forward.   Up and Back are also different.; 	Go Into changes the input to the current selection.  ; 	Forward goes forward in the history (opposite of Back).; 	Up changes the input to be the parent of the current input (independent of the selection); ; 	adding to the history rather than going back in the history.; 	Back; Forward and Up work similarly to Explorer.; ; 	Theres no icon for Go Into; because I felt that toolbar icons should apply to the whole view; independent of the selection.; 	Go Into and Go To are separate entries because I didnt want the user to have to select Go To; then Into.; 	I agree Back and Forward will likely not be used from the menu often; but they are there for completeness.; 	The Go To menu would have to be there anyway; for Go To / Resource.

Title: (potential usability?) Perspective preference on drugs (1GECXF8)
Description: The preference for what happens when you open a new perspective messes with ; your mind; because it changes the meaning of Shift and Alt.  I understand yould like to ; reuse these;; but I suspect it introduces a pretty wierd usability problem.  This only works ; if you believe youll; only ever change this setting ONCE in your life; otherwise you have to remember ; that the keys; now do something different.; ; People get used to what hot keys do and then they pick them automatically.  ; Changing their meaning; forces them to retrain this automatic action.; ; ; NOTES:; ; KH (9/19/2001 11:27:10 AM); 	Others also complained about not being able to find this capability. ; (Did not think to look in preferences page)

Title: IDialogConstants.CANCEL_LABEL missing shortcut key (1GEEACW)
Description: Should be &Cancel in NLS file.; ; NOTES:

Title: Usability: Can not change Z-order of Detached view.  (1GEEFJY)
Description: MF (5/27/01 3:10:46 PM) ; 		I might be missing something obvious here; but how can you make a perspective window; 		move in front of (cover) a detached view window?; 		Here is a usability scenario: ; 		I have my search results in the Java perspective as a detached window. I want to be able to click; 		on a search result and go back to the code; hiding the search results in the background. ; 		Currently; the search window stays in the front of the z-order; even if it looses focus.; ; 		Maybe this should be a Workbench Preference option that the user can select.;   ; ; NOTES:

Title: Filter dialog wording inconsistent/confusing (1GEEW34)
Description: There are several places in the UI where the user uses a dialog to specify filters:; ; 	1) Click the Filter tool in the Tasks view toolbar.; 		Notice that the dialog that comes up says: Show entries of type; 		Notice that checked items in the checkbox tree will be *SHOWN*.; ; 	2) Click the little down arrow menu in the Navigator or Packages toolbar; and select Filters...; 		Now here; the dialog says: Select filters to apply  (this could be confusing to users - does apply hide or show?); 		And the checked items in the list will be *HIDDEN*.; ; 	It would be more consistent if the Navigator/Packages filter dialog said something like: Show files of type; 	and then the user would know that checked items in the checkbox list will be shown.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Editor Mgmt] Usability: open editors are difficult to manage (1GEFRTU)
Description: EG (5/28/01 2:35:17 PM); 	The managment of multiple open editors is still a severe usability problem. A common; 	practice is to do a close all editors periodically. There were several proposals for how; 	to address this issue and I dont want to repeat them; but Id like; 	that this problem is reconsidered.; 	; 	; ; NOTES:

Title: Error opening the examples property page on a Project (1GELFZD)
Description: When you select the Properties Example all resources page of the Properties for a Project; you get an error dialog which states; ; Uable to created the selected property page.; ; Reason:; Plug-in org.eclipse.examples.ui.extension.properties was unable to load class ; org.eclipse.examples.ui.extensions.properties.ResourcePage; ; Ditto for properties examples; ; ; NOTES:; ; CE (6/1/01 12:09:25 PM); 	fixed in 116 drop. to verify

Title: Extension should be assumed when exporting (1GEK3EL)
Description: This should probably move to SWT; I will let KH decide.; ; When exporting to a JAR; the user must enter the extension manually.; ; Steps:; 1) Make sure you have a project in your workspace; 2) menu: File->Export...; 3) select JAR file; click Next; 4) select some resources to export; 5) where it says Where do you want to export resources to? click; browse...; 6) you will get a save dialog; ensure *.jar is selected for Save as type; 7) enter a file name myProject (without including an extension); click Save; ; The expected behavior is to save the JAR as myProject.jar; instead it is saved; without an extension.; ; If you goto export again; you will notice the combo box remembers your previous; save; but it added the .jar for you this time.; ; To see the expected behavior; run Microsoft Word; goto Save As... and enter a file; without the extension; the file will save with the .doc extention.; ; NOTES:; JEL (30/05/2001 4:50:05 PM); 	When the user clicks Finish; if the file string does not end with .jar it should be; appended.  If the user wishes to save without the extension (s)he should be allowed to; edit the text field within the wizard.

Title: Enable/disable menu items when no page open? (1GEG1VT)
Description: Someone needs to review all the menu items in the menubar and determine; 	which should be enabled when the workbench window has no open pages.; ; 	NOTE: There is a difference in which menu items are enabled/disabled; 	depending on how you get to have no open pages!!! Try this...; 		1) Close all perspectives. Now note which menu items are enabled/disabled; 			in the menu bar.; 		2) With all perspectives closed; shutdown the workbench and start it up again.; 			Notice that some menu items which were disabled are now enabled and vice-versa!; 		A good example of this is the File->New menu item. Its disabled after a close; 		all perspective; but after the workbench restart; its enabled.; ; NOTES:

Title: New project wizard bases icon on the closed icon (1GEG3RS)
Description: The New project wizard has an icon based on the closed project icon which is not how it ; would appear to the user.; ; STEPS; 	1) Select New->Project. Look at the icon for Project; ; ; NOTES:; 	EJP (6/25/01 3:06:48 PM); 		Same on Windows.

Title: [Viewers] POST-RELEASE: Investigate how often label is obtained (1GEGYSS)
Description: JA says:; ; I have noticed while using the version label annotations that getLabel() is called with ; very high frequency in the navigator.  It seems like it might be doing excessive work.  ; The VCM label decoration isnt too expensive; but when invoked frequently; it may contribute ; to general loss of responsiveness in the UI.  ; For example; just changing the selection in the navigator asks for the labels again.  ; Also; during notification phases; getLabel is called frequently.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/29/01 12:04:37 AM); Thanks; Ill take a look.  It shouldnt be doing this just when the selection changes; ; unless one of the selection listeners on the viewer is interested.; Actually; it might be the forward/back/up buttons updating their tooltips.  But Ill investigate.

Title: Build Problems Error Dialog (1GEHGWD)
Description: Got the following Build Problems Dialog:; ; ; 	Build Problems 		<== Title; ; 	Build problems 		<== Message; ; 	Errors during build.		<== detail message; ; ; 	This isnt very informative.; ; 	The reason for the build problem was the following walkback; ; ; java.lang.NullPointerException; 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.AbstractDataTreeNode.assembleWith(AbstractDataTreeNode.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.DeltaDataTree.basicCompare(DeltaDataTree.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.DeltaDataTree.compareWith(DeltaDataTree.java:258); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDeltaFactory.computeDelta(ResourceDeltaFactory.java:22); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager.getDelta(BuildManager.java:265); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.InternalBuilder.getDelta(InternalBuilder.java:45); 	at org.eclipse.core.resources.IncrementalProjectBuilder.getDelta(IncrementalProjectBuilder.java:145); 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.builder.impl.JavaBuilder.checkIncrementalBuild(JavaBuilder.java:105); 	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.builder.impl.JavaBuilder.build(JavaBuilder.java:47); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$1.run(BuildManager.java:44); Title: Text editor should use icon to show dirty state (1GEHS24)

Title: Copy & Move should be disabled when closed (1GEHVNK)
Description: It is not possible to copy or move a project when it is closed; so the commands; should be disabled.; ; Steps:; 1) create a new project; 2) in the Navigator; right click on the project and click Close Project; 3) right click on the project and click Copy Project; 4) enter a new name and click OK; ; The workbench will not allow this action; so the menu item should be disabled; for this item; or it should be allowed.; ; NOTES:

Title: [EditorMgmt] Need more control on launching external editors  (1GEHWEH)
Description: Registering an external editor in a plug-in manifest file needs to allow the developer to; specify where the selected file resource goes in the command using something like %f. ; It cant always go at the end.; ; NOTES:

Title: [JFace Text] Java Editor: doesnt detect file modification (1GEHXFZ)
Description: Java Editor doesnt detect external file change and also uses the old contents.; Notice that Default Editor doesnt have this problem.; ; 1. Create a project and a java file( .java ); 2. Close the java file.; 3. Using NotePad; modify the java file. Be sure to save it.; 4. In Navigator; rightclick the java file; Open With->Java Editor. ; 	Notice that it shows the old contents. It doesnt detect the file change; either.; 5. This time; do an Open With->default editor.; 	Notice that it gives you the normal error message.; ; NOTES:; ; KUM (5/30/01 8:37:17 PM); 	Cannot reproduce on 114+.; 	Seems to work because of 1GEJWB3: ITPCORE:ALL - IFile.setContents. Must be revisited.; ; WC(07/06/2001 6:44:41 PM); 	Fixed. Verified on 119 JDK

Title: Copy project dialog problems (1GEIKGH)

It looks like it could be creating a new project.); ; NOTES:

Title: Need way to cancel an operation that doesnt specify fork= true (1GEJ66W)
Description: Is it possible to execute an operation in a wizard that is called with context.run(false; true; op) and has the cancel button; 	enabled.; ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (5/30/01 10:19:19 AM); 	No; this is not possible since the UI is not running to check the cancel button.

Title: API diff between CoreException & WorkbenchException (1GEJK3L)
Description: WorkbenchException inherits from CoreException. CoreException has a method; 	getStatus() that; according to the doc; will always return some type of IStatus object; 	(i.e it will not be null).; ; 	This is not the case with WorkbenchException and PartInitException - they do not; 	always have a status object.; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR: Would like coupled horizontal scrolling in compare browser (1GEJNHO)
Description: JDK 0.114 W2K; ; The compare differences browser permits coupled vertical scrolling but not coupled; horizontal scrolling -- this would be nice to have.

Title: IAction id field not initialized by default when created as part of an action set (1GEJVE8)
Description: An IAction object is created for each element of an action set specified by plugin.xml.; 	IAction has a getId() member that should return the ID of the object (or null).  It seems;; 	however; that regardless of having specified an ID in the plugin.xml for the action or not;; 	getId() always returns null.; ; 	A workaround for this problem is simply to implement the IExecutableExtension interface; 	and set the field yourself (thanks Dave!); but the problem should be corrected; or else if it; 	is by design; then the JavaDoc should be clarified.; ; 	JB (30/05/2001 1:45:23 PM); ; NOTES:

Title: Undo does not jump to undone location (1GEK1G5)
Description: When you undo something; the undo action is performed but the position at which the; 	operation occurred is not made visible in the active editor view.; ; 	To reproduce:; 	Double-click on a (fairly large) *.java resource to open an editor view.; 	Make some changes spread throughout the file on distict visible screen pages.; 	Hit undo (Ctrl-Z; context-menu or menuitem) several times.; 	Note that though the changes have been undone; the editor view was not; 		scrolled to each change as it was undone.  It may be difficult to see that the changes; 		were undone as there was no visual confirmation that the undo action took place.; ; 	JB (30/05/2001 3:57:26 PM); NOTES:

Title: Undoing all changes does not revert file to unchanged state (1GEK1OY)
Description: To see the problem:; 	Double-click on a resource to open an editor.; 	Make some changes.; 	Undo all the changes.; 	Note that the * still appears by the name of the file in the editor tab; and that; 		the Save button has not been greyed out.; ; 	Many text editors provide visual confirmation that all unsaved changes have been; 	undone by restoring whatever visual cues onscreen it uses to show that a file has been; 	saved.  This makes the current behaviour somewhat counter-intuitive by comparison.; ; 	JB (30/05/2001 4:01:03 PM); ; NOTES:

Title: Find/Replace dialog discards old search text even if there is no current selection (1GEK29U)
Description: The Find/Replace dialog has a feature that allows it to grab the currently selected; 	text [in an editor] for use as the default Find string and the Replace string is discarded.; ; 	However; if no text is currently selected; the old Find and Replace string should not be; 	discarded in the dialog.; ; 	To reproduce:; 	Double-click on a *.java resource in the navigator to open an editor for it.; 	Select some text then hit Ctrl-F.; 	Note that the selected text appears in the Find field as expected.; 	Type something in the Replace field.; 	Close the dialog.; 	Clear the selection (click somewhere else).; 	Hit Ctrl-F; 	Note that both the Find field and the Replace field have been cleared.; ; 	Apparently this is not the same behaviour as that of Leapfrog and other; 	text editors.; ; 	JB (30/05/2001 4:16:18 PM); ; NOTES:

Title: [Standard Components] Flash in tasklist (1GENDMI)
Description: Popup the menu in the tasklist; New Task; Note that when the task appears; the checkbox (second column) flashes many times.; ; NOTES:; EJP (06/27/01 02:47:39 PM); 	Could not reproduce it in the build 125

Title: Eclipse icon has too bright pixels in bottom left corner (1GELFKF)
Description: The new Eclipse icon; seen in the window title and in the task tray;; has some bright pixels in the bottom left corner; which make it look not as clean as it could be.; ; NOTES:

Title: Font selection issues (1GEKDHR)
Description: This is not strictly a Workbench issue...; ; I have counted no less than 4 different preference pages in which I can set the font of different; editors; consoles; ...  I would not be surprised if there are more.  Since normal users experience; at least 2-3 of these editors; consoles; ... shouldnt there be one place to go and find out the ; default font?  If individual plugins want to allow their editors to have different fonts; they can ; still allow people to set it but if the user does not; the UI default should take effect.; ; NOTES:

Title: Copy file dialog default size too small (1GEKFJH)
Description: To reproduce:; 	In the Navigator; right-click on a resource and select copy.; 	Note the size of the dialog...; ; 	The dialog should try to fit the data in the tree horizontally and make an; 	effort to show a good 10-15 lines worth of information inside.  If adequate; 	default dimensions cannot be determined programmatically then the; 	dialog should store its size in persistence data so that the user need only; 	ever resize it once.; ; 	JB (30/05/2001 9:00:39 PM); NOTES:; EG (5/31/01 9:24:35 AM); 	Navigator is owned by ITPUI moving

Title: Fast View can be resized only once (1GELX93)
Description: Any view made a fast view can be resized once (by pulling the right edge).; 	This operation cannot be repeated second time with the same fast view.; ; ; NOTES:; ; SA (6/1/2001 1:49:16 PM); 	This could not be reproduce. I can resize the same fast view multiple times.; 	I tried this with build 0.115 plus loaded the lastest Eclipse UI changes (0.117).; ; KK (2001-06-01 15:03:38); 	In driver 0.116 for Linux (out of the box); the problem still exists.; 	Sometimes resize works 1 to 4 times; and then breaks.; 	Drag any view to make it a fast view; show it.  Position a mouse over; 	the right edge of the fast view.  The cursor changes to horizontal resize.; 	Drag the edge of the view left or right. Repeat the resize.; 	Eventually cursor will stop changing to resize cursor and resize is impossible.; 	Pinning the view and making it fast view again does not help (still cannot resize; 	that view).; 	I have found that if I move the mouse very slowly; I get more moves.; 	If I drag the mouse fast and release the edge; it is more likely to break then.; ; 	May be increasing mouse acceleration in preferences of your test machine can help; 	recreate the problem.; ; 	KK (6/3/2001 4:36:44 AM); 	Tried with driver 0.118 on another machine (RedHat 7.0); problem exists as well.

Title: [Tasks] The Tasks View does not add new tasks properly (1GENB0K)
Description: In some cases when adding tasks to the Task View; they are not added in the correct order.; There are various cases where this happens; here is one:; ; 1) Clear all the tasks; 2) click New Task in the Tasks View; 3) type 1; hit <Enter>; 4) click New Task; dont edit the name just hit <Enter>; 5) click New Task; type 2; hit <Enter>; 6) click New Task; dont edit the name just hit <Enter>; ; You will notice the task is not placed in the appropriate location.; ; NOTES:

Title: Workbench Action Smoke Tests (1GEPLU8)
Description: This is a test list for actions in the workbench.; ; File Actions ..; 	Invoke File New .. projects; items; other.; 	Invoke Toolbar button for File New .. projects; items; other.; 	Verify close and save action enablement with ; 		- no editors open; 		- one editor; 		- one dirty editor; 		- after revert; 		- two editors; 		- two dirty editors; 		- after close all; 	Verify actions when switching between pages ( one with dirty editor; other without ).; 	Verify after all pages closed.; 	Open many editors; close all; test MRU list.; 	Open an editor and try to print the contents.; 	; Edit Actions ..; 	Verify global actions track global part.; 	Verify editor contributions appear in action bars when is opened.; 	Verify editors of same type reuse contributions.; 	Verify editors of different type cause contribution change.; 	Verify editor contributions are removed when editor is closed.; 	Verify edit actions are consistent when switching between pages.; ; Perspective Actions ..; 	Open = always enabled; 	Verify other actions only enabled when a page is open.; 	Verify open new window; open new page; and replace with using shift and control; 		key options.; 	Verify Save As by modifying current persp; save as; close; reopen.; 	Verify Reset by modifying current persp; then reset.; 	Verify Preference page.; 	Hide Editors; Show Editors; 	Hide Editors; Open new editor; verify implicit show editors.; 	; Action Sets ..; 	Confirm order is consistent.  Add all actions; record order; then remove and re-add; 		select action sets to verify order.; 	Test Customization of File New; Perspective Open; and Show View.; 	Confirm editor actions have consistent place ..; 		- start with no editors; 		- show x action sets; 		- open editor; verify editor actions after sets; 		- hide x action sets; 		- show x action sets; 	Verify action set order persisted between sessions.; ; NOTES:

Title: Cannot export file after saving with system editor (1GENK9W)
Description: If you open a file with its system editor; you will not be able to export the file as it is not; in sync.  You will get an error Zip file must have at least one entry which is not the case.; If you do a refresh from local; the export will work.; ; Quick fix: Have a more generic error message Error(s) exporting.; ; Ideal fix:; 1) Do a refresh from local for all projects automatically when the user selects Export...; -or-; 2) Do a refresh from local for a single project when the user selects; expands; or checks the; project node.; ; Refresh from local is executed very fast when there are no files out of sync with the system; so I dont think the cost of doing this each time you export is that drastic.; It wouldnt hurt to pop up the Refreshing dialog to indicate to the user why the CPU is chugging; if there are many changes to catch up to.; ; NOTES:; ; KH (6/1/2001 2:10:01 PM); 	Auto-refresh is not a good idea. Builders may run. ; ; TC (6/2/01 11:31:47 AM) ; 	Deferred

Title: [Import/Export] No save prompt before exporting (1GENMDK)
Description: (Not a serious issue); Before entering the export wizard; the user should be prompted to save their work.  There is a good; chance the user is planning to export the file they are currently editing and could easily forget to save.; If they are exporting; the user rarely checks the contents of the jar/zip so the exported work may not; be what they desire.; ; Illustration:; 1) open a .java file in a project; 2) make some changes to the file; dont save; 3) File->export (file system); 4) select the java file you were editing; export to your desktop; 5) open the java file; note that your changes are not in the file; ; ; ; NOTES:

Title: New File/Folder should be disabled when no projects (1GF0OJN)
Description: If you try to create a new file or folder when you have no projects in your workspace;; the wizard cannot finish.  These commands should be disabled when there are no open; projects available.; ; This means that if you have a project in your workspace but it is in a closed state; the; actions should not be available.; ; NOTES:; JEL (08/06/2001 3:39:36 PM); 	This issue also affects Java projects and the new package/class/interface actions.

Title: Cannot open file in default text editor (1GENOZ5)
Description: 1) Select a non-java file in one of your projects.  ; 2) right click and select open with Default Text editor; 3) observe that nothing happens; ; If you double click on the file it often will open in the defualt text editor unfortuantely some files have other; editors registered for them (e.g.; PDE and plugin.xml) so that does not help.; ; The net effect is that the platform cannot be used to edit files using just the default editor.  Bummer.; ; NOTES:; ; TC (6/6/01 10:40:03 AM) - cannot replicate; TC (9/18/2001 4:14:36 PM) - cannot replicate in build 135

Title: Action Set Actions appear in reverse order (1GENP9K)
Description: If the actions within an action set are declared as 1; 2; 3; they appear in the; workbench window as 3; 2; 1.; ; NOTES:; ; DS (6/1/01 3:20:46 PM); 	To fix this reverse the flag in PluginActionSetBuilder where findInsertionPoint is; 	called.; ; SA (6/1/2001 9:27:22 PM); 	The code has been changed and waiting to be verified & released

Title: [JFace Text] Text selection off by one when double clicking on a task (1GENPCI)
Description: If you add a task to a file and then reopen the file from the Tasks view the selection will be one character too short; ; STEPS; 	1) Create a text file; 	2) Add a task; 	3) Close and save the text file; 	4)  Double click on the task on the tasks view; 	5) It will open be the selection will be off by one.; ; ; NOTES:; ; TC (6/1/01 3:31:09 PM) - same problem for Bookmarks

Title: [PropertiesView] Properties not updated when file saved (1GENPH2)
Description: - show properties view; - new text file test.txt; - type some text and save; - notice that the properties arent updated; ; The last modified and size properties should be updated.; ; If you reselect the file in the navigator; the properties update.; ; NOTES:; ; 	KH (9/19/2001 2:34:40 PM); 		Duplicate

Title: Cant re-associate files to the OLE editor (1GENPQ0)
Description: When you first add a file to your project in a Windows platform; it will open the OLE editor inside; Eclipse.  The problem comes if you associate the file to be opened by the system editor (or; anything else for that matter) there is no known way to re-associate that file to the OLE editor.; ; steps:; 1) create a new project MyProject; 2) create a new file pic.bmp; -MS Paint should open here as an OLE (or what ever you have bmps associated to; 3) right click on pic.bmp and select Open With -> System Editor; -now you cant open bmps with the OLE editor unless you restart eclipse.; ; NOTES:; ; TC (6/2/01 10:51:02 AM) - this is because the system editor works differently than the ; internal editor that we look up. This is a big change with very little value added and; should be deferred.

Title: workbench action example does not run (1GENQ7V)
Description: Two problems here:; 1. example does not run; 2. a com.ibm name is referenced in a plugin ; Fixing one should fix the other.; ; STEPS:; -start the dev image; -run org.eclipse.core.launcher.UIMain to open the Eclipse platform; -click on the toolbar button that looks like a pencil.  The hover help reads:; 	Example of Workbench Action; the following is printed to the Console:; ; Could not create action.; Reason:; Plug-in com.ibm.eclipse.examples.ui.extension.menus.workbench was unable to load class org.eclipse.examples.ui.extension.menus.workbench.FirstAction.; ; ; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Moving view has different reveal order than close (1GENS04)
Description: - new resource perspective; - show Bookmarks view; - it appears docked with Navigator and Repositories view; - close Bookmarks view; - the Navigator view is revealed; - show Bookmarks view; - drag it over outline view; - the Repositories view is revealed;  ; Its surprising that a different view is revealed for close and drag.; ; NOTES:

Title: Go to bookmark does not select whole line (1GENS5N)
Description: - new file Test.txt; - enter Test; - add bookmark to first line; - in bookmarks view; choose Go to File (or double-click); - it selects Tes; - add some more text to the first line; e.g. Test. This is a Test.; - in bookmarks view; choose Go to File again; - it selects Tes; ; Bookmark should remember just the line number; not the character range.; Go to File should just select the whole line.; Marker annotation model should only update line number if no character range recorded (not record a new range).; ; NOTES:; ; NE (06/01/01 4:40:03 PM); 	Same for tasks created in the ruler.

Title: Should be able to drag back fast views (1GENSQ5)
Description: - drag a view to the shortcut bar; - you cant drag it back; ; This is a logical way to undo the drag.; It should give me the drag outline; and have the same drop semantics as a regular view drop.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Perspective] Need to show something when all views closed (1GENTGJ)
Description: If you close all the views in the perspective; it remains open; but looks very bare;; and its not clear what the user can do next.; ; Simply closing the perspective is one option; though it might be surprising.; Another would be to show a view which lets you navigate to other perspectives; or close this one.; ; This is particularly bad for the Help perspective; since it only contains one view.; Clicking the help views close button is a natural thing to do when done with the help.; ; NOTES:; ; DS (6/6/01 11:39:44 AM); 	We can pop up a dialog asking the user what they want to do ..; 		1. Close perspective.; 		2. Do nothing.; 	It would also be good to have a disable button on the dialog; as in do not show again.; ; DS (6/6/01 3:07:35 PM); 	Basic implementation; sans dialog; in; 		>WorkbenchPage 0.119 [ds] 05

Title: [Perspectives] Minor - additional perspectives should have same layout as last (1GENTI5)
Description: If I change the layout of the Java perspective; I expect each new Java perspective that I open; 	to have the same layout as the last one.; ; 	Do I have to first save the changes to the perspective?; ; NOTES:; ; 	KJ - I have since found the Save as option... but it seems that window size is not one of the same items.; 		I just rearranged my debugger perspective but it doesnt remember the window size.

Title: Dragging view over separator detaches it (1GENTNR)
Description: - new Resource perspective; - drag Outline over Navigator to make one group on the left; - drag Tasks view over separator between left group and editors (so you get the Window cursor; not the left or right cursor); - drop it there; - it detaches the view; ; - it should place it between the group and the editors instead; ; You can get the desired effect by moving the cursor a bit more to the left or right;; so this is a strange non-linearity.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] File opening is confusing (1GENW09)
Description: The property sheet example registers an editor for .usr files; If I create a .usr file; the property sheet example editor is used to open the file.; Close the editor and do Open With>Default text editor; ; Bug 1 Note the tab has the icon for the property sheet editor not the Default text editor; (it is the default editor because it has no outline); ; Now close the editor and double click the file; it opens with the defualt text editor again.; ; When did I ask to change the default (double click) editor to the Default system editor?; All I did was an open with.; ; This is probably working a designed because there is a check beside the default system editor (indicating; that it is the default?); ; But I find the design is confusing.; ; Changing the default editor for a file type should not be a side effect of performing an Open With; ; NOTES:

Title: cannot run wizard example (1GENWD2)
Description: It appears that the icon for New wizard is missing.; Upon closer examination; the path to the resource class seems to be incorrect ; (see stack trace).; ; Platform is looking for: org.eclipse.examples.ui.extension.wizard.resourcecreation; The directory on the file system is: org.eclipse.ui.examples.extension.wizard.resourcecreation; Maybe a jar file is missing from a plugins directory or the wrong qualification is specified when; calling the ClassCreationWizard class.; ; -run eclipse.exe; -File-> New-> Other; select the Other category; 	Look at Wizard Example - I only see a red square.; -select Wizard Example and click on Next; you get an error.; ; Log: Fri Jun 01 17:49:41 EDT 2001; Title: [Preferences]  Need test suite entry for failed preference page.
Description: - new Java project; - go to project properties; - go through pages in order; skipping Java build path one (see 1GEP48U: ITPJUI:WIN98 - SEVERE - NPE opening build path page); - after the JRE page; they stop showing properly (although their title shows); - note that some of these are non-JUI pages (e.g. Managing); - if you reopen the properties dialog; and go through them in reverse order; they appear; except for Java info; - if you reopen and select Java info; it works.; ; Seems to be caused by JRE page.; ; Theres no error dialog; or anything in the .log.; ; Filed in ITPUI since its unclear whether this caused by a UI or JUI problem.; But UI should be resilient enough to not affect other pages if caused by a JUI problem.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (6/2/01 10:37:51 AM); 	See also 1GEP4ZL: ITPJUI:WIN98 - SEVERE - JRE properties page throws off other pages; ; KH (6/5/2001 2:17:46 PM); 	JUI team fixed their probem. Still need to handle error case better.

Title: Properties page missing project info (1GEPD0E)
Description: jkca (6/2/2001 9:50:40 AM); 	jre-sdk 117; ; The project properties page from the packages view is missing the project info; page (path; last modified; read only; etc.).  This page can be found on the project; properties page in the navigator.; ; EG (6/3/2001 4:40:10 AM); 	the info page is specific to resources and currently cant be used; 	for IJavaElements. The preference should be generalized to support; 	objects that have underlying resources. In the same way as we have done; 	it for project references and the managing page. Once this is done we; 	could contribute the page for IJavaElements.; ; 	Notice; that this one missing feature that makes the Packages view; 	not equal with the Navigator. ; 	JM has complained about this to.; 	; 	Moving to ITPUI

Title: [UI] Popup menus sometimes stop working after tearing off views (1GEPISS)
Description: NOTES:; ; KH (6/4/2001 5:18:27 PM); 	Possibly caused by creating the view initially torn off then putting back into workbench?; ; KH (6/5/2001 10:47:59 AM); 	correct platform behavior -> calling setParent leaves widgets in wierd state. Need to; 	isolate steps. ; ; KH (6/7/2001 3:22:16 PM); 	Similiar problem for tooltips showing behind window. ; ; NE (6/15/01 10:26:21 AM); 	Menu problem explained in:; 		1GF0ZJ6: ITPUI:WIN2000 - SWTException: Navigator; 		1GF9NE7: ITPUI:WIN2000 - Context menus stop working when detached view is reattached; ; NE (6/15/01 12:16:06 PM); 	Readme doc:; 99.1.1 Pop-up menus stop working when detached view is reattached; ; When a view is initially created as a detached view; then is reattached to the main workbench window; its pop-up menu no longer works.; The workaround is to close and reopen the view.; The problem does not occur when a view is created in the main workbench window; then is detached; then is reattached.; ; ARCH (7/11/01 11:02:32 AM); 	Defer to 2.0

Title: Compare does not lazy load (1GEPO80)
Description: jkca (6/2/2001 3:52:51 PM); 	jre-sdk 117; ; The compare plugin does not lazy load.; ; To duplicate:; 1. Turn options on; 	org.eclipse.core.runtime/debug=true; 	org.eclipse.core.runtime/loader/debug/activateplugin=true; 2. New Project; 3. Right click the project; the compare plugin loads; ; NOTES; 	KM (6/2/01 5:12:58 PM); 		Moving to UI; ; AW (22.06.01 17:17:09); 	The Compare plugin load is triggered by the creation of VCM Merge action.; 	(VCM UI plugin depends on Compare plugin).; 	Moved to ITPVCM.; ; JohnA (6/26/2001 11:46:29 AM); 	Strange... the platform should not be loading any actions until they are first run.; 	Lazy loading is not our responsibility; were just well-behaved users of the platform.; 	Moving back to ITPUI.

Title: Full/Basic icons not managed when specified in extensions (1GERGGW)
Description: Our extensions contain lines like; 	   icon=icons/basic/ctool16/newprj_wiz.gif>; ; We are not managing the full/basic case (loading a different icon; depending on screen color depth) for these icons.; ; (there are other cases specifying only .../full/...); ; NOTES:; ; KH (6/5/2001 11:17:07 AM); 	Would be even better if we could ignore low color devices.

Title: DCR:URL on about should be hyperlink (1GESIZJ)
Description: URL (www.apache.org and www.eclipse.org) should be hyperlink in the Help->About dialog; (so I can click on them ); ; NOTES:

Title: [Tasks] Checking tasks in task view doesnt feel right (1GESVB2)
Description: 1. In order to check a task (i.e. fill in the checkmark beside it) in the task view requires; 		two clicks. One to select the task and a second to check it. It should require only; 		one; most checkbox-tables Ive used do not require you to select the item prior to checking it.; ; 	2. The response on the check click is very slow; it takes over a second for the checkmark to; 		appear. It should be fairly instantaneous.; ; NOTES:

Title: Copy file does not ask to same first (1GESYDE)
Description: Open an editor on a file (f1.txt for example); 	Modify the file but do not save.; 	Now copy the file into another folder/project; ; 	You are not prompted to save youre current changes.; ; NOTES:

Title: D&D started on editor after file deleted (1GESZ0Z)
Description: - edit a file (like f1.txt); 	- make changes in the editor but do not save them; 	- go to the nav view and delete the file you are editing (f1.txt); 	- now click on the editor tab of the file you deleted (f1.txt); 	- you are prompted to save changes because the file does not; 	exist anymore; do so; 	- now move you move to the empty tab area on the workbook; ; 	==> notice a D&D outline is not visible.; ; NOTES:

Title: Editor does not always detect file deleted (1GESZEB)
Description: - open an editor on a file and make changes; 	- from the nav view delete the file; 	- click on the editor tab of the file just deleted; ; 	Usually; you get a dialog saying the file was deleted and would you; 	like to save the changes. But sometimes it does not show this dialog.; 	I think it has to do with how fast you are between hitting del key in; 	nav view to delete file and clicking on the editor tab. It seems if you do; 	so before the operation is done; you never get the dialog.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: POST-RELEASE: Bugs in StringMatcher (1GET09O)
Description: There are two bugs in StringMatcher.; ; match(...) should match the whole string.  find(...) can find any occurrence.; A pattern of  should only match the empty string.; For example: new StringMatcher(ab; false; false).match(abz) is false;; so new StringMatcher(; false; false).match(z) should be false too; but its currently true.; ; This is due to the segCount == 0 test; which should check whether there are actually wildcards before returning true.; The next two tests check for empty target and empty pattern; but theyre not currently reached.; ; I also noticed another bug; where if ignoreWildcards is true; it doesnt check the length.; So new StringMatcher(a; false; true).match(ab) currently returns true; but it should return false.; ; The corrected lines are:; 		if (fIgnoreWildCards); 			return (end - start == fLength) && fPattern.regionMatches(fIgnoreCase; 0; text; start; fLength);; 		int segCount = fSegments.length;; 		if (segCount == 0 && (fHasLeadingStar || fHasTrailingStar))  // pattern contains only *(s); 			return true;; ; NOTES:; ; NE (9/28/01 12:16:59 PM); 	See also 1GKQ0XA: ITPJUI:WINNT - Text search for   gives results for s; 	Should add test case for:; 		u .toUpperCase() -> USS; 	Another example; from http://www.unicode.org/Public/UNIDATA/CaseFolding.txt; 		MASSE and Ma e ; 	See http://www.unicode.org/unicode/reports/tr21/; 	for discussion on case mappings.; ; NE (10/2/01 2:24:13 PM); 	Fixed in > 202a; for StringMatcher in org.eclipse.ui.views.navigator.

Title: Usability: import selects nothing (1GET09S)
Description: DW (6/4/01 11:05:52 AM); 	118; ; 	I selected a project; and then used the import wizard to import from the file; 	system. When I selected a directory to import; it appears in the wizard;; 	but by default; no files are selected for import. I chose the directory; so; 	it should select all files in the directory by default.

Title: [Navigator] Goto Resource dialog does not clear In Folders list (1GET0ZY)
Description: From the Goto Resources dialog (from popup menu in nav view on a resource);; 	if you type a resource that does not exist; the Matching Resources list is empty; 	but the In Folders list is not.; ; NOTES:

Title: Close Project menu-item only on Navigator context menu; not Packages (1GET29F)
Description: Right-click on a Project icon in the Packages view.; 	Notice that the Open/Close Project menu-items do not appear here.; 	Do the same thing on a Project icon in the Navigator view.; 	Notice that these menu-items appear here.; ; NOTES:

Title: Open/Close Project context menu-items should be context sensitive (1GET2HO)
Description: Right-click on a Project in the Navigator.; 	Notice that both Open Project and Close Project items appear though one item will always be greyed out.; 	Why not merge the items and change the name depending on the context?; ; 	i.e. Show Open Project when the project is closed; and Close Project when the project is open.; ; NOTES:

Title: [JFace] Out of memory errors reported as null (1GET7EQ)
Description: If you get an OutOfMemoryError from Java when rebuilding the world the error message is; Errors Building: null. On the console you will get an error exception in GlobalBuildAction.run(); java.lang.OutOfMemory error. The user should be informed it was an out of memory error; ; ; NOTES:; EG (6/4/2001 11:47:03 AM); 	The GlobalBuildAction is contributed by ITPUI and not JDT. There isnt a lot; 	of data in this PR. In general ISVs should not catch runtime exceptions but let them; 	propagate to the platform where they are handled. Moving to ITPUI.; ; JM (6/5/2001 10:43:58 PM); 	I suspect this is NOT one of the null message problems we were seeing with Status objects; 	unless someones IStatus implementation is being more premissive and generating a string.; 	The standard Status will assert that the message is not null

Title: New tasks appear in middle of list (1GET6TD)
Description: Task view.; 	Add new task.; 	The task; which initially has Enter task description as its tasks; gets; 	neatly sorted under E in the list of existing tasks.; ; 	The sorting behaviour should be overridden here to make the new; 	task appear either at the top or the bottom of the list.; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR: Provide a hide option for workbench Views (1GET83R)
Description: Just a thought.; 	For views that are private or that we want to prevent users from creating via the Perspective -> Show View... option; 	[i.e. we only want to open them programmatically] it would make sense for the Workbench views extension-point to; 	provide a hide attribute in the XML schema.; ; 	This is the case right now with a set of SWT examples that open views.  We have a launcher view which; 	supplies ancillary functionality related to the example views (Descriptions and Import source code). As; 	such it is not necessary or desirable for the user to open these example views manually.  Moreover; leaving these; 	views hidden would reduce clutter in Perspective -> Show View...; ; NOTES:

Title: ReadmeSectionsView should use page selection service (1GET8HH)
Description: ReadmeSectionsView.init(IViewSite) should hook the pages selection service; not the windows.; Need to fix dispose() too.; ; This is copied in the isvdoc as well.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
Description: Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000 - Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default; - new basic project; - new file test.xml; - the editor used is the scripted resource editor example; which totally ignores the XML file content; ; - select test.xml in Navigator; - choose Open With... / Default Text Editor; - nothing happens; its reactivating the scripted resource editor example; ; Searching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.; It should open a new editor on the file; because the editor type is different.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Why do I have to use the workbench to see the JFace examples (1GETA1R)
Description: The JFace examples should not require the workbench; There should be runnables in the packages or a stand alone launcher.; (similar to the SWT examples).; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Views/Editors appear active when inactive (1GET9KG)
Description: If you switch to a process outside of Eclipse; the Native Active Title Bar becomes inactive; and turns grey.  The Eclipse Views and Editors however remain coloured which may appear; confusing.; ; To repeat:; 1) select a View or editor in Eclipse; note the title bar colourize.; 2) switch to another app and restore down so that you can see Eclipse in the background.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: NPE: Cannot open examples view (1GET9OT)
Description: There is a null pointer exception trying to open the examples view; org.eclipse.jface.examples.common.ExamplesView.getExamples(); could do something like; ; 	// obtain file; 	URL baseURL = JFaceExamplesPlugin.getDefault().getDescriptor().getInstallURL();; 	URL fileURL= null;; 	try {; 			fileURL = new URL(baseURL; EXAMPLES_FILE);//$NON-NLS-1$; 	} catch (MalformedURLException e) {; 		// handle the exception; 	}; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Tab names are huge and the tab outline does not show (1GET9VK)
Description: The tab names are huge (failed nls lookup?) and the tab outline; is not seen in the help view; ; NOTES:

Title: [Wizards] If not using default location; directory info wiped out (1GETA7W)
Description: 1) Click on create Java Project in Getting Started wizard.; 2) Uncheck Use default location; ; Notice that the gray text indicating the default location is wiped out and the field for specifying the non-default location is blank.; ; I am most likely going to put the stuff somewhere close to where the default location is and would prefer to have the opportunity ; to edit that directory.  If I dont want that directory; I can easily select the text and delete.  It is not as easy to type all that stuff back in.; In most applications; the text would be left there but would be selected so I could just start typing if I wanted to replace the entire thing.; ; NOTES:; EG (6/4/2001 10:51:50 AM); 	The project creation wizard page is owned by ITPUI. moving.; ; KH (9/13/2001 3:01:37 PM); 	DCR.; 	Need to resolve overlapping content area issues.

Title: [UI] Rename in navigator is lost (1GETAFW)
Description: 1. Select a file in the resource navigator.; 2. Invoke Rename; 3. Type some name in the double outline box which appears.; 4. Select some other file in the same navigator.; ; Result: The file rename operation is cancelled.; ; NOTES:; ; TC (6/5/01 8:47:31 AM) - this is consistent with the way the Windows Explorer works.; ; EJP (6/25/01 3:35:15 PM); 	Tested Windows Explorer and Eclipse on Linux and Windows.; 	Eclipse on Windows works and Windows Explorer renaming the file before closing the in line editor.; 	The Eclipse on Linux does not rename the file.

Title: [UI] Test Field in Overwrite Perspective dialog is too small (1GETAVP)
Description: 1. Invoke Perspective | Save As.  ; 2. Select a perspective name which already exists.; 3. Press OK.  ; ; Result:; ; An overwrite confirmation dialog appears.  On linux the text field for comments is ; too small; so the top and bottom of the question text are cut off.; ; NOTES:

Title: [JFace Text] Editor: saving a locked file discards change (1GETAZL)
Description: Saving a locked file in the editor discards all the change.; ; 1. Create a file in Workbench; 2. Open the file in MS Word. Now the file is locked.; 3. Modify the file in Workbench; 4. Close the file. Youll be prompted by the save message asking if you want to save it. Click Yes.; 	The error message shows and the change is lost.; ; NOTES:; JEL (14/06/2001 10:28:50 AM); 	Should we leave an editor open when a save fails? leaving the user the option to Save As or simply; close without saving.

Title: Customize dialog label mentions action sets; but shows other types of things (1GETBW8)
Description: - Choose Perspective / Customize...; ; The label menitions action sets; but the tree shows categories for New Wizards; Perspectives; Views; and Other.; Are these actually action sets?; ; It looks like Other includes the free-floating action sets.; ; The terminology seems funny here.; ; NOTES:

Title: AbstractUIPlugin.initializeImageRegistry is final (1GETC7J)
Description: The spec for AbstractUIPlugin.initializeImageRegistry(ImageRegistry) says it can be overridden;; but its marked final.; ; This is a little cruel.; ; NOTES:

Title: Color cell editor has the wrong button label (1GETCLM)
Description: The button label in the color cell editor is a down arrow; it should ; be ...; ; NOTES:; ; SA (6/6/2001 10:46:49 AM); 	Talked with Randy about this. The use of ... is expected for showing a dialog; 	on the windows platform. The proper solution is to get a ... image instead of; 	just placing ... in the text of the button (larger fonts make the button too big). ; 	Otherwise; well just end up getting more PR from people complaining about; 	the button size. Waiting for KH to comment.

Title: [JFace] New dialog buttons clipped (1GETDPU)
Description: Open the File->New->Other dialog. On Solaris some of the buttons ; 	at the botton of the dialog (e.g. Back button) are clipped.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: New dialog header text not visible (1GETDSA)
Description: Open the File->New->Other dialog. As you select items in the right; 	hand column; the text at the top of the dialog should change. On; 	Solaris; no text is visible; but the icon in the header is visible.; ; 	If you select CVS - Stream and hit Next; the following page displays; 	the error message Enter the name of the new stream if the text; 	widget is empty. Enter any character and the error message disappears; 	but neither the text Stream or Create a new stream are visible.; ; ; NOTES:; ; 	KC (6/13/2001 4:17:04 PM); 	The problem is probably that the text colour is white and the dialog; 	background area for the text is also white. On Solaris; the default; 	system colour (e.g.; text in the menus; window titles; etc.) is white.

Title: Why is there a field editors example tab? (1GETDXH)
Description: Field editors are only useful in a field editor preference page so they should only ; appear in the preference example.; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR - Callbacks to notice file changes
Description: Open a *.java file.; 	Open it with notepad.; 	Change it in the notepad and save.; 	Go back to the eclipse workbench.; 		1st problem:; 			If the editor was activated when notepad was opened ; 			you do not get the File was changed in the file system.....  message until you deactivate and; 			re-activate the editor.; 	Activate the editor; 	- The message dialog will open asking if you want to load the changes made in the file system.; 	Say no.; 		; 	2nd problem:; 		The text should be marked as dirty since it is not the same as the one save in the file system.	; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Doc problems (1GETMJI)
Description: Jim des Rivieres; 	06/04/2001 02:08 PM; 		 ; 		 To: Kevin Haaland/OTT/OTI@OTI; 		 cc: Susan Griffin/OTT/OTI@OTI; 		 Subject: org.eclipse.ui extension points with no doc; ; Kevin;; ; 1) The org.eclipse.ui.markerImageProviders and org.eclipse.ui.resourceFilters extension point; are missing their doc files. Please add doc for them.
