Title: [UI] cannot save .doc file - dirty bit not shown in editor (1GETPH1)
Description: I cannot save files that are of type .doc.  ; I tried Ctrl+S; File-> Save; and save on close.; Each led me to believe that my changes were being saved; before I closed the file; but the next time I opened the file; ; there were no contents.; ; STEPS:; -create a new file called me.doc (must be a .doc file type).; -edit the file (start typing some junk) ; 	notice the dirty bit (star) does not show on the editor tab; -close the editor; -say yes to save the changes; -open me.doc; -there are no contents!; ; NOTES:; KLM (6/4/01 9:14:41 PM); 	.bmp files also did not show the dirty bit on the tab when edited; but the ; 	changes did save.; ; TC (6/5/01 8:44:01 AM) - the dirty bit is not shown on OLE Editors because there is no; way of knowing from OLE. ; ; SA (6/5/2001 9:45:47 AM); 	For ActiveX Contols; you can make use of one of the IPersistStorage interfaces; 	and call isDirty() on it. Im pretty sure you can do the same for an embedded ole; 	object too. There is also the IAdviseSink2 interface that can be hooked up via; 	the IOleObject interface. There is also some support via the IDataObject (but if; 	my memory serves me correctly; this was not always exposed. Anyway; its been; 	3 years since Ive worked in this stuff...maybe my mind is failing me ;-); ; VI (6/5/2001 11:51:53 AM); ; I am using the IPersistStorage mechanism as shown below.  I can investigate the IAdviseSink2 mechanism.; ; public boolean isDirty() {; 	// Get access to the persistant storage mechanism; 	int[] address = new int[1];; 	if (objIOleObject.QueryInterface(COM.IIDIPersistFile; address) != COM.S_OK); 		return false;; 	IPersistStorage permStorage = new IPersistStorage(address[0]);; 	// Are the contents of the permanent storage different from the file?; 	int result = permStorage.IsDirty();; 	permStorage.Release();; 	return (result == COM.S_OK);; }; ; KH (6/6/2001 8:12:10 AM); 	Pls followup with VI. There is API that we are NOT calling. ; ; EJP (6/6/01 2:37:48 PM); 	- We are not calling filePropertyChange when we save the text.; 	- We are not calling the SWT API isDirty() because there is not API to; 	add a listener to get a callback when the editor becames dirty so we; 	cant enable and disable menus.; 	- The menu acelerators are not working (Ctrl S; Ctrl F4 etc).  (PS: The OLE; 			editor menu acelerators work.); 	- MSWord gets dirty every time it is activated.; 	- The SWT API isDirty() works for MSWord and MSPaint but does not work with PPT.; ; EJP (6/6/01 4:04:34 PM); 	About the original problem discribed in this PR.; 	The text is not being save because the editor being open is Wordpad not WinWord.; 	The fix for it is to change the method OleEditor>>#usesStorageFiles(); 	to use Word.Document instead of Word which is more WinWord specific.; ; EJP (6/6/01 6:03:09 PM); 	Fixed the problem with WordPad.; 	Still need to fix the problem described in EJP (6/6/01 2:37:48 PM); ; NE (6/15/01 12:16:49 PM); 	Readme doc:; 99.1.1.1 Editor dirty state not tracked properly for OLE editors; ; The dirty state for an OLE editor is not updated properly.  This also causes it to prompt to save the contents when the editor is closed; even if the contents ; have already been saved.; ; 99.1.1.1 Workbench accelerator keys dont work when using OLE editor; ; Accelerator keys for Workbench actions; like Ctrl-S for Save and Ctrl-F4 for Close; do not work when an OLE editor is active.  However; the ; corresponding actions in the pull-down menus do work.; Accelerators defined by the OLE editor itself also work.

Title: UI is hiding important information from user (1GEUP2Y)
Description: I ran out of disk running Eclipse but it wasnt easy to get to that conclusion.; ; 	At first; a dialog appeared:; 	 Could not write metadata for: /org.eclipse.core.tools.spy. ; ; 	This dialog did not have a details button. I checked the log file and it was empty.; I couldnt even delete it.; 	I just figure out what was going on because I always run with the -consolelog option.; ; 	Not informing the user about this kind of problem is really bad.; 	Eclipse couldnt write the metadata for the project because it ran out of; disk space. Any of the workspace backup strategy (snapshots) would not be able to; run. The log file could not be written as well.; ; 	Dialogs should show as much information as they can.; ; NOTES:

Title: Suggested changes to org.eclipse.jface.examples.wizards (1GEUTN3)
Description: 1. The following are being done in ; org.eclipse.jface.examples.wizards.ClassCreationWizard.addPages(); 	setNeedsProgressMonitor(true);; 	setWindowTitle(Class Creation Wizard);; It would be better style to do these in the constructor.; ; 2. Why do you have the following check in:; org.eclipse.jface.examples.wizards.ClassCreationWizard.performFinish(); 		String classname= classNamePage.getClassName();; 		if (classname.length() == 0); 			return false;; Wouldnt the enablement code prevent this?; ; 3. The comment in ; org.eclipse.jface.examples.wizards.ClassCreationWizard.addPages() is:; /**;  * Hook method for lazy page creation. Subclasses should reimplement;  * this method if they want to create their pages just before the;  * wizard becomes visible.;  */; Adding has nothing to do with creating the page controls if that is what you mean.; Suggest; /**;  * Adds this wizards pages.;  */; ; 4. Replace org.eclipse.jface.examples.wizards.ClassNamePage.enter(int) with; public void setVisible(boolean visible) {; 	super.setVisible(visible);; 	if (visible); 		text.setFocus();; }; ; 5. org.eclipse.jface.examples.wizards.MethodStubPage.dispose(); Saving of dialog settings should be called from the Wizards perform finish method.; Settings should only be saved if finish is a success.; ; 6. Typo in comment of; org.eclipse.jface.examples.wizards.SuperClassAndInterfacePage.createControl(Composite); Creates the paegs UI component.; ; NOTES:

Description: 1.	Window-->Preferences-->Plug-in Development; 2. In Workspace Location type in a non-existant directory.; 3. Go to Windows; create the directory.  Note that the Apply button is not enabled.; 4. Select another Preference (e.g.; Managing).  Youre told that you have ; 	invalid values on the page.; 5. Browse for the Workspace Location.  Actually select the directory you created.; 	The IDE still will not allow you to save the data even though the directory does; 	exist.  The Apply button is not enabled and if you select another Preference item; 	youre told you have invalid values.; ; You cant use the new directory until you exit and re-open the Preferences dialog.; ; NOTES:; EG (6/5/2001 9:47:37 AM); 	This behaviour is in the preference framework. Moving to ITPUI for consideration

Title: Moving project content dialog confusing (1GEVF58)
Description: A few different things which are confusing:....; ; 	- create project AAA; 	- right-click to bring up the context menu and select Move; 	- Copy of AAA is the recommended new name; 	- make the name AAA; 	- NOTE it says that a project already exists; 	- de-select the Use default location checkbox; 	- NOTE that the error message goes away even though you havent; 	  changed the name of the project.; ; 	- NOTE that the text box is empty but the OK button is active; 	- click OK; 	- you get a message saying that the project couldnt be moved (this is ok); ; 	- right-click on the project and select Move; 	- make the name AAA; 	- NOTE it says that the project already exists; 	- NOTE the default location button is not checked; 	- NOTE the location in the text box is the default location; ; 	- click on the Use default location check box; 	- NOTE the error message goes away; ; 	- hit OK; 	- you get an error message because you tried to move to the; 	  same place that you were; ; 	Moral of this long story is that you seem to get into a weird state; 	if you try to move a projects contents to a location which is an; 	empty string.; ; NOTES:

The left arrow has 2 completly different meaning.; ; NOTES:; ; JohnA (6/5/2001 4:54:33 PM); 	Both sets of actions (and icons) are supplied by org.eclipse.ui.  Theyre the ones being inconsistent.; 	(as a side note; I prefer go home; go back and go into over back; forward and up.  This is a web-page navigation; 	metaphor; but what does it mean to go UP in a web page?)

Title: No outline view shown when open file from search result (1GEV8Y3)

You should see 1; the one for Test.java.; Close the Test.java editor; In the Search view; double click on the result to open Test.java in an editor.; BUG: Notice that the Outline view is not populated.; ; NOTES:

Title: Action enablement based on project nature? (1GEWQKC)
Description: GA says:; ; There might be opportunities for doing basic enablement based on project natures.; We have several areas where we can potentially take advantage of project natures; but did not have time to consider it for this round.; ; KH - do you agree?; ; - - - ; From: Nick Edgar <nick_edgar@oti.com>; Subject: Re: navigator view context menu contribution; Date: Wednesday; May 30; 2001 3:00 PM; ; We currently have no plans to change this.; ; The problem is that the only way youre going to get rich enough conditions; for enablement is to allow arbitrary Java code to be run.; Which means activating the plugin just to determine whether the action is; enabled or not.; Eclipse tries very hard to avoid starting plugins unnecessarily; to keep; startup time down.; E.g.; if Im editing text and not editing HTML; it should not have to; activate any part of the HTML plugin.; ; ; Robert Weisz wrote in message <9f09jt$b1q$1@rogue.oti.com>...; >Nick Edgar wrote:; >; >> Robert;; >; >> There is currently no way to selectively contribute an action based on; the; >> project type.; >; >Any idea if there are plans to add this functionality in the future?; ; NOTES:

Title: Changes not saved when comparing project with another version (1GEY6GL)
Description: 1) Select a Java Project; 2) Select Compare with ..->Version...; 3) Select a previous version of the project; 4) Review the changes and use the Copy current changes from left to right button to undo some changes in workspace code; 5) Select Save from context menu in workspace code.; 6) Notice that the * does not get removed from the tab item name but the Save menu option is disabled.; 7)Close the tab folder item.  Prompted to save now.; 8) Changes are not saved even though I said Yes in dialog prompting me to save changes; ; NOTES:; ; AW (07.06.01 14:13:43); 	We shouldnt install a Save action in the TextMergeViewer if the viewer is enclosed in a CompareEditor.; 	In this case all modification are done on the editors buffer.; 	In the VCMSyncView a Save is needed since VCM UI doesnt support a buffered model.; ; AW (07.06.01 18:45:07); 	Since the CompareEditor will be replaced by a CompareViewer or dialog I suggest not to allow buffered; 	editing and make the  CompareEditor readonly. This is easily done by enabling the two lines:; 		cc.setLeftEditable(false);; 		cc.setRightEditable(false);; 	in the CompareAction constructor.

Title: [UI] Deleting file does not close OLE editor (1GEYF50)
Description: If you delete a file while its OLE editor is open; the editor does not close and you get; some unexpected behaviour.; ; Steps:; (this must be done in Win32 OS); 1) new project; 2) create a new file pic.bmp (this will open its OLE editor); 3) draw a stick man in the editor; 4) in the Navigator view; delete pic.bmp; ; At this point; pic.bmp is deleted from the Navigator and from the system but the OLE; editor is still open.  If you close the OLE editor now and choose to Save changes;; the file will be re-added to the Navigator.; ; You can get the same type of behaviour if you are using the System Editor; but Eclipse; cant be expected to retain control over apps outside of its domain.  I imagine Eclipse should; be able to close a files associated OLE editor when deleted however (and also bypass the; Save changes? dialog which is always automatic for manual closes).; ; NOTES:

Title: Save in compare editors needs progress bar (1GEYF58)
Description: Saving a resource in compare can cause a build; so it needs a progress bar.; This should be done by compare FW; but we can do it ourselves if; thats easier.; ; NOTES:; ; KM (6/7/01 5:31:48 PM); 	Since you compare can show up outside of VCM then yes they should support.; 	Moving to UI.

Title: Unexpecte behavior on dirty editor close (1GEYHPZ)
Description: - open a resource perspective; 	- open an editor on file f1.txt; 	- open another resource perspective; 	- open an editor on the file f1.txt; 	- modify the file; 	- select File->Close; ; 	I was expecting a save dialog to appear. But nothing did; the editor; 	just closed. I thought I had lost all my work. I opened the file f1.txt; 	again and the editor opened in a dirty state with all the changes I; 	had done. I could not understand how this happenned until I remembered; 	I had also editor open in another perspective. I switched to that perspective; 	a sure enough it also was editing the same file and had the changes; 	I had type into the other editor.; ; 	I was happy that my changes were not lost but I was really confused for; 	a while because I was not asked to save the file on close.; ; 	What is the best way to handle this?; ; NOTES:

Title: Strange behaviour deleting a project with unsaved changes (1GEYHSF)
Description: 1) create a new generic project MyProject in the Navigator; 2) create a new file MyFile in the project  (a text editor will pop up); 3) edit the file but dont save it; 4) select MyFile and delete it; ; At this point the file is deleted; the editor is still open however.; I am not sure if this is the expected behaviour but I would think the user would assume; changes would be lost when deleting the file so closing the editor(s) with changes; should be ok.  An editor without changes is closed properly when its file is deleted.; ; Follow up problem:; 5) close or delete ALL your projects; 6) close the open editor of MyFile; ; You will be prompted to save changes; if you click yes you will not have any projects available; to save the file to so you will have to cancel and lose changes.  This problem would not exist if; editors were closed properly - the user shouldnt be asked to save changes to a deleted file.; ; NOTES:

Title: Closing project should prompt to save changes (1GEYIUV)
Description: 1) create a new project MyProject; 2) create a new file MyFile in the project; 3) edit the file but dont save it; 4) right click on the project and select Close Project; ; Notice the editor is still open; you should be prompted to save changes when closing a project and; the editor(s) should be closed.; ; Follow up problem:; 5) close the editor for MyFile; 6) you will be prompted to save changes; click yes; ; You will get an error dialog Save Problems: Save could not be completed. Reason: A resource; already exists on disk: <target directory>\MyProject\MyFile.  This problem would not occur if the; editors are closed when closing a project.; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR: double clicking on a closed project opens it (1GEYJ3W)
Description: There is currently a double-click listener for projects that causes them to expand.  This only works; if they are open obviously.  Double clicking on a closed project does nothing; it would be nice if; double-clicking a closed project invoked the Open Project action.; ; NOTES:

Title: Creating a Project should show a progress monitor (1GEYWOU)
Description: - from a new workspace; 	- create a folder P1 under the default location; 	- populate this folder with a lot of resources; 	- create a Project P1 in the workspace; ; 	Note that the UI takes a while to close the dialog and no; progress monitor is shown. Depending on the size of the; project and its location (maybe on a network)it would seem; that the workspace is frozen.; ; NOTES:

Title: SMOKE vertical lines do not align (1GEYWPL)
Description: not a big deal but...; ; drop a view under the editor placeholder; the vertical do not align correctly; ; NOTES:

Title: Changing build order should initiate incremental build (1GEYZPB)
Description: If you change the preference so you can specify build order;; and change the order; autobuild should run if enabled (or do full build).; ; NOTES:

Title: Total Eclipse shutdown - unknown reason (1GEYZX5)
Description: - I had some dumby projects/files open in the Eclipse Navigator; - invoked an Import (zip); - popped up the combo box with history of files; - Eclipse closed immediately without any error dialog; no .log entry.; ; Tried to backtrack my steps but I could not get this to occur again.; ; NOTES:; JEL (07/06/2001 5:47:15 PM); 	Other apps open at same time: Explorer (x2); Internet Explorer; Lotus Notes; ; TC (6/7/01 6:39:56 PM) - I think this is an OutOfMemory exception - I have had the odd one on my Linux; box all over the UI - as JEL is working on a smaller machine this is quite plausible.; ; JEL (08/06/2001 12:44:07 PM)  Just to confirm; this was an out of memory problem.  It can be easily; recreated by working on a system with low physical memory; setting your pagefile to a low fixed value; (i.e. 32-64MB) and filling up the memory with dumby apps.  There is not much we can do about this;; even the OS crashes sometimes when memory runs out.

Title: org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access when updating a file (1GEZ001)
Description: We have code generation that runs in a background thread.  It is invoked like:; 			ProgressMonitorDialog dialog = getProgressMonitorDialog();; 			EJBDeployBeansOperation operation = new EJBDeployBeansOperation(getProject(); enterpriseBeans);; 			IRunnableWithProgress runnable = J2EEUIPlugin.getRunnableWithProgress(operation);		; 			dialog.run(true; true; runnable); 	// true==fork; true==cancelable; ; (more details on this part available if necessary); ; In the forked thread a java source file is generated.  If the java editor is open on that ; source file at that time; the following exception is thrown.; ; Unhandled exception caught in event loop.; Reason:; java.lang.NullPointerException; org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access;         at org.eclipse.swt.SWTException.<init>(SWTException.java:45);         at org.eclipse.swt.SWTException.<init>(SWTException.java:34);         at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1774);         at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1707);         at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:378);         at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.<init>(Shell.java:193);         at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.<init>(Shell.java:257);         at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.createShell(Window.java:271);         at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.create(Window.java:237);         at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:515);         at org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.MessageDialog.openError(MessageDialog.java:319);         at org.eclipse.ui.internal.SafeRunnableAdapter.handleException(SafeRunnableAdapter.java:39);         at org.eclipse.ui.part.WorkbenchPart$1.handleException(WorkbenchPart.java:85);         at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.handleException(InternalPlatform.java:306);         at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java(Compiled Code));         at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java(Compiled Code));         at org.eclipse.ui.part.WorkbenchPart.firePropertyChange(WorkbenchPart.java:80);         at org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.AbstractTextEditor.firePropertyChange(AbstractTextEditor.java:1223);         at org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.AbstractTextEditor$ElementStateListener.elementDirtyStateChanged(AbstractTextEditor.java:99);         at org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.AbstractDocumentProvider.fireElementDirtyStateChanged(AbstractDocumentProvider.java:383);         at org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.AbstractDocumentProvider$ElementInfo.documentChanged(AbstractDocumentProvider.java:96);         at org.eclipse.jface.text.AbstractDocument.fireDocumentChanged(AbstractDocument.java:427);         at org.eclipse.jface.text.AbstractDocument.replace(AbstractDocument.java:712);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.CompilationUnitDocumentProvider$BufferSynchronizer.bufferChanged(CompilationUnitDocumentProvider.java:106);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Buffer.notifyChanged(Buffer.java:291);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Buffer.setContents(Buffer.java:428);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeleteElementsOperation.commitChanges(DeleteElementsOperation.java:57);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeleteElementsOperation.processElement(DeleteElementsOperation.java:128);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.MultiOperation.processElements(MultiOperation.java:183);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeleteElementsOperation.processElements(DeleteElementsOperation.java:139);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.MultiOperation.executeOperation(MultiOperation.java:87);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation.execute(JavaModelOperation.java:258);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation.run(JavaModelOperation.java:453);         at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1093);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelManager.runOperation(JavaModelManager.java:952);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaElement.runOperation(JavaElement.java:509);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModel.delete(JavaModel.java:165);         at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.SourceRefElement.delete(SourceRefElement.java:46);         at com.ibm.etools.java.codegen.JavaTypeGenerator.generateTarget(JavaTypeGenerator.java:114);         at com.ibm.etools.java.codegen.JavaMemberGenerator.run(JavaMemberGenerator.java:234);         at com.ibm.etools.codegen.BaseGenerator.runChildren(BaseGenerator.java:190);         at com.ibm.etools.codegen.BaseGenerator.run(BaseGenerator.java:182);         at com.ibm.etools.java.codegen.JavaCompilationUnitGenerator.run(JavaCompilationUnitGenerator.java:350);         at com.ibm.etools.ejbdeploy.generators.RemoteImpl.run(RemoteImpl.java:54);         at com.ibm.etools.codegen.BaseGenerator.runChildren(BaseGenerator.java:190);         at com.ibm.etools.codegen.BaseGenerator.run(BaseGenerator.java:182);         at com.ibm.etools.ejbdeploy.plugin.EJBDeployOperation.deploySession(EJBDeployOperation.java:197);         at com.ibm.etools.ejbdeploy.plugin.EJBDeployOperation.run(EJBDeployOperation.java:444);         at com.ibm.etools.j2ee.ui.RunnableWithProgressWrapper.run(RunnableWithProgressWrapper.java:49);         at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:99); ; NOTES:; ; EG (6/7/2001 12:49:24 PM); 	the problme is that JFace text is not designed to be accessible from multiple threads. This is ; 	consistent with JFace.; 	Workaround is to call the progress monitor with fork=false.; 	This has the negative consequence that the operaiton runs in the UI thread and cannot; 	be cancelled.; 	For more background see:; 		1GCEE6Y: ITPUI:ALL - Architectural issue - using RunnableContext in forked mode; ; EG (7/12/01 11:53:12 AM); 	Cannot do anything about this in JUI; moving to ITPUI.

Title: [UI] ISV must reference internal class to get workbench prefs (1GF0EOA)
Description: The workbench exposes a number of preference constant keys in IWorkbenchPreferenceConstants.; Unfortately; you can only access those constants if you reference the WorkbenchPlugin class; directly or rely upon the underlying core support to get a well defined plugin class.  ; This is bogus.  ; If we expose the constants then surely we should also expose the object where; they can be used.  There should be API to get the preference store from IWorkbench.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Sub Categories are ignored in Customize .. New Wizards (1GF0NIC)
Description: This is a rare case.  If you define a wizard category with sub categories; and there; are new wizards in the sub categories; these wizards do not appear within the; customize .. dialog.  The code in ActionSetDialogInput does not recurse into; the complete wizard tree.  It just examines the root categories.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] OLE: Save as does not change the file being edited. (1GF0RKQ)
Description: Open a .doc file.; 	Change the contents.; 	Save the file as xxxx.doc.; 	; 	> The file being edited should be xxxx.doc but the editor is still opened on the; 	first file.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (6/15/01 12:17:40 PM); 	Readme doc:; 99.1.1.1 Save As... on an OLE editor does not change its input to the new file; ; If Save As... is used on an OLE editor; its contents are saved to the new file; but the editors input is not switched to the new file.; Subsequent saves will modify the original file; not the new file.

Title: [Editor Mgmt] Open with a diff editor should ask to user to close the opened and open a new one (1GF0RRZ)
Description: 1) Create a .txt file. - The DefaultTextEditor will open.; 	2) Select the file in the navigator and Open with -> another editor.; 	; 	The new editor will not open.;    We should ask the user if he wants to close the opened editor and open the file with the new ;    choosen editor.; 	; ; NOTES:

Title: [Welcome] Drag select in Welcome editor causes wizard to open (1GF0UJ1)
Description: Open the welcome editor (Help->Welcome); click down in one of the; 	paragraphs that has links in it; but not on a link. Holding the mouse; 	down; move the mouse around. This selects the text - what you would; 	expect except for being extremely slow to show feedback! Now continue; 	to move the mouse until you are over a link in the paragraph and let; 	go of the mouse button. Voila; the wizard is launched.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Status line messgae remains after fastview is closed (1GF1RPI)
Description: TM (6/9/2001 11:39:21); 	SDK 121; ; 	1) I was catching up with changes. I do this in a fastview of the synchronize view in the java; 		perspective.; 	2) when I was done; I clicked the fastview icon on the left workspace window border.; 	3) the fastview closed; ; 	4) observe: I still could see the status line message fromt he synchronize view (No conflicts; ...); ; NOTES:; ; SA (10/10/2001 2:23:44 PM); 	This problem is still here in 0.202 build. It can be reproduced with any views. Once the fast view; 	is hidden; no other view/editor is given focus.; ; 	This should be fixed in the bigger context of proper focus & z-order handling. That is; focus; 	should go to the pevious part that had focus.

Title: Do not show err msg about lead/trailing spaces in project wizard (1GIVG00)
Description: Using the simple project wizard; type in a project name. Now; add a space to the end; 	of it. Notice the error message about no leading / trailing spaces allowed.; ; 	This is really annoying message (especially when it shows up when typing in a project; 	name made of multiple words). Cant we just strip the leading and trailing spaces when; 	done? Thats what MS does when you type in leading/trailing blanks when creating a ; 	folder.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Click in script editor fails to activate (1GF65CA)
Description: 1. Create a test.xhtml file and open it in the script editor.; 2. Click on the navigator to activate it.; 3. Now click back and forth on the Source and Preview tabs within the script editor.; ; Notice: The editor is not activated; ; 4. Click on any of the enabled actions in the script editor.; ; Notice: The actions run; but the editor is still not activated.; ; NOTES:; 	BF (2001/06/12 10:27:15); 		Widgets are created in org.eclipse.internal.scripting.views.ScriptUIEditor.createPartControl( Composite ); 		ScriptUIEditor extends org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.TextEditor; ; 		Composite (input parameter); 			Composite; 				Composite for button palette; 				TabFolder; 					TabItem (Composite) for text editor; 					TabItem (Composite) for preview page; ; 		; NE (6/15/01 12:16:23 PM) ; 	Readme doc:; ; 99.1.1 Clicking on tabs of a multi-page editor may not activate the editor; ; In certain cases; clicking on a tab for a page within a multi-page editor may not activate the editor.; For example the script editor (for .xhtml files) has this problem.; The workaround is to click in the content area of the editor to activate it; then click on the page tab (or vice versa).; Clicking on the tab for the overall editor works as well.

Title: Copy file with open dirty editor does not save first (1GF65E9)

Title: Find/replace should move dialog if hiding found occurrence (1GHBT80)
Description: The find/replace dialog should move itself out of the way; if it hides the selection for a found occurrence.  ; ; Compare with other apps.; ; NOTES:

Title: F1 help popup keeps focus from switching (1GF5RSJ)
Description: TM (6/11/2001 15:31:34); 	SDK 122; ; 	1) open a java editor; 	2) press F1; 	3) observe: you get a popup window; 	4) click on the outliner; 	5) observe: the outliner doesnt get the focus.; ; 	The outliner should get the focus. ; ; EG (6/11/2001 10:46:01 AM); 	moving to ITPUI; ; KH (6/12/2001 7:46:33 AM); 	Two clicks required.

Title: [UI] Loading eclipse with ppt open also opens PowerPoint (1GF5RW9)
Description: Test case to be done with Microsoft PowerPoint installed on the system:; ; 1) create a new file with .ppt extension; 2) the ole editor will appear for the ppt.  Do not close the editor.; 3) close eclipse; when you are prompted to save; click yes; 4) run eclipse; ; When eclipse loads; the OLE editor loads inside eclipse but an instance of PowerPoint will also; appear.  This problem does not occur with any other programs.; ; NOTES:; ; TC (6/12/01 10:05:23 AM) - this is because there are multiple shows being shown in this case -; as there are two instances of power point power point will use the main one outside of ; Eclipse as its editor and the one in Eclipse as its viewer.; ; Workaround; 	Close PowerPoint; 	Click off of the editor in Eclipse and then click back on it again; ; JEL (12/06/2001 11:42:55 AM); 	dupe: 1GF7Q0F: ITPUI:WINNT - Reopening Eclipse with a Power Point OLE editor open opens it externally; ; NE (6/15/01 11:51:51 AM); 	Could not reproduce in Win98 with PowerPoint 97 on Eclipse build 124.; 	It opened OK; just in Eclipse.; ; NE (6/15/01 12:17:50 PM); 	Readme doc:; 99.1.1.1 PowerPoint opens as separate application on Workbench startup; ; If the Workbench was exited with an in-place editor open on a PowerPoint (.ppt) file; when restarting the Workbench; PowerPoint may launch as a separate ; application rather than an in-place editor.  The workaround is to close and reopen the file.

Title: [OLE] Locked out during OLE loads (1GF5SAL)
Description: Some loading times for OLEs can be quite long and the user is locked out during this time.; Is it possible to display a progress dialog or just a dialog without a progress?  Or even better; have the OLE load in an independent thread (which would be cancelled if the editor is closed)?; ; Also when Eclipse is loading; if you had any OLE editors open when it was last closed; all; the OLEs will have to load before anything is displayed.  Is it possible to open eclipse first; and have the OLEs load second?; ; NOTES:

Title: [Navigation] Compare - would like a next change button (1GF5SB6)
Description: I miss the VAJ functionality of quickly being able to step to the next change without having; to pick it individually amongst a list of candidates.; ; NOTES:; ; AW (05.07.2001 09:55:40); 	Im not sure I understand to what part of compare you are referring to.; ; 	There are lots of ways to navigate through the changes:; 	- every pane has next/previous buttons to step through the changes shown in the pane; 	- in the tree viewer you can step through changes by means of the cursor keys; 	- in the text compare viewer next/previous button first step through line changes and then through token changes; 	- the compare browser has next/previous toolbar items (and cntr-n/cntr-p shortcuts) to step through the changes across panes;; 		so it will go the the next resource if youve reached the end of the changes in that resource.; ; PM (7/5/2001 6:39:03 PM); 	I would like to have only ONE next change button instead of having to select various flavours. I am only interested in the next change; ; 	not in the next change in the next file...; 	; 	Accessorily; how is it that I am getting changes on files which show me no content changes ?

Title: Welcome: arrow keys do not work (1GF5T6A)
Description: The arrow keys do not work in the welcome view.; ; NOTES:

Title: Welcome: icons not aligned (1GF5SQG)
Description: The round blue right-arrows on the welcome page are not aligned; 	with the text to which they point.; ; NOTES:

Title: Multiple compare editors for same items (1GF5T98)
Description: It is now possible to open up multiple compare editors for several compare operations which is; very useful.  The problem is that you can open up multiple editors for the same compare items -; this is not consistent with regular editors that only allow one instance open for each item.; ; Steps to repeat:; 1) in a project with at least 2 files; select them both; 2) right click and select Compare With -> Each Other; 3) repeat step #2; ; When comparing X vs. Y; Eclipse should check to see if there is already an instance of that; compare editor open; if so simply give focus to that editor.; ; ; NOTES:; ; KH (6/12/2001 7:47:44 AM); 	Moving to JUI for comment. Compare is supplied by Workbench but JUI and layers above; 	are biggest users. ; ; KH (6/12/2001 7:48:13 AM); 	Current behaviuor goes against standard editor model but if it does not cause exceptions; 	I would have difficulty arguing that this is a stop ship PR. ; ; EG (6/12/2001 3:16:17 AM); 	agreed not a stop ship.

Title: Sorting the Tasks List should display icon for sort key/order (1GF5TQO)
Description: When you click on a column header in the Tasks View; an icon should appear beside the; column title to indicate the sorting key (pointing up for ascending sort; down for descending sort).; ; To see an example of this; run explorer and click on a column header (i.e. Name).  It will sort; the list and display an arrow marker.; ; NOTES:

Title: feature: mark either read-only editors or read-only resources (1GF5VIJ)
Description: I like the current behaviour that occurs when a read-only text file is opened in the workbench; (the editor opens in read-only mode).  However its easy and common for someone to not realize; that a file being opened is read-only; and hence may think that the editor is broken when it displays; the file but does not allow modification.  Some indicator of read-onlyness would definitely be good; for clarity; either on the editors tab or on the resource itself in the navigator (not just on its property; page).; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] NPE during part init due to null perspective (1GF5YRE)
Description: I added some code in an implementation of IViewPart.init as follows:; ; public void init(IViewSite site) throws PartInitException {; 	super.init(site);; 	if (site.getPage().getPerspective().getId().equals(IWorkbenchVCMConstants.PERPSPECTIVE_HISTORY)) {; 		//do some special work that only applies in this perspective; 	}; }; ; The problem is; a NPE occurs in WorkbenchPage#getPerspective when init is called during startup.; This means my view cannot determine what perspective it is in at startup time.  This restriction is; not documented in the API as far as I can see.  The stack trace is as follows:; ; Log: Mon Jun 11 11:59:19 EDT 2001; 2 org.eclipse.ui 2 Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: org.eclipse.ui.; java.lang.NullPointerException; 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.getPerspective(WorkbenchPage.java:675); 	at org.eclipse.vcm.internal.ui.HistoryView.init(HistoryView.java:350); 	at org.eclipse.ui.part.ViewPart.init(ViewPart.java:78); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ViewFactory.createView(ViewFactory.java:120); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ViewFactory.createView(ViewFactory.java:93); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Perspective$4.run(Perspective.java:661); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:758); 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:393); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Perspective.restoreView(Perspective.java:654); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Perspective.restoreState(Perspective.java:572); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.restoreState(WorkbenchPage.java:1126); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.<init>(WorkbenchPage.java:76); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.restoreState(WorkbenchWindow.java:743); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.restoreState(Workbench.java:598); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$5.run(Workbench.java:477); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:758); 	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:393); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.openPreviousWorkbenchState(Workbench.java:461); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.openWindows(Workbench.java:518); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.init(Workbench.java:393); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:616); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:815); 	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:285); 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:66); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:298); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.UIMain.main(UIMain.java:43); ; NOTES:; ; JohnA (6/12/2001 9:28:08 AM); 	I moved the initialization code into createPartControl; at which point the perspective has been properly ; 	initialized.  It turns out theres not much you can do in the init method; very few of the page and site; 	objects have been properly initialized at that time.  For example; site.getSelectionProvider() also returns; 	null at that point.

Title: [JFace Text] Editor: cant undo revert (1GF63TS)
Description: - new text file; - make some changes; - choose Revert from pop-up menu; - Undo is disabled; ; Should be able to undo a revert; since it has the potential to lose many changes.; Its also placed close to Redo and Cut; which makes selecting it by accidently fairly likely.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Refresh local when using external editors (1GF69W3)
Description: You should refresh local when modifying resources in external editors; otherwise they wont show up as outgoing changes.; ; ; NOTES:; ; JohnA (6/14/2001 11:46:47 AM); 	This should be in the org.eclipse.ui README.  Most of Eclipse; 	will behave incorrectly if you dont refresh after doing external edits.; ; NE (6/15/01 1:14:35 PM); 	Readme doc:; 99.1.1 Manual refresh required when files added; removed; or edited outside of the Workbench; ; When files within a project are added or removed outside of the Workbench; or when an external editor is used to modify a file within a project; a manual ; refresh must be done in order for the changes to show up in the Workbench.  This is also needed for the changes to show up as outgoing changes when ; synchronizing with a team stream.  To do this; select the project in the Navigator view and choose Refresh Local from the pop-up menu.  Alternatively; ; activate the Navigator view and hit F5; which refreshes the whole workspace.

Title: Editor disabled on read-only file (1GF656Q)
Description: Create a file resource (f1.txt); 	Mark the file (f1.txt) as read-only thru the properties dialog; 	Open the default text editor on the file (f1.txt); 	Try typing; and notice nothing happens.; ; 	We should allow the user to type. Since there are no visual cues to show; 	the file is read-only; the user is left confused as why the editor does not work.; ; 	MS Word lets you open a read only file and modify it. Just when you save it; 	prompts for another file name.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Default text editor has no help (1GF66DW)

Title: [JFace] Wizard banner is not high enough (1GF66QY)

ISVs need to make sure their messages fit. ; 	Moving to JUI for comment. ; ; MA (07.08.2001 10:12:46); 	On windows the full text can be read.; 	The line is now shorter; but I guess this problem will come again when NLS-ing; so maybe; 	the workbench should prepare a solution as well. (Tooltip; autowrapping..); ; KH (9/17/2001 10:00:59 AM); 	Make sure that message area can handle two lines of text on Linux. Then move to Feature Request folder.

Type the path.; It doesnt recognize it (OK is still gray).; Have to tediously tunnel down.; ; NOTES:

Title: Class Cast Exception adding a bookmark to a class file (1GF67SO)
Description: If you bookmark a .class file (which has no visible contents) and then double click on the ; bookmark from the bookmarks view you get a Class Cast Exception; ; STEPS; 1) Open a .class file (one of the ones in rt.jar is fine); 2) Select Add a Bookmark; 3) Open the Bookmarks view; 4) Double click on the bookmark; ; ; 4 org.eclipse.ui 0 org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project; java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project; 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.openEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:968); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.openEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:959); 	at org.eclipse.ui.views.bookmarkexplorer.OpenBookmarkAction.run(OpenBookmarkAction.java:30); 	at org.eclipse.ui.views.bookmarkexplorer.BookmarkNavigator$2.doubleClick(BookmarkNavigator.java:109); 	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.fireDoubleClick(StructuredViewer.java:269); 	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.handleDoubleSelect(StructuredViewer.java:409); 	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer$1.widgetDefaultSelected(AbstractTreeViewer.java:626); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:90); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.notifyListeners(Widget.java:622); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java(Compiled Code)); 	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:963); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:637); 	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:620); 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:815); 	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:285); 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:126); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:408); 	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:281); ; ; ; NOTES:; ; DS (6/12/01 12:01:36 PM); 	Here is the offending code ..; ; 	public IEditorPart openEditor(IMarker marker; boolean activate) ; 		throws PartInitException ; 	{; 		// Get the resource.; 		IFile file = (IFile)marker.getResource();		<------ according to exception; 		..; 	}; ; 	Problem 1: I suspect this exception occurs because the result of getResource is an; 	IProject; not an IFile.; ; 	The marker target is a class file in an external jar.  There is no underlying resource for the ; 	class file; so I would guess that the java team is hanging the marker on the project itself.  ; 	Thus; getResource returns an IProject rather than an IFile.  ; ; 	If the getResource result is not an IFile there is no way for the workbench to ; 	determine the editor input.  IMarker does not provide API to support the scenario.; ; 	Solution: check type of getResource result.  If not IFile show error dialog and return.; ; 	Problem 2: The marker shouldnt even exist.  As stated above; IMarker doesnt provide; 	API to get the real marker target.  Our own AddBookmarkAction does not support the; 	creation of bookmarks on non-IFiles; so the java team must be defining another ; 	bookmark action to bookmark class files.  This is an error.  The packages view ; 	should not allow bookmarking on class files.; ; EG (6/12/2001 7:09:23 AM); 	the real problem is described here 1G8SCA9: ITPUI:ALL - Cannot open breakpoint on external jar ; 	This problem will not be fixable so we have to investigate in workarounds.; 	Changing the Add book mark action in the packages view is no problem. However; it isnt; 	enough we can also create book marks in the Class File editor. ; 	Tasks will have the same problem; need to verify.; ; ARCH (6/12/01 3:21:05 PM); 	Defer - Erich is doing separate workaround fix.

Title: Selection folder dialog is not consistent with wizard (1GF68V4)
Description: 1st - inconsistency:; 		The wizards show the error messages in the wizard banner.; 		The Folder Selection Dialog show the error message close to the OK botton.; 	2st - inconsistency:; 		If you select a closed project when copying a file; the  Folder Selection Dialog shows; 		a error message but if you select a closed project when creating a new file; the dialog does not; 		show any message.; 	; NOTES:; 	EJP (6/11/01 3:51:32 PM); 		See PR: 1GF68L0: ITPUI:ALL - Should hide closed project when selecting folder.; ; KLM (9/26/2001 5:43:03 PM); 	Need to create a folder selection dialog that is a subclass of TitleAreaDialog.; 	Currently it is a subclass of SelectionDialog; which has no title area.  Should ; 	also look at other subclasses of SelectionDialog and see if there are others ; 	that are offending (e.g. possibly ProjectLocationMoveDialog; maybe others).; ; KLM (9/28/2001 12:05:23 PM); 	Part 2 fixed: see 1GF68L0: ITPUI:ALL - Should hide closed project when selecting folder.

Title: [Standard Components] Export behavior not consistent (1GF68VX)
Description: Assume you have a project P1 with three files in it f1.txt; f2.txt; and f3.txt; 	Open the file system export wizard. Both file system export options are not checked; ; 	Case 1) Press Select All and export to a dir (like c:\case1). Note that P1 dir is created with; 	three files.; ; 	Case 2) Press Select All but uncheck one of the files (let say f3.txt). Note the project is now; 	gray selected (which indicates not all its children selected as other dialogs do). Export; 	to a dir (like c:\case2). Note that P1 dir is not created; but the two files are exported. Why?; 	I wanted the directory P1 to be included.; ; 	Case 3) Press Select All; uncheck on of the files. Note P1 is gray checked. Now check the; 	file again (so all files are checked) and P1 is still gray checked! Why?; ; NOTES:; ; TC (6/12/01 8:31:42 AM) - it looks to me like you were running without the create directory structure; option selected which would have given you the behaviour you were after. Without that option; selected everything white selected is exported flat - that is directories and thier children or ; just white selected files.; ; However we have decided that exporting a white checked directory should always result in that; directory showing up. Now createDirectoryStructure should create all folders including the ; project.; ; See ; ; ZipFileExportOperation :: org.eclipse.ui.wizards.datatransfer 122 [tc] 01; FileSystemExportOperation :: org.eclipse.ui.wizards.datatransfer 122 [tc] 01; ; ARCH (6/12/01 3:18:10 PM); 	Defer

Title: [Tasks] DnD feature not implemented (1GF6AE8)
Description: This is from the Eclipse SDK June 2001 Plan ( http://home.ott.oti.com/hubba/release1.0/plans/plan.htm ):; ; ------------------------------------------------; P1/M0 Drag and Drop (DONE) ; o       Implemented. No significant changes expected but we will respond to customer feedback.; ; ...; ; 	- Task list drag and drop: The task list supports the following transfer types: marker; text.  Tasks and; 	problems can be dragged to any OLE component that supports text transfer (such as Microsoft Word);; 	to produce a textual task report.  IMarkers can be dragged from the task list to any views that support; 	marker dropping (currently none). ; --------------------------------------------------; ; The feature is documented as being implemented but it is not.  The Plan should be updated if it will not; be implemented so that it does not end up as part of Eclipse documentaton.; ; NOTES:

Title: [OLE] OLE editor ignores read-only attribute of file (1GF6AVX)
Description: Create a file like f1.doc; 	Open the files properties and mark it as read-only; 	Open the word ole editor on it; 	Make changes and select File-Save; ; 	Notice it overwrites the read-only file. Looking at the files; 	properties; its read-only attribute is turned off.; ; NOTES:

Title: Filter tasks dialog could be simplified (1GF6B41)
Description: The lower part of the filter tasks dialog has three rows of checkboxes; The first check box in each row could be eliminated. ; The remaining boxes would all be checked by default.; ; NOTES:

Title: navigator forward button always disabled... (1GF7RL5)
Description: The forward button in the navigator is always disabled until you right click in; the navigator and choose go into for the first time.; ; NOTES:

Title: Navigation arrows are confusing (1GF6BK8)
Description: I find the navigation arrows in the toolbar confusing.; The up arrow I understand but I think that the right arrow means ; go into and the left go out of. ; In fact it is possible to get them to do just the opposite.; ; Perhaps the problem is that what the left or right arrows will; do at any given time depends on some invisible history.; Just looking at the visible state of the navigator you have no; idea what these buttons will do (without checking the button; hover-help).; ; Perhaps another problem is that the left right arrows look the; same as the up arrow but their functionality is completely different.; The up arrow is move relative to current location; The left-right arrows are move to to some abitrary location in the history ; ; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Resource icon is greyed in menus and dialogs (1GF9HU1)
Description: The Resources perspective icon is always greyed out in the menus and in the Select Perspective; dialog.  When you open the Resource perspective however; its icon appears in colour in the left; column.  This is inconsistent with the rest of the perspective icons.; ; I thought this might have been because Resources is the default perspective; but if you change the; default perspective in the prefs; the icon colour remains unchanged.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Link Navigator selection to active editor does not work for .class files (1GFD9TS)
Description: 1. Window>Preferences>Workbench; 2. Ensure Link Navigator selection to active editor is on; 3. In the navigator create a file a.class; 4. Create a file b.java; 5. Create a file c.txt; 6. Note that selecting b.java or c.txt in the navigator or editors area ; causes a selection in the other part but it does not work for a.class.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Standard Components] Type selection for Export needs a busy cursor (1GF7N8A)
Description: When we select types on export we do not use a busy cursor even though this can be a long; operation. We do use one for import.; ; I have a suggested fix; WizardExportResourcesPage :: org.eclipse.ui.dialogs 122 [tc] 01; ; NOTES:

Title: Inaccurate error message in file wizard (1GF7OIF)
Description: Select a project in the navigator; choose New->File; In the filename field; enter a single period character.; ; The error message says; Path must include project and resource name.  This error; message is misleading.  It should say; . is not a valid filename; or . must not end in a period.; ; NOTES:

Title: Should let user know that the file is read-only. (1GF7QBV)

I would like to be able to change the file as in notepad and; 	see a error message as in e32.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] JavaDoc is wrong for IViewPart (1GF7QMX)
Description: Id like to just change this in the next open edition; but Ill log a PR instead.; ; In IViewPart the following statement is made.; ; This interface is not intended to be directly implemented by clients;; * subclass ViewPart instead.; ; This is inconsistent with IEditorPart ..; ; This interface may be implemented directly. For convenience; a base; * implementation is defined in EditorPart.; ; In fact; both IEditorPart and IViewPart may be implemented directly. The WorkbenchPart; hierarchy exists as a convenience; and we make no assumptions about; implementation.; ; We should fix this javadoc to avoid misunderstanding.; ; NOTES:

Title: [OLE] [UI] EditorInput is not updated in most editors on move and rename (1GF7T8Q)
Description: If you rename a file that currently has an OLEEditor or external editor open on it ; the EditorInput is not updated. As a result a save will save it to the old location.; STEPS; 	1) Create a file foo.doc; 	2) Open an editor on it; 	3) Rename the file to bar.doc - no editor update; 	4) If you then save the editor it will re create foo.; ; TC (6/12/01 12:11:46 PM) - this is also an issue for move; NOTES:; ; NE (6/15/01 1:51:14 PM); 	Readme doc:; 99.1.1.1 Rename and move do not update OLE editors; ; If a rename or move is done on a file that is open in an OLE editor; the editors input is not switched to the new file.; Subsequent saves will re-save the file under the old name; not the new name.

Title: [JFace] Strange dialog cell editor behavior (1GF7UL8)
Description: Open a x.usr file; Select a person in the content outline; Open the properties view; Make sure the workbench is small enough that the properties view; horizontal scroll bar is showing.; Click on the hair color property to activate the cell editor; 1. Press escape; the cell editor does not close; 2. Use the right/left arrow keys; note that the view scrolls but the; cell editor remains stationary.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Navigator] Rename file inline editor does not go away on mouse down (1GF7UN2)
Description: On linux; select a file in the nav view then choose rename from the popup menu.; 	Rename the file then click on the white-space of the nav view - notice the editor; 	stays active. Doing this on windows cause the inline editor to close and the file; 	to be renamed.; ; 	Also; if you repeat the rename process but this time click on another file in the; 	nav view; the inline editor is closed but the file is not renamed. Under windows; 	the file is renamed.; ; NOTES:; 	EJP (07/12/01 04:19:30 PM); 		This is due a workaround added for 1GF7TXO; 		See RenameResourceAction.

Title: [UI] org.eclipse.ui.internal.OpenNewPageAction appears to be unused (1GF7X0A)
Description: I could not find any references to org.eclipse.ui.internal.OpenNewPageAction; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Impossible to delete a read only project (1GF7Y2S)
Description: If you create a project pointing at a directory where all of the contents are read only you cannot; be rid of it.; ; STEPS; 	1) Create a project Foo whose location is your CD ROM drive; 	2) Select delete on Foo. It will ask if you want to delete the contents from the file system.; 	3) Say no - you will now get prompted for each one being deleted.; 	4) No matter what you cannot get rid of Foo; ; ; NOTES:; ; TC (6/12/01 1:49:17 PM) - interestingly this works fine if you choose to do the same thing on a ; read only file on the file system. Just select yes to deletion and it deletes the resource but; leaves the file alone.; ; SA (10/10/2001 10:34:40 AM); 	In build 0.202; this problem still exist. Here some more details on what is going on. When; 	a project is created and its location points to a read-only directory (and all files contained in; 	the directory is read-only); the equivalent resouces are created in the workspace with the; 	read-only flag on. So when you delete the project; the first dialog prompts if you want to delete; 	the actual files and directories in the file system. The next prompt you get is if you want to; 	delete the read-only resource project in the workspace (you also get prompted for all; 	the resources in the project if they are read-only also).; ; 	I guess the confusion comes from the message in the prompts? I too was fooled; 	the first time I ran this. At the very least; we need to update the messages in the; 	prompts (maybe add the words project or workspace resource; etc). Or maybe; 	we should change how this is presented to the user? (no ideas at the moment of; 	course).

Title: [UI] New File/Folder wizards dont filter \ character (1GF80YL)
Description: When using the new file/folder wizard; you can enter a name with a back slash.; ; Problems with new file wizard:; 1) entering abc\ for a filename and clicking finish will not create the file and give an error; 2) entering abc\xyz for a filename and clicking finish will create the file with no errors;; 	on the file system it actually creates a file xyz in folder	abc but will display abc\xyz; 	in the navigator); doing a refresh from local updates the navigator.; 3) entering abc\ or abc\xyz in linux will create the file and not display errors - this is legal in linux but we; 	should filter it out since resources may be shared with win32 users.; ; ; Problems with new folder wizard:; 1) entering abc\ for a folder name will create a folder abc on the system but display abc\ in the ; navigator; doing a refresh from local updates the navigator; 2) entering abc\xyz creates subfolder xyz within folder abc on the system but displays abc\xyz; 3) entering abc\ or abc\xyz in linux creates the folder without any errors - this is legal in linux but we; 	should filter it out since folders may be shared with win32 users.; ; ; NOTES:; JEL (12/06/2001 2:59:30 PM); 	All of the new project wizards & new java resource wizards filter out the \; ; NE (6/15/01 1:20:42 PM); 	Readme doc:; 99.1.1 New File and New Folder wizards accept \ in name; ; When creating a new file or folder; it allows the backslash (\) character in the name.  It should not.; On Windows; this can make the workspace inconistent with the file system.  A Refresh Local on the project will repair the inconsistency.

Title: Compare editor cannot be closed if editors were hidden (1GF80QM)
Description: - In Java perspective; click on Hide editors; - Select 2 files in Navigator and Compare with -> each other; - The compare editor that appears cannot be closed (missing cross button). The; cross button appears only if you maximize the editor.; ; The same happens in Team perspective when you compare on repositories.; ; NOTES:; EG (6/14/01 3:51:02 PM); 	cant reproduce the close box shows up; you have to scroll the editor tab to make it visible.; ; OC (14/06/2001 11:04:34 AM); 	Actually it only happens if you close all your editors before clicking Hide editors.; 	Sorry for this missing detail.; ; OC (14/06/2001 3:11:38 PM); 	Fabrice tried on his machine and reproduced it.

Title: Editor does not accept input even when file not read-only (1GF81GI)
Description: Select a file in the nav view; open its properties dialog and set it to be read-only; 	Open the file in an editor (I was using default text editor) and try typing...nothing happens; 	Select the file in the nav view; open its properties dialog and set it to be not read-only; 	Goto the editor and try typing - nothing happens still.; ; 	You have to close the editor and reopen again before it starts accepting input.; ; NOTES:; JEL (12/06/2001 3:07:54 PM); 	The opposite is also true; if you open the editor when the file is read-write you can type.; If you now set it to read-only you can still type; but if you try to save the file you will receive; an error and you will lose your changes.  The check for read-only should be done when the; editor receives focus not when the editor is opened.  Similarly to how the editor shows a *; prefix for dirty (unsaved) editors; perhaps the editor could show a (Read-Only) prefix for; read-only files.  This would likely shift the rest of the title over hiding it from view though.

Title: Unchecked boxes on Import ZIP Details are misleading. (1GF81YM)
Description: GPD (6/12/01 3:11:56 PM) ; 	Created this defect for John Sefler (Web Tooling tester); ; When importing files from a Zip file;; if I click on the Details button from the; Import wizard; the File Selection dialog first; opens with the root / directory selected (checked);; but the sub directories do not appear; selected (not checked).  However when I click; on the names of one of the sub directories; its contents; are checked.  Its misleading to me to only see; the root / directory checked along with all of the leaves;; but not see any of the branches checked.  Afterall; if I; click on the Select All button; then everything gets checked; as I would expect.; ; It seems to me the best default when this dialog; is first opened is for all to be checked. ; ; NOTES:; ; TC (6/12/01 3:10:33 PM) - this is the case as of build 118

Title: Usability: cannot drag detached view back into perspective (1GF85BA)

The only way to accomplish this is to go to the menu option; 		and select Perspective -> Reset.; 	; ; NOTES:; 	MF (6/12/01 4:25:23 PM); 		To reproduce: ; 		go to a Resource perspective. ; 		Close all view; except one. Close any editors. ; 		Detach the remaining view. and try to drag it back into perspective. Things are fine; you will get the black arrow indicating that you can drop the view.; 		Detach the view again. ; 		Now go to Perspective -> Hide editors.; 		Now try to drag the view back into perspective. Can not be performed.

Title: [OLE] Cant save bmp file unless it is dirty. (1GF9K87)
Description: Create a JavaProject; 	Create a bmp file; 	Change some thing.; 	Save the file. (It will have OK).; ; 	The save menu will still be enabled.; 	Try to save it again without changing anything. ; 	It will fail to save.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (6/15/01 1:34:46 PM); 	Readme doc:; 99.1.1.1 Error saving BMP file if no changes made; ; When a .bmp file is created or opened; by default it opens the Paint application as an in-place OLE editor.; If Save is chosen when there are no changes to save; it will give an error dialog saying it could not save the file.; No changes are actually lost; since none have been made since the last save.

Title: [Tasks] TaskList cell editor should be closed when tasklist is deactivated. (1GFJ52E)

Title: [UI] Context menus stop working when detached view is reattached (1GF9NE7)
Description: When a view is reparented; its context menu(s) are not reparented.; This causes them to get disposed and stop working when a view is created detached;; then reattached.; This is because the menus parent is actually the shell.  When a detached window is reattached;; the shell is disposed; which also disposes the menu.; ; For more details; see 1GF0ZJ6: ITPUI:WIN2000 - SWTException: Navigator; ; NOTES:; ; KH (9/19/2001 2:25:35 PM); 	SWT needs to fix this. ; ; 	This is our proxy for an SWT pr.

Title: Compare editor has local toolbar???? (1GF9P24)
Description: Select two files and do a compare on them. The compare editor opens in the editor area.; 	But note how this editor has its own toolbar! Why is it not using the main toolbar like; 	all editors are required to do? It would also save space because you could get rid; 	of the Text Compare title bar (including the tools); ; NOTES:; ; AW (18.06.01 15:13:42); 	Not the compare editor has its own toolbar; but one pane within it.; 	If you compare folders instead of files every pane has its own toolbar.; 	In your case you compare two files (and the files have no known structure) the compare editor shows only a single pane.; 	It would be possible to move the action from the panes toolbar to the editors toolbar.; 	However the same isnt possible when comparing folders (or files with known structure like Java files).; 	In this case every pane needs its own toolbar because it has specific actions.

Title: [UI] Help Context not found for global actions (1GFA1NO)
Description: With either the default text editor or the java editor; the global actions; (located under Edit) are all reporting help context not found.; These global actions delegate to their action handler for a context id.; Thus the handlers need to have an id set. ; However; the global action should not respond to F1 if the handler has ; not supplied a context id (or perhaps the global actions should ; have a default context id to use in this case).; ; NOTES:; ; 	RG (6/14/01 4:08:04 PM); 	Actually we are handling this correctly in code.; 	The reason we are getting a context not found message is that; 	We are missing all of the contents for the contexts defined in ; 	IAbstractTextEditorHelpContextIds.; 	I have emailed Greg regarding this; ; 	RG (6/14/01 5:17:32 PM); 	Karice will add the descriptions

Title: DCR: Show in Navigator doesnt appear during merge (1GFA382)
Description: The context menu action Show in Navigator doesnt appear in the menu during a merge.  It should.; ; NOTES:; ; JohnA (6/13/2001 5:38:49 PM); 	This is because; in order to find the navigator; I need access to the IViewSite; which editors; 	dont have.  No easy solution to this... CompareEditorInput should perhaps provide access; 	to the IEditorSite (which would also help us fix up the cut/copy/paste hacks we have).; 	Moving to Compare FW; but this is a future redesign item.

Title: [Welcome] Welcome: selectable text but no copy action (1GFBDM4)
Description: In the Welcome window you can select text with the cursor; but you cannot copy the text.  Also;; you can select disjoint portions of text.  Try selecting one section of text; then go to another part; and select that.; ; NOTES:

Title: Failing open with system editor should default back (1GFBF3C)
Description: If you try to open a file that does not have a system editor; you will get an error Unable to open; external editor for <file>.  If this occurs; the default editor should be reset.  Right now the editor; remains as the System Editor so double clicking on the file again will give the same error.; ; NOTES:

Description: Create a project with a folder and a file (if you do not have any).; 	Select the folder and go into.; 	Exit ; 	Start up.; ; 	> Navigator starts up using its initial input instead of the selected folder.; 	; ; NOTES:

Title: TextCellEditor.isSelectAllEnabled() is expensive (1GFBITI)
Description: TextCellEditor.isSelectAllEnabled() does text.getText().length.; This is expensive.; Its common to have Select All enabled even when the widget is empty.; Compare with Notepad and Windows Explorer.; ; Should change it to just return true.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] TextActionHandler should be removed (1GFBJC2)
Description: org.eclipse.ui.internal.TextActionHandler is no longer referenced and should be deleted.; ; NOTES:

Title: Change Rebuild All in navigator context menu (1GFBQG3)
Description: The Rebuild All navigator context menu entry is misleading.  It really should be Rebuild Project  with the same ; accelerator as in the Java packages view.  Note that the current message conflicts with the Project->Rebuild All ; menu entry which means rebuild all of the projects in the workspace.; ; NOTES:; ; NE (06/14/01 3:39:36 PM); 	Agree.  Should work the same as the packages view.; ; SA (6/14/2001 4:07:07 PM); 	Just my two cents having investigated this a couple of months ago...; 	(the agreement at the time was to leave things as they were); ; 	The term Rebuild All and Build have meaning to those outside of VA Java; 	land (those working with C++ and other Java IDEs that require you to compile); 	All of them know what these mean.; ; 	The problem is with the menu bar item Project which is supposed to; 	represent all projects in the workspace. In other words; menu items; 	in this Project menu are applied to all resources in the workspace.; ; 	What do the usuability studies say (from Julian)?; ; 	Also; what do you call Build action when auto-build is off? Build Project?; 	Now users are confused with Rebuild Project and Build Project.; ; EG (6/14/2001 11:02:17 AM)	; 	NE> Agree.  Should work the same as the packages view.; 	another difference is that in the packages view the build project; 	also shows in the menu when you select a child of the project.; 	It was found to be tedious to always select the project before; 	you can build it. This change is more than a wording change; 	but I wanted to mention it here.

Title: Empty menu in compare browser (1GFBQKE)
Description: Compare project with stream contents.; 	Right-click in the tree viewer in the compare view.; 	I got an empty menu.; ; NOTES:; ; 	KM (6/14/01 3:52:21 PM); 		On NT I just dont get a menu.; 		Is there supposed to be something in the menu? (not clear what we could allow someone to do here); ; 	JEM (6/14/01 4:14:24 PM); 		I think there is a convention like an item labelled <Empty Menu> or something like that if; 		the menu is intentionally empty.; 		; JohnA (6/14/2001 4:17:36 PM); 	This would be a compare FW PR.  VCM knows nothing about that menu.  I believe that menu used to ; 	contain our friends Copy selected nodes from left to right; etc.  I guess Andre decided to remove them ; 	completely. I thought he would remove them from the toolbar but leave them in the compare editor context menu.; ; AW (13.08.2001 10:54:44); 	From John A:; 	Hi Andre; from usability discussions; they thought the copy selected nodes from left to right buttons; 	in the structure view were confusing.  They really mimic the catchup/release menu items when in the catchup/release view.  ; 	Maybe they shouldnt appear in the structure view toolbar; but just in the context menu.; 	That way; I can exclude them completely from the catchup/release view. ; 	They would only appear in the context menu of other compare editors; where they make more sense. ; 	Currently there is a confusing array of operations for copying things from local->server and vice-versa; and it seems confusing.
