Title: [UI] Directory is not checked after I have selected it for import (1GFD7WK)
Description: 1. Select a project in the navigator; 2. Open the import wizard; 3. Chose file system; Next; 4. Press the top Browse; 5. It says Select the source directory; 6. Pick a directory an press OK; 7. Press finish; ; A dialog appears stating There are no resources currently selected for import; ; Why is the directory I have just picked not selected?; This is inconsistent with export where selecting a project in the navigator; and then opening the export wizard causes the project to be preselected for; export.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Minor - Navigator filters dialog confusing (1GFD8VG)
Description: Bring up the navigators view menu and pick Filters; The dialog asks the user to Select filters to apply and presents a list with two items; *.class; .*; ; 1. If I select *.class and press OK; my first expection was that I would see only; files with a class extension since they would match the current filter. Instead I see; just the opposite; .class files are filtered out.; Once I understand this then checking .* removes all files beginning with . as expected; The message at the top of the dialog should indicate that files matching the selected; filters will not be shown.; ; 2. How are my choices here determined? Is there any way to add to the list?; I think these are questions users will wonder about. It the choices are; static I think they would be better shown as two check boxes in a composite;; rather than in a check box list.; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR: Tooltip on compare editor to show full file path (1GFDACM)
Description: When comparing two files which happen to have the same name but in different folders or; 	projects; its hard to tell which is which. It would be nice is a tool tip would appear with; 	the complete file path when the cursor is over the file name (in the title area of each; 	compare pane).; ; NOTES:; 	JB (21/06/2001 5:22:41 PM); 		I agree that this is confusing but I think that we should show the full resource path; 		of each resource (or at least a disambiguating segment) rather than just a tooltip; 		so as to make the distinction all the more apparent.; ; 	SA (6/22/2001 9:36:53 AM); 		Even better - I agree! If however you can only show a segment of the path; then a ; 		tooltip with the full path would be useful.; ; 	JB (22/06/2001 10:56:35 AM); 		Makes sense.  We could just have a tooltip there all the time; then try to show as; 		much of the path as possible; using an infix ... so that the resource name is; 		visible; and at least the beginning of the path.  That should be enough most of the time; 		when comparing source files in packages with parallel structure.

Title: [UI] SEVERE: Problems with html files and Netscape (1GFDB2Z)
Description: - new simple project; - new file test.html; - it gives an error dialog saying: ; 		Netscape was unable to locate the server (no name specified).; 		Please check the server name and try again.; 	- sometimes the new file wizard gets redrawn over this dialog; so it looks like Eclipse has hung;; 	  and theres no way of hitting OK on the dialog.; 	- other times; the dialog appears behind all other windows; so it looks like Eclipse has hung;; 	  but if you find the dialog and hit OK; it comes back; 	- other times; Netscape crashes; causing Eclipse to hang as well; 	- Ive even seen it crash; then come back with the error dialog; and then Eclipse recover when the dialog is dismissed; ; - if you get the above to succeed; it opens Communicator on the empty .html file; and theres no way of editing it.; - close the editor; 	- Eclipse prompts to save changes; but no changes have been made (or can have been made; since its just the browser); 	- hit No; - open the file again; 	- you get the same behavior as on open; but usually it goes for case 2; ; 	  where the dialog is behind other windows but can be found and dismissed; 	- while the dialog is up; if you obscure Eclipse then bring it to the front again;; 	  it either does not redraw; or redraws very slowly (Ive seen both occur).; ; - if you exit and restart Eclipse with .html editors open; you can get the same behaviour on startup.; ; Also:; - with Netscape open on test.html in Eclipse; double-click on another html file in Windows Explorer; - it replaces the contents of the browser in Eclipse; but leaves the title as test.html; - theres no feedback that it opened in Eclipse; - the back button doesnt work (presumably because it got the error opening test.html); ; ; ; NOTES:; ; NE (6/15/01 11:25:59 AM); 	When Netscape crashes on open; the details are:; NETSCAPE caused a general protection fault; in module DDEML.DLL at 0002:00002139.; Registers:; EAX=00080000 CS=1697 EIP=00002139 EFLGS=00000206; EBX=0167032d SS=4d07 ESP=00008cfe EBP=00008d10; ECX=00010000 DS=168f ESI=00004d47 FS=4cd7; EDX=00000000 ES=0000 EDI=000001b8 GS=0000; Bytes at CS:EIP:; 66 23 44 1a 66 0b c0 75 1f ff 74 22 83 7e f8 01 ; Stack dump:; 4cd7018f 0000018f 00010008 000003a0 8d6460ce 01bf0028 00000001 c4140000 03a00000 22f2002d e248bff5 ffff7802 17f0ffff 12d700c6 00107800 12c00000 ; ; NE (6/15/01 11:27:29 AM); 	Maybe we should just bind html files (and related file types) to the default editor.

Title: Cant go back to OLE editor after editor explicitly chosen (1GFDBYW)
Description: - new workbench; - new simple project; - new file test.doc; - it opens an OLE editor using Word (or Wordpad if you dont have Office installed); - close the editor; - choose Open With / System Editor; - it opens Word (or WordPad) as a separate application; - you can no longer get it to open as an OLE editor; ; - same if you do Open With / Default Editor; ; NOTES:

Title: Save As... on OLE editor doesnt let you choose folder (1GFDCRE)
Description: - new file test.doc; - it opens Word or Wordpad; - choose File / Save As; - it gives you the rename prompter; which only lets you enter a new name; not choose a different folder; ; - Save As on an internal editor does let you choose a folder; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR: Compare editor features (1GFDD7X)
Description: 1) When comparing two directories it would be nice to have the filters:; 			show only the files that are only in the rigth side.; 			show only the files that are only in the left side.; 			show only the files that are different.; 			hide/show files that match specified patterns.; ; 	2) It would be nice to have a menu option to copy the file names to clipboard.; ; 	3) It could show bmp files the same way it should gifs (acualy it should show all ; 	image types SWT supports).; ; NOTES:

Title: Wrong icon used in showing action sets (customize dialog) (1GFDDP0)
Description: Open the Customize Perspective dialog. Click on the Other category;; 	then on the Readme Actions. Notice the icon displayed is not the coloured; 	one; its the one representing enable state in a toolbar (i.e. black & white).; ; 	Assuming you have the latest plugin.xml file and icons for the readme; 	example; you will notice the action set definition specifies the three; 	icons to use (enable; disable; and hover). If only the icon attribute; 	is specified; then swt will generate the disable and enable version; 	of the icon; but these look bad in low color res; especially on Linux.; ; NOTES:; ; SA (6/15/2001 3:56:49 PM); 	This is no longer the case as the plugin.xml was reverted back to its original; 	content. Only the color image is provided - so SWT gens the disable and enable; 	version of it...which on linux looks bad (and sometimes on windows too).; ; 	Why then do we have Linda producing these enable and disable images if; 	we are not using them?

Title: Very minor - Improve error message when part creation fails (1GFDMRH)
Description: When part creation fails; we open the pane with an error message; An error has occurred when creating this view; ; change to; ; An error occurred when creating this view; ; Similarly for editors change to ; ; An error occurred when creating this editor; ; NOTES:

Title: Help popup diff in each view? (1GFDNXT)
Description: I noticed the help popup for the standard component views we ship with; 	Eclipse UI is different - is there a reason?; ; 	For example; select the Task view and press F1. You get a help popup and; 	at the bottom is a down arrow. Click on it and a little menu appears with the; 	options Workbench Concepts; Workbench Tasks; Workbench References.; ; 	Now select the Properties view and press F1. You get a help popup and at the bottom; 	is 3 links - Workbench Concepts; Workbench Tasks; Workbench References.; ; 	Outline view says Context help not found (there is a PR for this; 	somewhere else); ; 	Navigator works the same as Task view; ; 	Repositories works like Properties view; but also has the down arrow button; 	but with nothing in the menu (why are we even display it then?); ; 	Bookmark works the same as Task view.; ; 	So which way is better? Using the links or the menu? Why is Properties view; 	different for its help popup?; ; NOTES:; ; SA (6/15/2001 4:00:29 PM); 	Looking more closely at the message; the one for Task; Bookmark; and Navigator; 	view seems to be some generic help message from the workbench. Meanwhile the; 	Properties view has a message related to the view itself.; ; 	Hopefully all this help stuff was sorted out in 0.125 build?; ; RG (6/15/01 4:35:57 PM);    	Task; Bookmark; and Navigator are doing it Correctly; 	Outline as you mention is currently missing its help contents ; 	1GF66A4: ITPUI:WIN98 - Outline has no help; 	It is also not using a context computer which would give it the geneic links but we are not going; 	to fix this for the beta.; 	The properties view is using a context computer but it uses to show help for the properties.; 	It could be modified to also get the generic help as well.; ; RG (6/15/01 4:57:13 PM); 	Actually the properties view is working correctly; it is getting the generic help.; 	The reason you are seeing differences is the different content and the way the help systems ; 	info pop deals with it.; 	We pass the help support system an array of context ids.; 	Each id maps to a description and 0 or more links; 	The help support system combines these into a single description and local links as well; 	as links that appear under the down arrow.; 	Suggest move this PR to ITPHELP to see if they can make their presentation appear more consistent ; 	for the various cases described.

Title: copy behavior when in rename mode is incorrect (1GFFE4P)
Description: *	Create a project & file; *	Select the file and choose rename from its popup; *	While the rename entry mode is showing pick Ctrl+C; ; It tries to copy file1.txt - it should be trying to copy the text.; See file explorer.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: next/prev arrows active when only one difference in compare (1GFIQX3)
Description: When there is only one difference comparing a file; the next and previous buttons are still active.; Since there is only the one difference; clicking on them does nothing.; ; NOTES:

Title: Minor: active editor is not updated properly (1GFIS9J)
Description: I.; When you select an open editor via the Navigator or Packages views; it will become visible; but not active.  This is probably the desired behaviour but the only problem is if you try; to do an editor action (such as Close) it will close the last active editor; not the current; visible one.  This can be a bit confusing but is not major.; ; Steps:; 1) create file abc; the editor should become visible and active; 2) create file xyz; the editor should become visible and active; 3) click on abc in the navigator; notice that abcs editor becomes visible but not active; 4) File > Close (or Ctrl+F4); xyz closes; you would have expected abc to close.; ; II.; When you do a drag-and-drop operation on an editor to split up the editors; the editor; is shown as active but the Close operation does not affect it.; Steps:; 1) create file abc; the editor should become visible and active; 2) create file xyz; the editor should become visible and active; 3) grab the title bar of abc and drag it to an edge thus spliting up the editor workspace; 	- do this in one action (do not select it before moving); 4) File > Close; xyz close; abc should have closed; ; NOTES:; JEL (19/06/2001 3:11:00 PM); 	from CloseEditorAction::run -> IEditorPart part = getActiveEditor();; could be changed to -> IEditorPart part = activePage.getEditorPresentation().getVisibleEditor();; This would tell the workbench to close the Editor that is being viewed instead of the last editor; that was clicked on.

Title: Selecting a window in the window menu does not maximize window (1GFITIC)
Description: STEPS:; 0. Minimize all your windows; 1. Go to any window and select the Window menu; 2. Pick any window; Notice that it only gets selected and not maximized.; ; This happens in Linux as well.; ; ; NOTES:

Activate Tasks view.; 3. Change filters to as above.; 4. Add task.  Notice how it applies to current editor input.; ; How do I create a task which is not associated with this file?; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Workspace in odd state after crash while loading. (1GFKO1Y)
Description: My machine crashed  (caused by IE; not eclipse) while I was loading several projects; 	from CVS. When I restarted eclipse; it complained that I was unable to re-load the; 	snapshot. I then exited and restarted. This time when it came up; there were no; 	complaints.; ; 	Because I wanted to get to a clean state; I attempted to delete the project which I had; 	previously loaded; but this failed giving the there were internal errors dialog. When I ; 	checked the details; it said that various entries in the project were out of sync with ; 	local storage.; ; 	I presumed that this would mean that; if I refreshed from local; I would then be able; 	to delete the project; but this also caused internal errors. Effectively; this means that; 	the workspace is useless.; ; 	When I checked the .log file; all that was in it was...; ; Log: Tue Jun 19 10:30:22 EDT 2001; 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 Exception in org.eclipse.ui.actions.RefreshAction. run: java.lang.NullPointerException; ; NOTES:; ; JohnA (6/19/2001 10:43:14 AM); 	Although a VCM operation happened to be in progress when the workbench crashed; the; 	errors he is seeing are platform core/UI problems.  Moving to ITPUI.  I will continue to; 	try the test case; it would be interesting to find out how the snapshot failed.

Title: Feature - would like a back button for navigating (1GFKOGH)
Description: When navigating in the Java UI; it is quite easy to loose focus on the current edited source (because selected a search result in the same unit for instance).; This is somewhat disruptive; and causing confusion.; ; I think that in most cases; it would be nice to offer a back button; restoring the previous editor state. ; Maybe also; it should be offered to open the selected item (search results or other) in a different view; like what web browsers offer as well.; ; NOTES:; EG (6/19/2001 9:46:08 AM); 	The editor management is controlled by ITPUI - moving

Title: Cannot copy from selected task (1GFKOMD)
Description: There is little you can do from a selected task; except navigating. It would be nice for example to be able to copy/paste from tasks.; ; NOTES:

Title: Dragging multiple views onto each other makes it impossible to move (1GFKVDM)
Description: STEPS:; 1) Drag a view to make it a window; 2) drag another view onto this new window; 3) Try and move these two views together (the new window); Impossible!  the dragged view tries to become a folder or a new window which is not what is desired.; ; ; NOTES:; ; KJD (6/22/2001 2:35:00 PM); 	Not impossible: in order to move it click and drag the empty space beside the tabs!

Title: Close project does not prompt to save work (1GFKVRR)
Description: Create a project P1; and a file F1.txt inside of it. Edit the file but do not; 	save. Close the project P1. Notice you are not asked to save your changes; 	Trying to save changes after the project is closed fails of course. Now you; 	have to reopen ;save; and then close the project again; ; 	If possible; before a Close project is done; any dirty editor on resources; 	within the project being closed should be saved (prompt the user to save ; 	the changes).; ; NOTES:

Title: [Navigator] Open/Close project not always available (1GFKW5S)
Description: Create two projects P1 and P2. Select P2 and close it. Now select; 	both P1 and P2. Notice the Open Project menu item is available but; 	the Close Project is not. Either both should be available or neither; 	one should be enabled.; ; NOTES:

Title: [GlobalActions] Problems with Desktop Save Model (1GFKW8X)
Description: GPD (6/19/01 1:38:52 PM): Created for Asahata-san; ; Page Designer has following Save menu items:; ; [File]->[Save]; ([File]->[Save As...]); [File]->[Save All]; [File]->[Save Frame]->[Save All Frames]; ([File]->[Save Frame]->[Save Frames As...]); ; These are the same items in Studio Classic and Homepage Builder;; and; in HTML frame editing mode; these items have following functions:; ; [File]->[Save] ([Save As...]);    Save a current focused html file only.;    (i.e. If the focus is in a child frame; only the child frame page will be saved.); ; [File]->[Save All];    Save all documents (The same as current eclipse.); ; [File]->[Save Frame]->[Save All Frames]([Save Frames As...]);    Save active editors  top frame and its child frames.; ; Note that [Save] and [Save All] save different files.; ; However; the eclipse framework call the same doSave() function; to both [Save] and [Save All].  Page Designer needs to distinguish these two menu item ; to support HTML frame file.  ; ; Implementing this would also re	quire the ability to specify the text that appears; on the save menu item so that we could tailor this to be only the active frame.; ; NOTES:

Title: DCR: Rename of a close project? (1GFKWIR)
Description: It would be convenient to be able to rename a closed project.; 	Currently that is not possible.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Workbench] DCR: Show plugin loading message in status line (1GFKWUA)
Description: To help make the wait seem shorter and emphasize lazy plugin loading;; we should show a message in the status line when loading a plugin; ex. ; Loading Version/Configuration Management UI...; Loading Default Help System...; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Info property page missing from project in java perspective (1GFL0XO)
Description: When you open the property dialog on a project in the java perspective;; it is missing the Info page; ; NOTES:; 	RG (10/2/01 4:56:05 PM) ; 	It has a java info page instead

Title: [UI] Active Editor with greyed Title Bar (1GFL1N3)
Description: Here is a way to make an active editor have a grey title bar:; 1) Open two editors; 2) Split them up (drag and drop an editor to the editing area boarder); 3) Activate one editor; 4) close the other editor by clicking on the X; do not activate it before hand; ; Now the open editor will be active; you can edit the file but the title bar is grey.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Import from zip progress bar inaccurate (1GFL1W5)
Description: The import from zip progress bar reaches 100% before importing all the files.; ; NOTES:

Title: Window lifecycle needed (1GFL2TW)
Description: From Eclipse Corner (6/13/2001):; ; It seems some obvious functionality is missing from IWorkbench. We need to; know when a new workbench window is opened or an existing one closed. For; example:; ; IWorkbench.addWorkbenchListener(IWorkbenchListener); ; IWorkbenchListener would contain; among other methods;; windowOpened(IWorkbenchWindow); windowClosed(IWorkbenchWindow); etc...; ; ; Ive found a workaround. However; this is very ugly and it would be great if; someone could give an estimate when real listener support could be added to; IWorkbench. Im adding a ShellListener to the current WorkbenchWindows; shell. When I get a shellDeactivated; I check to see what the; activeWorkBenchWindow is. If its not the original window; I know Ive got a; new one. Ive discovered I must do the check in an asyncExec; because at the; time shellDeactivated is called; the original workbench window is still the; active one.; ; NOTES:

Title: [UI] Cannot activate OLE editor on toolbar portion (1GFL5OX)
Description: If you click on an OLE editor to activate it; if you are clicking where the toolbar would be; (it is hidden from view when inactive) you will not be able to activate the OLE.; ; example:; 0) this example assumes bmps are associated to mspaint; 1) create any type of file dummy; 2) create a file test.bmp; 3) edit the bmp by using the paint bucket and filling the draw area in black; 3) split up the editors; 4) activate dummy; you should now see dummy active and the contents of test.bmp; 5) click to the left of the black contents of test.bmp (where the toolbar is hidden); ; Notice the ole is not activated.; ; Now click on the black contents; the OLE will be activated.; ; NOTES:; ; KH (9/17/2001 3:59:54 PM); 	Check again in latest build. SWT made changes.

Title: [Welcome] [UI] Scroll wheel doesnt work in welcome page (1GFLDCB)
Description: If you have a mouse with a scroll wheel; it doesnt work in the Welcome page;; even though it shows a scroll bar.; ; NOTES:; ; AW (20.06.01 09:38:16); 	I have a Logitech mouse with a scroll wheel. Under WinNT scrolling with the wheel works;; 	however it is pixel- not line-wise.; ; RG (6/20/01 8:47:00 AM); 	1GEPPPG: SWT:ALL - Welcome page: scroll wheel doesnt work; ; KH (9/19/2001 2:07:24 PM)	; 	SWT Team claims they have fixed problem with scroll wheel. Need to retry.

Title: Contents of Perspective>Open menu should not change (1GFMEUS)
Description: The contents of the Open>Perspective menu depend on the current perspective.; I find this confusing.; The contents of this menu should be above or independent of the perspective.; It leads to one of those you cant get there from here situations (I know there is always ; the other option).; This is modal ui behavior. ; The list of available perspectives should not depend on the current perspective.; ; NOTES:

Title: Cannot save editor when file has been deleted (1GFMK22)
Description: 1) Create a new file.; 2) Open an editor on the file; and dirty it (write something; but dont save).; 3) In the navigator; delete the file; 4) Go back to the editor; it says; The file has been deleted from the filesystem.  Save anyway?; 5) Hit Save.  It prompts for a folder and filename.  If you enter the same folder and filename where; 	it previously existed; you get an error:; ; 		Title: Save Problems; 		Message: Could not save file.; 		Reason: BClass.java does not exist.; ; NOTES:

Title: [Dialogs] Misleading error message in Save as dialog (1GFMK8Y)
Description: Edit a file.  From the file menu; choose Save As.  Type a character in the filename entry box.; The wizard now has an error message at the top that says The folder is empty..  It should say; something like No folder chosen. or more politely; Please choose a folder..; ; NOTES:; ; SA (6/20/2001 11:13:21 AM); 	Better yet; the folder field should be prefilled based on the container of the; 	resource being edited.

Title: [JFace Text] Undo text does not work in overwrite mode (1GFQH41)
Description: To reproduce:; 	Open a Java resource editor.; 	Make sure you are in Insert mode (its the default).; 	Select some text.; 	Type a couple characters to replace the selection.; 	Toggle to Overwrite mode (hit Insert key).; 	Undo.; ; 	Notice that the undone text changes are garbled.; ; 	I think Ive seen this happen in other scenarios as well; but; 	cannot recall at the moment exactly what they were.; ; NOTES:

Title: [PropertiesView] Usability problems in the property sheet (1GFMLV4)
Description: Gpd (6/20/01 11:47:44 AM):; ; Abstract : keyboard doesnt suit for editing attribute on Properties view; ; Problem Description : Keyboard doesnt seem suited for editing attribute on the Properties view.; Combination of Esc + cursor up/down are required every time when to move other attributes value besides just above or under; ; Misc. Information :;   Reported by :  Y. Yamanashi; ;   Date :  06/13/2001 (mm/dd/yyyy);   Frequency :  S  (Solid / Intermittent problem); ;   Environment :;     OS : Windows 2000;     Eclipse build : wsa-jdk-20010612_1330-107-107;                     wsa-jdk-20010614_1300-107-119; ; ;   Current implementation is ;;     1. clicking the property or its value makes the value is selected and editable;     2. esc key is required to cancel its editing mode;     3. up or down arrow key allow cursor movement to up or down by one line and the value; where cursor has just located on; is now editable.;         So multiple Esc + arrow key operation is required to edit the propertys value located far from the one where the cursor located first.; ;   On the other hand; on the ordinary spreadsheet application; like Lotus 123 or Microsoft Exel; or on the Explore of Windows; a user can  ;   move cursor only using up/arrow key to the place where a user wants to edit. Then a user presses some key; such as F2; to be able to edit that item.; ;   So at the point of the usability; keyboard should be more suited for editing attribute on the Properties view.; ; ; NOTES:; 	RG (6/20/01 3:40:06 PM); 	The select activates cell editor design has been present in the property sheet for; 	as long as I can remember. This is also the way the property sheet worked in the; 	VAJava VCE.; 	I understand that it is nice to be able to navigate through the properties using ; 	up/down without triggering an editor but this is a design change that we; 	should consider carefully.

Title: [UI] OLE editor kills accelerators (1GFMN3G)
Description: When using an OLE editor; all of the single-use accelerators associated with eclispse do not work; (such as alt-up; alt-down; ctrl-s).; The menu popup acceleartors still work however (like alt-f for file menu).; ; NOTES:; ; KH (9/17/2001 3:58:24 PM); 	Check again in latest build. SWT made changes here.

Title: [UI] Cannot give workbench focus after dragging out help view (1GFMOKF)
Description: 1. Close the help perspective if it is open; 2. Open the help perspective ; 3. Drag the help view onto the windows desktop (detatched window); 4. Click on the workbench titlebar; it refuses to take focus. The menu bar and; toolbar also refuse to work.; 5. Clicking on the shortcut bar does work and after that the other parts; of the workbench will take fucus.; ; ; NOTES:

Title: Editor save of file not refresh from local yet (1GFMQWJ)
Description: - create a project P1; 	- create a file F1.txt; 	- edit the file F1.txt and save; 	- leaving the editor open on F1.txt; go delete the F1.txt off your hard disk; 	- do changes in the editor and save; ; 	Notice you are asked for a file name and container location. Specify; 	P1 as the container and F1.txt as the file name. Press ok and you get; 	an error message saying the file F1.txt exist! ; ; 	True the resource F1.txt exist still in the Workspace (cause a referesh; 	from local was not done yet); but the actual file F1.txt is gone.; ; 	It just seems weird that when you ask to save it seems to know the file; 	is gone (thereby asking for a file name); but then complains it exist.; ; NOTES:

Title: Project compare should open viewing selected file (1GFMRP6)
Description: Compare a project or folder with stream resource.; 	The compare editor opens; and an item in the tree is selected; but; 	the left and right viewers are not visible. Re-select the item manually.; 	The left and right viewers appear and are populated.; ; 	Either the editor should not select the file in the tree; or it should; 	create and populate the left and right viewers when it does.; ; ; NOTES:; ; JEM (9/13/2001 2:47:13 PM); 	Compare bug. To replicate:; ; 	Proj1; 		+-folder1; 			+-file.txt; 		+-folder2; 			+-file.txt; ; 	Give file.txt different content in each folder.; 	Select folder1 & folder2. Compare with-> Each other.; 	The compare editor opens with file.txt selected; but no text editors are created.; 	Select file.txt again. The text editors are created.; ; 	Moving to JUI.

Title: Nav view refresh not visible in menus (1GFMSNL)
Description: In the Navigator view; you can press F5 to refresh the view. However;; 	this accelerator is not shown anywhere in the menus. We should; 	maybe add a menu entry to the views menu - something like; 	Refresh    F5; ; 	I think other views support some type of refresh when F5 is pressed; 	and should include a menu entry also; ; NOTES:; 	RG (6/20/01 3:33:48 PM); 	Similarly the property sheet supports F5; but there is no refresh menu or ; 	toolbar action.
